description:
Came here on a Saturday with a group of friends . It was crowded but not too much that you are touching elbows with other people . It was a fun place to be and it's spacious that makes a great place for a hang out that's not too stuffy. There's a bar on the left side or you can sit in the tables and have a waiter serve you. There are also arcade games , pool tables, and a bunch of other games for everyone to have fun and play with . TV screens everywhere as well. 

Overall, our group had a blast ! $27 for a pitcher of beer we ended up buying 3 . Definitely a place that I would come again.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Want a galore of tvs and no good view of those tvs to watch the game? 

Want to find a place to sit with your pregnant s.o. to watch the game, but cant because there are like 8+ guys lounging across a 4-top waiting for their other non-existent friends to show up? 

Want to order a bloody mary and be told you have to ask for promotional price ($7 ads everywhere) before hand after you get your bill?

Want a cocky bartender with a tear tattoo that obviously hates his job, but somehow is still in the business of making peoples experiences enjoyable? 

If you want all three or any of the above, than this place is for you! 

Btw, we really wanted to like this place. I eat tator tots like crack, but after the poor experience from getting drinks, we opted to go to Boardroom in North Beach to spend our usual Sunday spurge for football Sunday on more beers and eats.
author: Roman V.

description:
The Golden Gate Tap Room is located near the south east corner of Sutter and Powell just a block north of Union Square park.  

The actual place is a few floors up and at the ground level there's security checking for IDs and giving stamps to ensure age of majority was indeed checked before entry.  This place is definitely a sports bar as the identity leaves no ambiguity whatsoever.  Big screens showing games, video games, music, wings, beer and such give the place a life of a clubhouse type of hangout.

While I didn't feel like having any food I very well could have gone with something since they have options for small and larger sharing type plates.  You can get a small plate of wings or you can get a wing platter with different flavors.  Typical bar type food like burgers, sandwiches, etc are all on the menu here as well as an extensive drink menu with a full bar as well.

I wasn't hungry for bar food at the time so I did stay and sit at the bar for just a couple beers because after a long day of going all over the city a nice sit down drink or two was all I was looking for here.

I didn't see too many places like this around the area so this being one of the few or only one I noticed was filling a niche in the neighborhood I'm guessing.  Being that there are so many hotels in the area there's a lot of out of towners like myself just looking for this type of place in the area so it works out.
author: Lambert P.

description: Good sports bar , great beers on tap. Lots of beer on tap. Awesome games to play. Shitty cocktails, don't ever order cocktails here.
author: Madhu J.

description:
Solid place to watch the games. Don't let the website fool you as they open early for college and NFL football. Inside is a sports fans' dream with TVs and large screen projections all over the place. They have a mix of high tops, tables, and couches perched in front of the TVs. They also have a number of activities including skeeball, hot shot basketball, and a how hard can you punch game (there were probably others that I missed). 

The food was decent, albeit the portions were a bit small for what you paid and the beer was a bit pricey. The staff also seemed a bit preoccupied despite it being relatively slow.  Come here for the atmosphere and the great view for any game or sporting event, the food and drinks should be secondary to any of that anyways, right?
author: Evan P.

description:
This place is soooooo cool! 

I haven't been carded in a while so it felt good when security asked for my ID before letting me up. 

After walking up some steep tight stairs we made it inside and to the bar. I noticed a large beer menu hand written on wood along side of the beer menu is the cider menu. The well drinks aren't on the menu so be prepared to know what to ask for. I didn't and the bartender couldn't believe I was of age. LOL. She asked to see my stamp for verification. Sure. I know I'm old, I just had a few shots before getting here and am confused on what I want to continue drinking without hurling on your nicely cleaned floors. 

Margaritas it is. I didn't look nor taste like a real margarita but it made due for my state of mind at the time.

Ooooh look games! Ski ball and other arcade style games and games I've never seen or played before. COOL! 

Food? Yup, they got that too. I ordered the filet mignon skewers, smaller in size than expected, but very very tasty and well worth every bite. We also ordered some tots fully loaded with the bacon on the side (I haven't eaten pork in almost 10 years but the bacon looked fresh and thick, others enjoyed it). 

Overall I can't wait to come back! This place deserves 10 stars if I could.
author: Kyshia M.

description:
This is a perfect spot if you are huge sport fan and love arcades!  I just happened to be both so this is my go to if I want to watch a game, play some arcades, and have a drink or two with friends.  It's a little walk from my work, but it's a great location.  I have recently came here to watch the Warriors games and it was very nice.  My friend and I came here just before the huge crowd and got us a seat right on the bar.  We had the TV right in front of you and people are cheering and celebrating with the victory.  

This place has 3 floors. 2nd floor is where all the arcades is at.  There's TV and tables but it seem a little crowded to be sitting for dinner.  3rd floor: where more tables and seats and perfect to watch the game.  there are 2 pool tables and little bit on the arcade section in the corner.  so if you ever just wanna come here to watch the game or chill with friends.  3rd floor is where you wanna go.  

Their foods are decent.  I usually come here just for bar food, typical wings, fries, fried calamari, and popcorn shrimp.  they all seem super good with the beer.  Service seem to be great and on point.  

They get super busy during games and weekend. so plan accordingly.
author: Candice Y.

description: Came here from out of town on a Sunday to watch football because they show all the games. The food is solidly mediocre and they don't serve coffee. I asked if I could run to Starbucks and bring it in because they don't sell it, but they said no outside food or beverages allowed. Perfectly reasonable policy, but if you're going to open for breakfast make coffee available.
author: Michael B.

description: Gotta tell it like it is!  I popped in there yesterday because I was close and was hungry and the website makes you curious.  First of all there is a slow elevator or a trek up some rather steep stairs.  Once I got upstairs it was pretty empty and I was greeted by no one but the smell of sour bar rags and locker room/ feet smell.  Yuck!!  It was a little bit after lunch.  The place was pretty much empty.  So after I took a look around and shook my head, I left.  Listen up if you are gonna profess to be a bar and grill on Union Square clean that place up.  You are missing an opportunity to have classy people patronize your establishment.  The smell alone made me fearful of salmonella or food poisoning.
author: Pam P.

description:
This place is a lot of fun. Especially if you were in town and wanted to watch a sports game. They had an awesome beer selection, and their food menu seemed rather nice. They have a large area, and would be great for any sized group of friends. The bar was really clean, and the staff was friendly. 

I'm going to stop by for another beer the next time I'm in the city. 

Thanks for the great experience!
author: Jonathan H.

description:
I'm not really sure why GGTR doesn't have a better rating - it has everything I'm looking for in a sports bar, plus more! Awesome IPA selection at reasonable (city) prices? Check. Tons of TVs to watch the game? Check. Variety of fries? Definitely - regular, sweet potato, garlic, truffle, and tots! The clincher was the Skeeball; I freaking LOVE skeeball. 

My sister and I came during the Duke/Kansas game and the place was packed, but the bar service was  fast and friendly. The entire bar had ample open seating, though there were more than a few empty tables that desperately needed to be bussed and wiped down. My Dogfish beer was hoppy and cold just like I like it, and the basket of garlic fries with spicy aioli was AMAZING. Umm... did I mention they have skeeball? And if that's not your jam, there's also a pool table, shuffleboard, foosball, Pac-Man, Buckhunter, basketball, Goldentee, some Marvel Street Fighter-esq game, and probably a few others that I'm forgetting. Either way, if you're not entertained here, you need to take a long hard look at where you went wrong in life.
author: Justine L.

description:
This is a cool spot to bring a date or some friends to play pool, shuffleboard, other arcade games (including mini basketball shootout), or just watch the game!

They had a pretty good draft beer list, plenty of TVs, and plenty of seating!
author: Michael K.

description:
Never tried the food so I can't comment on the quality. 
And I don't do reviews frequently. 
But we sat at the table for 20 minutes without being acknowledged. Had to find a server. 
She came over 5 minutes later. Without menus. She had to go find some so we could place an order. 
We ordered beer and water, and told her we would be ready by the time she got back with the beer. 
25 minutes later, she had served every table in the joint without even making eye contact or coming by to say she'd be back. 
After over 50 minutes, we still did not have our beer or water. 
We went next door and are now spending our money somewhere that deserves our money. 
09/02/18 7-8:00 pm.
author: Gary G.

description:
The sour beer was my favorite. 

The food was just ok. 

I can see why people like this place. 

I do not. I prefer Richmond Republic. 

What I do like about it? After shopping around Union Square this is a good option for cold beer and greasy bites.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
I'm not sure how they can call themselves a sports bar. People are here for one reason (and it's definitely not their food).. or their service which is god awful. 
Football Sunday and the TVs are a disaster. Golf and informercials.. ?
author: Ashley H.

description:
This place has been on my list of places to try for a while. Came here on a Friday night right before 8pm and it was busy but still plenty of space to sit and play games if you wanted to. The ambiance is very casual, which is great if you're looking to grab a beer or cocktail after after work and hang out with friends. They also have cool games like basketball, shuffleboard, and pool. Awesome place to kick it and relax.

Wide selection of beers, from Hefs, IPAs, lagers, porters, stouts. You can also get pitchers to share with others as well. I've tried their carne asada fries - now if you're looking to order carne asada fries for authenticity or super great taste wrong place but for casual drinking to get some food down your stomach, they were pretty good. Fries were crispy and they didn't skimp out on the toppings like guac and meat. Got the job done of satisfying drunchies. 

I would definitely come back if I was in the area to unwind after a long week at work!
author: Andrea F.

description:
REVIEWER # 744

This place is HUGE! (Yup, that's what she said)!

If you are staying in the Powell area, this place is a MUST! I've been meaning to come check this place out and finally had the chance to do so over the weekend. Golden Gate Tap Room is one of the coolest sports bars in SF! They are one of two main craft beer halls that I had on my list; this place can easily be overlooked but once inside its massive.  I came here on a Saturday night with a couple friends and we were amazed to see how big this sports bar is. They have two levels

The upstairs level feels like you just stepped into an upgraded adult 'Dave and Busters' with big screen TV's; perfect for watching any of the games, hoop, pinball, group Pac Man and pool tables! There are tons of seating and perfect for coming here with a group. The atmosphere was great! They have a lot of draft beer and an extensive menu. I didn't eat any of the food but the portions were big and it looked tasty. Next time I plan to order: popcorn shrimp, truffle fries, and Blue Moon Chicken nachos; YUM! 

The bar selection is massive, (Hello, Drinkers!), serving everything you could think of. The drinks here are UH-MAZING! I ordered a long island-trust me, it was really stiff! I would have to come during happy hour to check this place out until 6 PM.  Make sure you arrive early to get a good seat, there's tons of seating (but they fill up quickly), and many floor levels to choose from; come check this place out!
author: Porsche C.

description: Opening night for NBA, and only one hard to see TV on each floor. Not much of a sports bar, it's a baseball bar.
author: Chris T.

description:
I've been trying to stay away from writing reviews about bars lately since I'm trying not to appear like an alcoholic, however GG Tap Room deserves a shout out. Been here a few times for drinks after work and have always enjoyed the experience. The bouncers at the door have always been friendly and not pretentious like other spots. The bartenders have always been very quick and efficient, and I have never once been ignored while standing at the bar to order a drink. And the waitresses have all been pretty good about occasionally stopping by our tables to clean up empty glasses and take orders. 


Plenty of TV's on the 3rd and 4th floor to watch whatever game happens to be playing (or reruns of games), and some arcade games (skee ball, pac man, basketball hoop, punching machine, foosball) and pool tables on the 3rd to pass the time. Plus if you're counting calories, you can just walk up and down the winding stairs a few times to burn off those drinks that you just consumed.
author: Alex C.

description:
The absolute worst bartender I have ever encountered.  Poor attitude, unprofessional, seemed to hate his job.  Treated multiple customers with a very negative attitude.  If I owned or managed the establishment, I would terminate him immediately.
I will never return to Golden Gate Tap Room.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I wouldn't even have tipped the waitress last night only thank god she didn't have my credit card on file. Not a please or thank you out of her. She acted like she was doing us a favor by being there and serving us. 
Not to mention she left a puddle of water on the floor didn't bother to clean it up. Never gave us a glass with our bottles or cans and waited at least 20 min before we got our beer.
ATTITUDE ADJUSTMENT NEEDED!
author: Lauren M.

description:
Visited last Sunday for brunch, we missed the time available ( noon). Lady, Asian Server was very curt, not hospitable .  We ordered a hamburger and she offered an egg on top. 
We asked can we just get 2 scrambled eggs since you are offering on lunch menu. And a hamburger, she checked but Chef was in- accommodating... odd. 

Her service was poor, we had to go to bar from our sears for condiments and forks to eat. 


Manager walking around but didn't check in ...
author: Freida O.

description:
It's probably one of the most common pain points in almost any company...MEETINGS.

Clearly, they aren't all bad and/or pointless.  It's just that the gratuitous and unproductive ones come up far more often than they should.  No, I don't need to hear my 8th different boss talk about the new coversheets for our TPS reports (love Office Space!).  I get it - I had my fair share of those at my old company.  Though, we did have some awesome ones as well, like that one offsite, inter-department, cross-functional operations and team strategy meeting...

...where we snuck off to Golden Gate Tap Room to watch some Champions League soccer, eat, grab some drinks, and play some games.  Team building, amirite?  #sorrynotsorry

Although I had heard about this place quite a few times over the years, I never really knew much beyond how it's an uber popular spot to catch just about any sporting event.  And now that I can say I've been here, it's easy to see why!  They have TONS of beers and alcohol to choose from, it's fairly spacious (there are multiple floors), and there are TVs and projectors in every direction!  Plus...there's plenty of food!

Regardless of your dietary preferences, you can find just about anything to eat from their list of bar bites - chicken wings, ribs, carne asada fries, tacos, nachos, quesadillas, potato skins, pot stickers, spinach dip, truffle mac n cheese, skewers, jalapeno poppers, calamari, mozzarella sticks...do I need to keep going?  Sadly though, despite how tasty a lot of their stuff sounded, I ended up settling for their FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH ($14) since none of my coworkers were in the mood for appetizers (boooo...).

As a whole, this wasn't too shabby!  The chicken is coated with either BBQ or buffalo sauce (I chose the latter) and topped with coleslaw, bacon, and Swiss cheese on a French roll alongside your choice of fries (I went with truffle fries).  While I didn't care much for the French roll (a little dry and bready), everything else was solid!  The chicken was juicy with a slight kick, the bacon was crispy, the cheese was just slightly melted, and the fries were terrific (loved the dip!).  Yum!

Besides how the food was pretty decent, as well as the huge beer list, Golden Gate Tap Room just simply has a fun vibe to it.  If the food, TVs, and alcohol aren't enough to keep you entertained, there's a whole variety of games to play, including shuffleboard, foosball, skeeball, pool tables, pinball machines, and arcade games.  Throw in some random ticket games and it'd be like being at D&B, but without those obnoxious prices and crowds!

While it was a breeze for us to snag a table (middle of the workday and all), I hear it can get super packed here during major sporting events, like World Cup matches or playoff games.  In those cases, coming early would be strongly recommended, especially if you want a table.  Otherwise, in between, this is definitely a great spot to spend a night with friends or to play hooky with coworkers!

I mean, to attend offsite, inter-department, cross-functional operations and team strategy meetings.   Yeeeaaaahhh...
author: Mike L.

description:
I ordered a burger from here. It was pretty expensive for what it was. It wasn't very good and was pretty expensive. They also added mayonnaise even though I explicitly told them I didn't want any. The fries were good and plentiful which kind of made up for the okay quality burger which was also a little small. 

The thing that did impress me was their selection of the brews on tap. It was a great selection! They also had many games for people to play. I went when it was the middle of the day so it was not even 5% full.
author: Nico M.

description:
I was excited to come here during our trip to San Francisco to watch the final NFL games of the regular season and try some fun craft beer. It is a pretty cool spot with decent TV's, a wonderful selection of draft beer and fun games to play. The food is just average and we never really had a server. I had to walk back and forth to the bar for everything we ordered.
Not a huge deal but the place does have servers- none of them waited on us though. 

When I got the tab- it was a bit steep for what we had- $75 for 3 beers, 2 mimosas and two egg dishes. Still a fun experience overall but I am sure in an awesome city like San Fran there are better sports bars.
author: Amy L.

description: This place has one of the worst service staff and managers.  Tge dumbass staff couldn't find my card twice.   If this place was in los angeles they would have closed down in 1 week.  Service staff i would rate -10 the only thing they got going for them is the big screens. That is it.  If this was my staff and manager they would all have been fired.   No service at all.   I will be posting this on my blog and IG of 3 million followers to see.  Maybe than the ownership will wake up and make the people work harder and nicer.  When you are spending money you dont want people being rude and shirty. As the owners of this place I hope they are happy with their 3 half stars
author: David S.

description: I'm not into sports, but I am into beers, friendly bartenders, and Star Wars pinball...and this is where the Bachelor party began.  Beers run from $6-12+, which is reasonable by San Francisco standards. I was having trouble deciding between two different sour beers, but luckily the handsome young bartender gave me a generous tasting pour of each one. Thanks bro!  Maybe he thought I was cute? Unlikely...he was just a nice guy. In another lifetime, a mirror universe, I might have slipped him my phone number.  We would've adopted kids...,got a house near Golden Gate park...I digress...I'm married...I need to put an end to this review...
author: Chun P.

description:
good selection of beer, they have a big space for groups. the stairs are a bit old but besides the point. the interior gives a chill/cool vibe. they have pool tables and a basket ball hoop for 2. great if you have in the competitive mood.

They have a great selection of food. i tried the curry tater tots. it comes with a side of dipping sauce that has a great flavor of curry seasoning. if you are not a curry fan or a heavily spiced individual pass on it. the wings are also flavorful and worth a try.

there were a couple of kids inside while there parents were drinking on a Friday.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Sunday mornings gets crowded fast. Good food good drinks. Only issue, even though they have lots of tvs i was only able to see 2 games. Most tvs were playing same games. Great 0lace though
author: Joe W.

description: I've eaten here before and had good food, but recently went here and waited a really long time to get 2 entrees and an appetizer. Plus they served it all together not the appetizer first which was weird. The food didn't seem very hot when we got it. We never got refills on our drinks and it took forever to get our waitress to bring the bill. Didn't seem busy enough for this to cause all these issues either.
author: Lauren J.

description: Spacious bar with some games I would typically see at Dave n busters. Only complaint I have is the bartender who said that I never opened a tab with them. Which means they had lost my ID AND CC. Thankfully, a waitress was holding onto it because we had ordered from our table a few drinks before I wanted to close.
author: David T.

description:
Decent place to hang out with a group of coworkers or friends. Huge space and plenty of seating.

Service can be pretty slow, but that's expected if you have a large party! It's not a great dinner place, but perfect for drinks and snacks. I'd recommend the mozzarella sticks, popcorn chicken, fries, and wings!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Good beer, great food and awesome service! 

Went here tonight for a company get together and everyone was happy. It's a great place to wind down after work, play some pool and have some awesome conversations!
author: Lovejit K.

description:
I have really warmed up to Golden Gate Tap Room since I moved to the city a year ago. I like its location for when I'm downtown after work looking for a fun spot to get a drink, but to be honest, I LOVE how massive and comfortable it is inside with its vast beer selection and diverse selection of activities like shooting hoops, Skee-ball, playing shuffleboard, arcade games, or just drinking and watching sports on its dozens of huge screens.

My past impression of Golden Gate Tap Room was that it was just a crowded tourist spot by Union Square (which is true) or as the place that charges $10-20 cover fees during Warriors playoffs game to lines that wrap around the block (which is true) or as a place for hundreds of drunk Santas to congregate during SantaCon (which is true).

However, no matter how true these things are, it really is a great bar and unlikely any other in (for its sheer size and location) in San Francisco. Visiting it during off-peak times has consistently yielded me enjoyable experiences!

Even the bouncers are really cool. I had a friend who was asked to leave for being too drunk and rowdy. Surprisingly, instead of forcibly, physically escorting him out, they actually let him walk over to his group and say goodbye before going.

Overall, great bar with huge floor space, tons of seats, big beer selection, and fun things to do. Just avoid it during popular events.
author: Phillip V.

description:
Well if the metal detector at the entrance doesn't throw you off, then you might be pleasantly surprised by the size of Golden Gate Tap Room and the wide variety of beers on offer. 

You wouldn't think the bar is that large from the ground but up a couple flights of stairs, you'll find ample space for large groups having post-work happy hour. Lots of beers on tap and you can get them by the pitcher. If you're feeling adventurous, have the bartender spin the wheel and see you end up getting. Food is pretty straightforward pub drub like chicken tenders and such. Have a game of shuffle board or watch the game live while you're at it. 

Not a bad spot to grab a pint while in Union Square. It does feel like a chain so more generic character. Crowd can be 50/50 which makes it more of a novelty stop than a regular watering hole.
author: Jon L.

description: This is the place you want to come to if you want to watch a game. The place is two floors with big screens TVs every where. Came here with some friends on a Saturday around 6 and the place was pretty packed with people watching college football, every where I looked I could see the game. This place is clean, lots of tables, video games and if you're a beer drinker there lots of beer on tap.  Did not get a chance to try none of the food here or look at the food menu cause I just came to have one drink and check the place out. I will be back to hang out catch a game.
author: Dennis T.

description:
Great place to catch the game! It's a huge place with lots and lots of screens . It's kind of hard to find a table , you have to just get lucky . And it's hard to order food until you have a place to sit so don't go super hungry... Food is pretty good - better than you would expect. Bar tender not really friendly and beer in the 2nd round was not as cold as i'd like but I don't blame them - with the number of people in there it must be hard to refrigerate so much beer!

Place felt much warmer than outside possibly due to the number of warm bodies but good vibes all around!
author: Anju J.

description:
Came in on game day. Totally forgot there was a football game on when we entered. First off the place is awesome 3 stories of beer food and party. Ended up with my group in the bar on the 3rd floor. Their screens are massive. 5 walls of projection and several smaller sets letting everyone have a view of the game. The food smelled delicious and every plate that was carried by made my mouth water. 
Ended up ordering the Vanilla Oat stout, and a pulled pork sandwich with jalapeño poppers. Top notch on every account. The food was delicious. No other word better describes it. The poppers perfect, beer smooth. Stouts not your thing? Don't worry they have a WALL of taps and dozens more bottles to choose from.

My ONLY complaint is the lack of couple tables. Leaving several of the group tables half full with two people cutting back on seating for new or late arrivals. Or lack of policing the groups that are already finished. 

Less my complaint 5 stars all the way.
author: John O.

description:
What a fun find. This was across the street from our hotel and we gave it a random try. 

Up the shaky, creaky spiralling stairway (looked like a street level dive from outside) into...a big brightly lit room, windows on two sides (it's on a corner upstairs!, midblock at street level), with lots of TV's, couches and various seating ootions, and lots of bar games. Great beer selection, pretty good games (some a little tired), clean bathrooms (that's a treat in SF) and very 9ers and Dubs centric. 

If I get back to try the food might get a 5th star. Ack, just read about review... apparently we missed a whole floor of fun
author: Kirk M.

description:
My friends and I came here for Game 2 of the NBA Finals. The game was at 5P and we came over around 4:20P, and the bouncers said standing room only, plus a $10 cover charge. We paid the cover and walked in, and I expected it to be like club-level crowded. Instead it was more of a casual bar scene leading up to the game, with groups of people hanging out at the bar or around tables. 

It definitely got a lot more crowded as the game went on but we managed to snag a few chairs that were unoccupied at various tables, and eventually we collected enough chairs for our whole group to set up shop in front of the big screen. 

We ordered French fries (5.00), jalapeño poppers (5.00), and a Magner's (5.00). The first time around, everything came to our table fairly quickly (about 25 minutes, but quick considering how packed it was). The second time around we wanted to order more appetizers, and one of my friends went up to the bar to place his order. Two hours later our appetizers still didn't make it to the table, and the waitress wasn't too friendly when we asked her to check on our order. I understand that it was extremely busy, but we were frustrated that the waitress kept checking on the other groups around us, either refilling their orders or bringing the bills to their table, all the while telling us there's nothing they could do if our order isn't ready. 

This was a fun place to watch the game and the crowd was passionate and energetic, all of which made for a fun viewing experience. Based on the poor service, however, I'm unlikely to come here again.
author: Mili P.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Golden Gate Tap Room to catch a game, but the timing was never right. Finally last Tuesday, May 2nd, I ended up here with Peter L around 8:45pm. They were carding at the door, so I guess you have to be 21+ in order to get inside. We did a couple of laps on both floors and ended up finding a table on the second floor after a couple left.

*Blue Moon Nachos ($5), add Chicken (+$3): house made tortillas topped with special cheese, bacon, scallions and chopped tomato
*Popcorn Shrimp ($9): panko crusted and fried served with cajun mayo
*Flame Grilled Burger ($12): tomato, lettuce, onion, and mayo with cheddar cheese
*Allagash White: allagash brewing company (portland me) witbier 5% abv ($7)
*Red Trolley: karl strauss brewing co (san diego ca) red ale 5.8% abv ($7)

I actually tried ordering two other beers before I settled on the allagash white. I guess they were all out of the other two which was a little disappointing. At least Peter got his first choice. The food itself was okay. I guess just normal bar food. Nothing special about any particular dish. But if I was throwing back a bunch of beers, I'd be glad they were offering food like nachos, popcorn shrimp, and a burger. It's good having food to sop up all the alcohol.

The main reason to come here is all the TVs! I think every seat has a good view of at least one TV. Luckily, we were in front of the huge screen with three TVs screens on display, so I had a great view of two screens. Could look left or right and see the game. I'm not sure if they play different games simultaneously, but that night, they were just playing the Warriors game.

Glad I finally stopped by to catch a game. I actually wanted to show up earlier to check out happy hour, but Peter wanted to visit a different bar. (Which ended up being closed by the way, so I should stop listening to him!) I'll probably be back to catch another game. And hopefully, HH as well!
author: Elena N.

description:
The crowd and location are a bit dodgy, but the place had a ton of great beer and food selection. Also, it was very reasonably priced. We went to grab drinks and some bar food after a work event. Had a selection of wings and other snacks and I thoroughly enjoyed everything I tasted. The carne asada fries were excellent! I must have had at least a dozen wings from our party platter. They were well cooked and just the right amount of spice which matched nicely with a cold beer. 

There was pool and pinball and big buck hunter to enjoy. My only complaint was that both of the shuffleboard tables were taken by groups that weren't actually using them, so we couldn't play. 

The service was extremely kind. Our bartender came over to make sure things were going well and also kindly brought us some bar towels to help us clean ourselves up after our wing extravaganza. I'd definitely go back for a little after work relaxation or to watch the local sports team compete against our much hated rival sports team.
author: John W.

description:
I've been coming to this place for the past 5 years !!!!
Every time my server is on point ...
Today I decided to order at the bar, what a disappointment, I simply ordered chicken wings , and they either lost my ticket or I don't know what happened , 40 minutes pass by and no food ..
I asked the bartender two times for it , the kitchen staff came by and asked what had I ordered , since they saw me standing for a long time with a number !!
I asked for a refund and the bartender just gave me the amount of the platter , I tipped him good he gave me just a sorry and he was out !!
It's not about the tips , it's about the principle !!
I basically tipped for nothing !!
author: Marco C.

description:
Came here on Santacon with a few friends and we had a decent time. 

Pros: Large space that accommodates a lot of people. Great place to watch games and play games. Service was fast despite the amount of people that were there. Good food! 

Cons: sticky floors, you have to pay for the games, hard to find tables, no one cleans up the tables
author: Christina P.

description: Best in town! Great huge beer selection, excellent food, staff is down to earth and cool. My hotel was right around the corner so I walked down to take a chance on something I hadn't tried in the city. An excellent surprise! Will be back next time for sure!!
author: J F.

description: Went here with a group of friends and had a great time!  Fun atmosphere with various games to keep you entertained throughout the bar. Drink and food prices are fair, considering you're in San Francisco.  The food itself was ok.  We ordered a few appetizers to share. I'm usually a big fan of calamari and tend to order it whenever it's on the menu.  Unfortunately of everything we ordered that was my least favorite.  It was over cooked, over breaded and tasted greasy.  If I was rating food quality only, I would have given this place a 3 star.  But factoring in the location and atmosphere I feel a 4 star rating is more appropriate.
author: Brant G.

description: We came here on a Friday and Saturday night. We sat at the bar and made good conversation with the bar tenders both nights. The wings were good, the carne asada fries were amazing. The Cesar salad lettuce was discolored. Fun sports atmosphere with lots of game and tv screens to watch any game on. They had an amazing beer selection!
author: Lindsey V.

description: Great variety of beer, fun environment but service was ok. Not a bad place for what it is.
author: Kenny K.

description:
This review is around their timeliness in returning your emails/calls when TRYING to plan an event for Corporate gatherings.

Do you guys know that no one answers your phone during business hours? Atleast thats the case  for the last 3 days I have been trying to call. 

I submitted a request to have an event at GGTP and after a Word Document that talks about HH prices (but doesn't say what they are) I clearly had questions. After asking for some clarification (twice), I have still not received a spot.

So can the manager of Golden Gate Tap Room please stand up (Kevin H) and tell me whats your guys problem? Do you guys not want to host parties?

Clearly you guys dont know what you are doing if you just check other requests regarding your events: (Lewis F) on 1/9/2017 or my favorite from (J B.) 9/28/2017.
author: Joseph Rebelo R.

description:
Came here to watch the Sharks game as this bar surfaces as a top 3 Google result for "best bar for Sharks game in SF".  Despite having 30+ televisions, I was scoffed at by a female bartender with tattoos and dark hair for requesting 2 TVs to watch the Sharks game because there was also a Warriors "playoff" game that night.  Uh... hello... it was also a "playoff" game for the Sharks, and there were a couple other groups inside wearing sharks gear aside from ours.  We all ended up huddling around one TV, despite multiple other TVs being left unattended by standard bar folk just in for beer and food.  

If this place is going to strictly dedicate all 30 televisions to the Warriors game then I suggest they market themselves accordingly so that anyone wanting to support other Bay Area playoff teams won't be disappointed coming in.  Safe to say I won't be bring my money back to this place, and will make an effort to spread the word on the disdainful service and sour attitude I received here.
author: Stephen A.

description:
I've been here a few times and I thoroughly enjoy my experience (with the exception of some rowdy customers during certain nights). The venue is relatively big with pool tables, basketball machines, etc. There are large TV screens around the room for sport fanatics. The drinks are affordable and they do both beer/hard liquor. 

The bathrooms get really dirty towards the end of the night - I guess people get kind of ratchet after so many drinks. Parking around here is impossible so I would recommend Lyft.
author: Chariya S.

description: In the women's washroom there is a scale, right as you walk in that says "have you gained or lost weight?" Is this really something that women need to think about while out with friends on a Friday night? In today's world of body issues/ eating disorders, this seems extremely inappropriate and unnecessary.
author: Katey V.

description:
Game day? yeahhh, this is the place.
Great beers, big screens and fan vibe. It gets very loud (cheers!)
Fast and friendly service. I usually get some fries and sides, they're pretty good. It also has fun games to play. Good location.
author: Vicky D.

description: This place is extra amazeballs for being located in a busy, busy area of SF! I'm shocked such a place exists! 3 floors high! We were here for the World Cup game and it was sensational. Lots of room. I was very nervous because we waited in a long line that wrapped around Walgreens/7/11 and then some. There was a $5 cover but that was fine :) filters out the cheapies. jk. So the rooms had multiple large projector screens, which is great! It helps when you're 5'3 on paper and are standing behind a large man. There's lots of beers on tap and they have this fun spin the wheel ordeal where you pay $7 or so and spin for your luck on drinks. They have lots of games and entertainment.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Horrible customer service at the bar on the 3rd floor I mean dude walks around like life sucks well I really don't care what's going on but when people are there maybe you should keep your personal issues at home. 

The food, the menu says it has this and that and when it comes out it's blah! Blue moon nachos I ordered with beef came with no bacon nothing it said would have! 

Sf chicken sandwich doesn't list onions but it sure came with even when I told the bartender no onions smh

My girl and I left after an hour and only one drink because of the attitude
author: Ed J.

description:
This place is great to throw birthday parties. I recently threw a birthday party here for my boyfriend and I called in because my boyfriend sister baked him a cake and would like to bring it into the venue. They were able to accommodate the cake and put it in the fridge for us.

Great place to play games with friends, drink and have fun.  They have pretty cheap drinks here. The food is okay, but I wasn't expecting it to be spectacular. It is bar food.
author: Kimberly D.

description:
Many stairs but lots of nice decor along the way. It's a great place to watch a sports game. Most of the seats are usually taken but there always seems to be one just available for you. It's not that clean.

People are friendly and willing to chat with strangers. 

The drinks and the price are average. Come here for the atmosphere. 

There is also a skee-ball machine I wanted to play with every time I'm here but someone is always using it. 

Despite my rating, I always come here to relax before embarking on my San Francisco nightly adventures.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
I'm usually here for Warriors games and depending on the game, the place can be pretty packed. However, today, the first Playoff game for Warriors was pretty empty. They didn't even need to open up the 3rd floor. 

The 2nd floor has many TVs and arcade games, kind of like Coin-Op Game Room (but without TVs) on 4th and Brannan Street. The 3rd  floor has a huge screen and we usually like to stay there to watch games. However, when it's less crowded, they don't open that floor. 

The place has many beer choices and bar food. You can order them from a bartender. The food service today was slow. We ordered Fried Calamari and it took them 30 minutes to bring it out and it was cold. Also be sure to check the charges. We were overcharged for a drink today. 

I'm sure I'll be back here and hopefully the slow service was just a fluke.
author: Alice L.

description: I love coming to Golden Gate Tap Room to watch basketball games. It can get pretty crowded but if you can find a seat, it's great! Good food, so many different TVs, fun games and great drinks!
author: Lillian B.

description: I just had a horrible experience at this place (I am writing this review in the bar). It has a nice choice of beer and hard drinks, but the service sucks and the food was barely adequate. There are a lot better places in SF.
author: Ed F.

description: Horrible customer service. Only had one bathroom available for the entire building which had shit and vomit all over it. When asked to use the upstairs bathroom I was threatened by security that I would be kicked out. Fuck  the security guards and fuck the staff for not doing anything about it.
author: Carson T.

description:
Solid place in downtown to grab drinks, play games, and of course watch your local sports. Since it is downtown it's easier to walk or take public transportation to this spot. When you walk through the door don't be surprised to find a few flights of stairs waiting for you. Once you reach the top it's a decently large location with tables and couches to sit. 

We came around 5:30PM on a weekday and it wasn't that bad to get seating but it was already pretty packed. Ordering food was easy but service was slow. We saw our drinks sitting by the bar for a good 10 mins before the waitress brought it to our table. 

Nachos & fried shrimp are great options to share. The nachos are mainly covered with cheese out of the can, but the meat was decent. The shrimp was also great since they weren't oily and the covering light and crispy. They were enough to share between 3 people and each one feel full enough. 

I really enjoy how interactive this place is but it does get loud with all the music and when games are playing so you might find yourself having to lean in to hear the conversations.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
I first visited Golden Gate Taproom for a friend's birthday. This touristy spot has a great selection of beer at tourist prices. I love love love the games, which are always in use, so be patient or bring a group of friends to help lay claim. Games include skeeball, hoops, pool, pinball, group PAC man, and Golden Tee. 

Recently I visited the restaurant only portion, which I didn't even realize existed. I had a delicious burger with fries.

Unlike its hipster counterparts like Brewcade, GGTR is for sports enthusiasts. There are giant screens everywhere playing every sport imaginable. Highly recommend this place for a nice cold beer, while watching a game. Just be aware of the crowds!
author: Joanna S.

description:
Certainly one of the better options to grab drinks and watch sports in the Union Square area. I visited during the recent heat wave in San Francisco. Ugh, it was unbearable but so was many other places. I've visited plenty of times before. 

Food is decent with good variety. The bartenders are routinely not paying attention to who arrived at the bar first. It gets a little annoying when it's busy and bright colored polo shirts are getting immediate attention. I think it's pretty simple. Pay attention to the bar patrons and work those beer taps with precision. Haven't exactly had a bad experience outside of waiting a while for a simple beer. 

The biggest draw back is during Warrior playoffs when this place is 1) packed with a ridiculous amount of people and 2)Charging a cover for everyone to get in. Uhh... pay a cover to fight a hoard of people at the bar for drinks and service. Me thinks not. 

Better to check out during the week. Vibe is pretty chill before the evening rush starts.
author: Ralph A.

description: This place is awesome! I've been here a couple times in the past few years and each time it impresses me. I haven't ordered any of the food here but I can tell you the drinks are amazing, I've gotten cocktail drinks and beers. This is more of a sports bar but also a good place to pregame if you want to go out for the evening. I came here once with the San Francisco pub crawl on Valentine's Day and it was really packed and really fun! I most recently came here this past Valentine's Day with my boyfriend to get a few drinks while waiting for a reservation down the street. The staff is really friendly and the vibes are awesome here. There's a lot of arcade games and fun games like Foos ball or AirHockey, it's like a mini Dave and busters! It's on the second floor so gives it a really cool secluded vibe, you should definitely check this place out if you haven't been here yet.
author: Alejandra A.

description:
Pros:
Awesome place to grab drinks and hang out with friends; they have shuffle boards, pool tables and giant TVs! Food prices aren't too bad but you do have to order at the bar as well. Lots of selection for beers and ciders. Definitely would come back with friends to hang out again!

Cons:
Parking is bad since it's in downtown. Also the ladies room only has two stalls and ran out of toilet paper quickly (watch out for that). Might be a little hard to find a table if it gets busy and it can get a little loud in here!
author: Jessa May C.

description: This is a fun place to meet friends for a drink or to have some fun with friends. I like the layout and the location is pretty convenient in the downtown San Francisco area. They have good food options and I enjoyed the drinks. If you're downstairs you can spin the wheel to choose a drink! This is a great place to host an event or party. It's a mixed crowd but you'll most likely find tourists and a mix of 20s to 30s. Check it out!
author: Natalie M.

description:
First of all, really good garlic fries! On big game days, the food service can get backed up. Took them a while (about 20-30 mins) for the fries to come out but it was hot, fresh, crispy and garlicky.  The fries automatically come with two sauces: ranch and chipotle mayo. Decent beer, cider, and wine selections on tap. Lots of big TV with 2 bars so you don't have to wait too long to grab a drink. 

Overall, this is a fun spot to hang out, eat, drink, and catch a game with your buddies.
author: MinhTho N.

description: Meh. We went bar hopping after checking out of our hotel before catching our train home. The place is upstairs, nice and has a lot of games to play as well as tvs. Customer service needs to be worked on. We were served and then ignored for the rest of the time there even though it was close to empty.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Tldr - fun chill vibes game it up

Tight place to kick back with homies. Lotta games we smoked some fools at pool. Jk we got our asses handed to us lol.

The basketball game is tight, we witnessed a dude get 196, beat that!

Overall fun place to come with some buddies and play games.
author: Samraaj B.

description: Good sports bar, fun vibe.  Only one waitress for what looked like the entire seated area. The security guy had to check on us to be sure we ordered.  The waitress was great, not her fault at all.
author: Scott S.

description: This place is super cool. Great atmosphere and staff. First time here and we'd love to come back to watch a game here. Will be back.
author: Haldis V.

description:
Went here for a team offsite and was really happy we decided to come here.  First of all, this place is really spacious.  I didn't expect it to be as big as it was and I really liked the Barbary Coast decor.  Unsure what to drink?  Well, I bet the over 100+ beers should help, along with their rotating seasonal taps.  Or feel free to order wine and they have a full bar as well.  

Like playing games?  They have pool, shuffleboard, skeeball, foosball, air hockey, pinball and hoops for you to enjoy.  Feel free to let your testosterone flow and challenge your friends as you enjoy libations and good times.  

They have a wide array of food offerings as well.  We ordered buffalo wings, sliders, nachos, jalapeno poppers, popcorn shrimp, fries and short rib tacos.  The food was much better than I expected, since most bar food is fairly blah.  However, everything tasted really good and I definitely enjoyed the short rib tacos, sliders, fries and nachos the most.  

There are plenty of large screen TV's for you to enjoy your favorite game(s) as well.  Great vibe and a really fun place to get together and have a good time.  

The staff was super friendly and accommodating too.  Our bartender Jeremy was serving-up drinks for us and Helena took care of us and did an amazing job.
author: Lon H.

description: Came here for the first time this past Saturday. My friend from out of town wanted to go somewhere with a lot of beers and Golden Gate is what we found on Yelp. The first thing you will notice when you walk in is how big and open this place is. They have TV's everywhere, including some screens that take up whole walls. There is also a great selection of bar and arcade games like pool, shuffle board, skee ball and many more. The beer selection is pretty good, they had about 30 beers on tap and another 15 or so in bottle or can, furthermore they are reasonably priced considering the type of bar this is and it being in the city. Golden Gate is definitely the place to check out if you want to watch the games with some friends or even take a date to enjoy the arcade games.
author: Tristan S.

description: Been here a couple times and enjoyed the beer selection and many fun video games etc to play while having a few.  Food is typical bar fare, reasonably priced and quick.  Unfortunately last visit the cocktail waitress had a horrible attitude but luckily we had the option to order at bar so we avoided her.
author: Gina P.

description:
Fun place and environment. Some staff were a little rude and prissy but who cares. As long as my food is good and the beer was better, I'm chillin. And the food was great and my 3 beers were delicious! 

So go check it!
author: Dani R.

description:
Outstanding location and amenities, fine food, great selection of beer, but a bit overwhelmed. 

It seems like this place could use a waiter system of some form.  I mean, going to the bar to order/pay up works okay when there are 10 people there, but when it reaches 50-60, it's an absolute mess. 

That being said, everything else about GGTP is great! Their beer selection is both varied and top-notch!  Their food is pretty good!  They have those cool games that all the kids like to play, like Skee-Ball and the thing you can punch.  They have big screens that they can turn to games you want to see when they're not overwhelmed. 

So pretty good, but a little overwhelmed.
author: John L.

description: Fun atmosphere for watching sporting events.  Lots of TVs and a great spicy Bloody Mary.  It's also fun to play shuffleboard.  Don't expect good service because it's almost nonexistent.  It seems like if your not a regular then they don't really care about you.  I really had to work hard to get a drink at the bar.
author: Mike M.

description: Nice space and great beer selection, but don't bother ordering mixed drinks/liqueur. They water those drinks down. Some of the least generous pours I've ever seen.
author: Eric S.

description:
Disgusting!

Came in to enjoy a beer and some bar food. Was amazed at how nasty the tables were. Yes the waitress came to wipe the table down with a nasty smelling wet rag. It left an odor (the kind you get after you wash your clothes and leave them there for some time without drying). After that the food didn't seem all that appetizing. Even after we saw some of the other tables getting their food we were reluctant to order anything off the menu. (the food wasn't pleasing to the eye) We simply had a beer and left. My sour was delicious don't get me wrong; but we wont be back due to the hygienic situation of this place.
author: Alberto V.

description: Really rude and fat mexican dude with an attitude at the bar. Kindly reminded me I was a bar, then had the nerve to comment on my ID photo (I didn't order any drinks) When I ordered nachos that have bacon in them he also kindly reminded me theres meat in them (it's 2018 and this dude assumed that since i'm Indian i cant read/have dietary restrictions). Horrible service okayish food.
author: Nina A.

description: Really cool place! We're huge sports fans, and this is a great setup for that. They ID before you enter, which is convenient. Drinks were delicious, they have a ton of beer on tap too! Shuffleboard and some fun games. Everyone here seemed happy and it was just all around an awesome atmosphere. This will be our new go to spot when we come to union square. We didn't order food, but everything looked really good, and consistent. Not much service walking around the bar area, if you want something, you've gotta go up and get it. Seems they have a full restaurant upstairs one more level from the bar. Great setup!
author: Sam B.

description: A fun, casual place to hangout with your friends after climbing up many flight of stairs. It is a short walk from the Union Square. They have many games like shuffleboards, basketball, skee ball, etc. and variety of beers and drinks. It is on the loud side so it won't be an ideal place if you want to have a quiet conversation.
author: Sarah C.

description: I'm only giving it a 4 star because it was hot in there. I know they do that intentionally to keep the cold ones flowing. Great use of space. Fantastic variety of ciders and beer. I kinda wish I was ballsy enough to spin the beer wheel. Line moved pretty slow even with 3 bar tenders. I would go back.
author: Sandy C.

description:
12/10/16 Saturday Santa Con SF 2016

Huge and spacious place! There are stairs to walk up, several flights too. The main floor is actually the second floor of the bar. It is decorated with sports, games and TVs. There is 1 main bar and as you enter it is to the left after the bathrooms. 

We were meeting with some friends we met previously at another bar, Harper & Rye, and overall our night at Santa Con was pretty crazy. Otherwise, we just had a pitcher of beer that our new friends decided to purchase, Stella! By the time I was given a glass of Stella, I couldn't take anymore liquids down. I was able to finish at least 2/3 of the glass, but decided to rest the glass on a random table.

Great place to come with friends or coworkers. It can get pretty loud depending on the crowd, and it is super close to Union Square! Like less than 1 block away!

I'll come back to try it out on a different night.
author: Vivian V.

description: Great place for sport with plenty of TVs. Service was so crappy we got one beer and left and I wanted to watch college football. The menu is small  but the wings looked good. The table next to me was complaining about the service as well. What a joke. It could have been a good time.
author: Mike S.

description:
Wasn't sure what to expect from this place since it was someone else's idea to go. We went on a Friday night and it does it packed as expected on a Friday in sf. The place is big though so lots of room to move around. 

They have shuffle board, pool table, skee ball, and basketball. An adult Chuck E. Cheese basically. 

Drinks were decent. They do good pours here. Got gin and tonic and they really fill it up! 

For food we ordered a vegetable plate (I know who orders that at a bar right?) Just trying to be healthy though and  veggies were pretty fresh but $8 bucks for veggies was not the best deal but at least it was fresh and had variety. Also got chicken nachos but was disappointed with that. Had the nacho cheese, tomato salsa, and chicken on top of chips practically. What about other stuff on nachos like sour cream, guacamole, beans, more salsa? Was a little lacking there. Drinks are way better and I'd probably stick it to that next time or try something else like a burger.
author: Melissa L.

description: A reasonably good size sports bar in the heart of Union Square chocked full of tourists waiting for numerous beers on tap. I had a chicken quesadilla and actually wasn't that bad. And the prices were pretty reasonable for San Francisco tourist trap. The crowd was just fine. For some reason a lot of the video games and so forth inside we're not working. That was disappointing as I want to play old-school cocktail table miss Pac-Man. Oh well I'll have to seek my retro thrill elsewhere.
author: Robert C.

description: First off I'll start by saying that I love coming here & the food & drinks are GREAT...  but what the actual FUCK... THEY charged my card an EXTRA $10 ! Uhhh i won't be using my card here ever again! Fuck that... your welcome for your fat ass EXTRA tip assholes.
author: Veronica G.

description:
While vacationing in San Fran my boyfriend and I still wanted to be faithful football fans and watch our team play at a near by sports bar. We decided to check this place out since it was only a short walk away from our hotel. Initially walking in the concept is pretty cool. They have some older arcade games like skee ball and the game where you slap the alligators on the head as they pop out of their holes, definitely nostalgic.

Food wise however this place was lacking. First off if you come before noon plan on eating breakfast only since the menu doesn't switch over til 12 on the dot. Once lunch time hit we ordered the nachos, wings and garlic fries. The nachos were super cheap, only $5 during game days, but the flavor was very disappointing. They tasted super bland and the toppings weren't very evenly distributed. The wings were probably the best part. We tried the BBQ which had a good flavor to it and they were cooked just right. The fries were pretty alright too, but just your standard ol garlic fries. There really wasn't anything unique or outstanding about any of our options.

Overall I guess I was expecting more of this place, but just ended up disappointed. They do have plenty of tvs though if you want to just watch those and drink it's probably a decent spot.
author: Erika N.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet.  I've been about a dozen times.  HUGE beer selection.  There are rotating taps, any style of beer you could want, a helpful beer menu with prices that helps with any indecision etc.  

There are food and appetizer options, but I haven't had any of the food in a long time.

Come here to grab a few beers, watch sports, play shuffleboard, video games, play skeeball, or.......pop a shot!!!

Now I don't want to brag, actually that isn't true.... I threw down a 114 on the pop a shot.  Shoot me a message if you want photographic proof!

If you beat 114, please take a picture and shoot me a message so we can set up a time to have a good ol fashion shoot off!!  Seriously!

Anyway, the beer are reasonable priced, the bartenders are not mean, getting a drink doesn't take too long.  There are lots of places to post up to watch whatever game you are interested in.
author: Ty C.

description: This place can get really packed as others have mentioned, especially on game days! Even though the service is sucky at times, the vibe is always great and I've never had a dull moment here! Food is nothing out of the ordinary and drinks are mediocre.
author: Mehak D.

description:
Stumbled upon this place and had a great time 
The bartenders are awesome !    We are having a. Blast people watching drinking beer and wine and playing games. Basketball , skee ball and of course  the photo booth ........ and lots of great beer. Ordered the  rib tips , the husband like them I thought they were dry as anything but who cares we are having a  great time
author: Laura S.

description: Fun place to watch the World Cup. Get the Warrior Burger and onion rings, it was delicious. Skip the rib tips.
author: Jess F.

description: Great food. Awesome bartenders. Crap waitress/server staff along with idiot security guards. Took hour before the server to come back after taking my card. When i went to the bar to ask for a manager i got blank stares. The server magically appeared. I didnt tip, signed the bill and walked away, that is when this idiot security guard decided to give me lip and tell me i cant get attitude with his wait staff... No, your wait staff is trash, if they can't handle not getting a tip for bad service, then they dont belong in the industry. Wont be coming back here again.
author: Andrew L.

description: Golden Gate Taproom is a typical touristy sports bar. Lots of TV's, games around and seat yourself. It's a decent sports bar but the food definitely left a lot to be desired. It was very crowded when we went on a Saturday afternoon to watch football. They play music, not sound for the games on TV so definitely something to be aware of if you are a big sports fanatic. There's always a massive line at the bar but PLEASE don't wait in the line. They serve all across the bar just like every other bar so don't wait in the line of 30 people to get a drink. I'd go back to watch sport, but not for their food.
author: Carol Ann V.

description: Worst bar ever, it is a sport bar, please putt the sound system with the game, not mexicain music l, seriously, rude bar tender, will never EVER come back
author: Hamel B.

description:
Watch your bank account after going here! My credit card was charged more than was authorized for the total plus tip. I've contacted this business several times to get them to explain how this happened and reverse the charge, and have yet to have the issue resolved.

Update: ended up having to go through my bank because the staff wouldn't return voicemails or online messages.
author: B J.

description:
In town for the weekend and needed a place to watch football.
 pros- a lot of beer on tap and a lot of TVs
Cons- the service was very poor. Bartenders were very slow and didn't seem to care. Server forgot half our meal. Nachos were not very good. 95% of the Tvs had the same football game.
author: Ethan R.

description: First off, this place has every game you may want to play while inebriated. Second off, you gotta pay to play. This place must be a gold mine. Full bar (which I didn't make it to this time) and many beers to enjoy on draft. I liked the sour monkey, the wings, the nachos, the carne fries, the potato skins, and the chicken sandwich. All in all, a fun place to darty.
author: Gene W.

description:
Lots and lots of TVs, not always easy to find seats during a big game, but still a lot of space for large groups. Quite a few arcade games (Buck Hunter is my fav), some pool tables, shuffleboard, and they do serve food, but average bar food.

It's not exactly a place anyone I know raves madly about, but we all still end up coming here anyway once in a while because, y'know, it's just there... and there's room for us all... so yeah, ok fine...

If you're here to watch sports, head up to the top floor where they project games wall-to-wall. I find it easier to get drinks up there too, but SHH.
author: Ashley S.

description: Great place to watch NCAA, NFL and other major sports.  Atmosphere can be loud at times.  Great selection of IPA and craft beer.
author: William M.

description:
Yeah about this place if you are in college and want to play games this is the spot for you otherwise probably skip. 
No service at the tables have to go up and get it.  Food is ok and good variety of beers
Just honestly was not a fan
author: Jorge A.

description: Awesome location, 3 blocks from the Powell bart station. They have fun games like shuffleboard, pool, and some arcade games. Great selection of draft and bottled beers. Great place to watch big games but get there early if you want a spot as it can get crowded. Bar food is good too. The service and security are very attentive. If you have a finished glass, it'll be gone in under 5 minutes. Definitely check this place out.
author: Mark A.

description:
Fun place to hang out, but management isn't always the most attentive, especially in regards to groups. 

I've had two experiences with GGTR, both of which have been less than ideal for different reasons. First time was a few years ago when GGTR was courting my alumni group for football season. We hosted an event and not once during said event did anyone come up to me, ask if I wanted anything to drink, etc. I didn't feel welcome or appreciated that I had brought them a decent amount of business.

Second time around, we were told that unless we agreed to a dollar minimum to be placed on a credit card in advance, we should arrive 2 hours early to reserve tables. It was communicated to us that both floors would be open. This was not the case: they understaffed for the night in preparation for college football the next morning, which I get. I was upset because we were told holding an area wouldn't be an issue. 

Lucky for GGTR and not for me, I only had half my expected guest list show up, and we managed to get a table. Our server was very helpful and even brought out a folding table for a silent auction we were doing. That does not excuse the lack of communication and help from management.

If I wanted to, I could bring this place a ton of business, but I'll stick with our normal spots that always go out of their way to accommodate our needs.
author: Andrew L.

description:
For starts, customer services skills: 0
So rude and unaccommodating..

So i have a glass cut my foot and I went to find someone to help, luckily the only person around was the security guard, which was the nicest person here, and he was able to guide me to the manager. The manager took about 15 minutes to find a bandaid.. while my foot was bleeding. 

Then as we went back to our table, we tried to call a waitress for 10 mins after we waited 20. No one tried to help us. I was able to grab someone and she told me that "we were not in her area of tables and that obviously were busy"

Well so much for supporting your staff and helping the client.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Great place to watch games and waitresses are awesome, but don't expect anything from the servers/bus boys. Asked 2 times for extra dipping sauces and one of them said "You have sauce already, see" Our waitress wrote it down too. Guess he just hates working here. Should probably quit if you want to give an attitude for doing your job.
author: Megan T.

description:
Friday night and a critical Game 4 GSW vs CAVs!  Two of my work colleagues suggested we make a party of it and head to the city to watch the game.  We had two gastropubs closer to our work but it's not the same!  Yelp led us to Golden Gate Tap Room, a short walk from Powell St. BART.

Apparently, many other GSW fans had the same idea, and there was a 10-15 min line that wrapped around the block.  Also a $10 cover charge to get in.  Outside the entrance is a statue of Warriors (and Cavs) legend #42, Nate Thurmond.  

The bar itself has three large floors of TVs and games like foosball and video games.  We literally found no tables or places to sit - since some folks arrived as early as 3PM for 6PM tipoff.  Eventually my friend convinced a bunch of young ladies if we could share their table to eat. They agreed and in return, my buddy covered their tab, food and all!  We also got seats for the rest of the game!

They had about 100 beers on tap it seems.  My max is 2-3 so I got lighter drinks with 4-5% ABV: Angry Orchard Cider (5 stars), Ginger Lemon Radler (4 stars), and Crispen Original Cider (3 stars).

Food is actually pretty good and affordable.  My faves were the Blue Moon Chicken Nachos (cheesy, strong bacon flavor with chicken) and Cheese Quesadillas.  Jalapeño Poppers were good, but Vegetarian Pot Stickers not (my coworker said they are too light, and he's a vegetarian).

Overall a great place to watch the game, especially if you get a seat.  Its very crowded on every floor and you'll find sticky floors since folks due spill beers trying to wade through the crowds.  They also had plenty of security guards here, though with GSW pulling out an exciting win everyone inside the bar (and outside the streets of SF) was euphoric.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Worst sports bar experience of my life. 

There are probably 100 TVs in the place spread over three floors. They refused to change ONE tv to the playoff game I went there to watch. 

Could have been a small tv in a corner - that would have been fine. But they REFUSED. 

Will not return.
author: Greg N.

description: Decent set up but service stinks.  Sat at a table by the bar and watched waitress after waitress pass me by.  Place has potential.  Disappointed
author: Denis S.

description:
There is not a lot I can add about the Golden Gate Tap Room. It's a heavy pub atmosphere establishment, with an enthusiastic staff, a ton of beers (and a wheel of beer to spin if you can't decide), with lots of space, lots of TVs on sports channels and lots of games to play. I actually came here more for the games, which included a few old fighting games, Pac-Man, Skeeball and HotShot. There was food roaming around too, which I didn't try since I had already eaten, but looked heavily fried and fit in with the rest of the spot.

I had fun here, I was looking for a fun, quick bar with good drinks and/or a large beer selection, relaxed environment and plenty to do. If that is what you are looking for, then you will not be disappointed. Fancy cocktail seekers should look elsewhere.
author: Nick M.

description: Really friendly staff.  They knew my friend by name "baby face Jones" and greeted us with alcohol.  I'll recommend to anyone.
author: MImi M.

description:
WOW! I am not a huge fan of watching sports at a bar, but if you ever have to....come to Golden Gate Tap Room. Literally, the best way and only way to watch sports. The top floors has giant screens and makes you feel like you are on the actual football field or basketball court. 

Shout out to our server, Keely/or Kaley, because even though it was crazy for super bowl, she was super sweet and pleasant. thank you Golden Gate for amazing service, delicious garlic fries and boneless chicken strips and of course wine/cider!
author: Linette F.

description: I had a very different experience here.  There were no waitresses at all.  You had to self seat and place your order at the bar.  Now this was ok but the line was incredibly long and there was only one bartender on a busy Saturday afternoon.  He did have food runners and he was very efficient and very pleasant even though he was swamped.  We were able to open a tab but you had to stand in line any time you wanted anything other than water. He also had to stop to change the tv channels to different games for customers... lol. The food was good. I had the Cobb salad and my friend had short rib quesadillas (excellent) and we shared the pulled pork nachos which were terrible. The meat was dry and the cheese cold. Also the chips did not have any flavor.  The beer selection was great.  They had a little something for everyone.  Overall I did have a good time but the time waiting in line was a little obnoxious.  Get that man some help please!
author: Tashana B.

description:
Came here during a weeknight happy hour with a large group (about 10). Got carded coming in, had a stamp put on my wrist (not sure why that was necessary), and made my way upstairs. The proximity to Union Square and BART is great if you're looking to mix things up and get away from FiDi/SOMA. 

The Tap Room has a huge, sprawling interior that resembles a warehouse attic and a sports-bar/loungey/arcade-y vibe, depending on which corner of the room you're in. There are pinball machines, a full bar, and large tables that are perfect for a crowd. 

The appetizers were great, and they had a wide selection of beers on tap. I didn't have much of a chance to explore the entire menu (or the entire bar), but I'd be happy to return!
author: Laura B.

description: We were sitting on a table near the bar. We waited for our drinks for about 20 minutes. We saw our drink just waiting to be brought to us.  Our waitress was no where to be found.  Our appetizers came before our drinks... that's odd... After we finished, we asked for our bill, added the tip from credit card, gave extra cash tip.  A few days later, I checked my bank and noticed it didn't match.  The waitress actually added more for her tip.... smh... should I say more?  Should I even mention her name here since it's on the receipt?
author: Fil A.

description: Second time I've been here. This place is a cute gem with a eclectic vibe. I met up with a few friends of ours while bar hopping around on a Friday night, it wasn't that busy and we got our drinks in a timely manner.
author: Sandeep C.

description: A great bar to have some fun at!! Full of super fun games, the shuffleboard is the best!! $6/hour! Pool, Pac-Man, skeeball, pinball, beer, great food. Awesome bartenders! We visited San Fran for two nights, came here for one of them. Came back a week later on our way back to Seattle! Only complaints would be the quarter machines are a little pricey ($1 instead of one quarter) and weekends get buuuusy! Tough getting to the bar but the bartenders kick ass and won't make you wait too long.
author: Jordyn V.

description: This is the coolest bar I've ever been to! It's like an old school sports bar that has teenager kids hangout place. Will be back to this place again when we get the chance to visit SF again. Ambiance is so cool that I felt like I'm a teenager again LOL!!
author: Tiffany N.

description: We came here for happy hour on our way through the city. Its up the stairs in this huge room with so many screens and TV - a fun place to watch sports for sure! We got there a little bit before 4 so we had to get up and order beer's from the bar. They said waitresses start taking drink orders later (can't remember what time). But the bartenders were fast and nice and there is a GREAT selection of beer. We got the fries to munch on and enjoyed some games.
author: Hanna H.

description: Came here after a random Tuesday night of sake bombs and sushi down the street. Was in the mood for beer so stopped by after peeping yelp. The bartender Elena was AMAZING hella nice and super attentive. Fun games. Will be back next time I'm in the city visiting my friend. We had a great time. We literally just left and I thought I needed to post this review asappp just based off the service elena provided. She also said the third floor is open on weekends for games and can't wait to check it out!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I'm a fan.  Get it?  Golden State fan? Got it?  Yeah, they have a lot of Warriors paraphernalia (thanks spell check).  I actually came here after a game and there were a lot of people around but it wasn't much of a party; I guess it was about an hour later.

Drinks were reasonable and the bartender friendly enough.  No food though after whatever time I showed up.  Bartender said they don't mind if you bring food in from Lori's Diner.  PM me if I am wrong about that.

Pool tables and some weird shuffleboard tables, TVs all over, a pretty good place to hang out if you are in the area.
author: Keith S.

description: Great place to watch the game. Hard to get service at the bat seating area. Very vast tab selection. Jumbo tvs are amazing. Will go back.
author: Ali R.

description: Good beer selection, though my pit stop at GGTR was severely dampened by the smallest chicken wings in the world.
author: Mike T.

description:
Basically in Union Square, Golden Gate Taproom is a great central location to meet with friends. I usually go here after a long day of shopping, but it's a great place to decompress and just chill. 

First of all, the drinks are really affordable here! With a wide beer selection on draft and in bottles, there's so much to choose from. Pair this with their food (which is served late) -- you got yourself a great night! After you have some liquid courage in you, you can either watch one of their big screens or play any of the games they have scattered around. I'm honestly way too drunk to play any games, but it's good to watch as well! 

Not only is Golden Gate Taproom a great bar, there's lots of seating and different floors. Second floor is open later than 11! I love this place and should probably try more of their food, but am not a good fan of their bartenders and security at times. The bartenders like to charge on chasers and the bouncers are everywhere and are check up on basically everything. Would appreciate some kindness and privacy at times. But overall this is a great place for groups!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Awesome hangout spot with quite a few selections of game: from shuffleboard to Tekken, pinball machines to deer hunting (virtually, of course). The place itself is lively but not overbearingly loud and crowded. I didn't really try any of their drinks but there seems to be quite a few different types on the menu. Go here if you're with a group of friends, new or old, and you'll be sure to have a solid good time.
author: Joy H.

description:
We came here post-Nike SF race to watch the 49er game. This was the closest sports bar near our hotel. What better way to watch a 49er game than in SF! We got carded as we entered the bar by the bouncer - who btw was super nice. We went upstairs and the bar was packed. No empty seat in the house. We stood around until the prior game ended and then people started to leave.

We found a table with 3 chairs luckily and we had a good spot to watch the game on the big screen. The service was not good considering how packed it was. You're best to order your alcohol at the bar because you'd get it faster. We ordered tacos, sliders and wings to share. Mediocre bar food.
