Located right on Powell and in the heart of Union Square. It's actually a big place and a good place to watch sporting events, but if its crowded, forget about it.
author: Maria C.

description:
This place is located deep in the city so parking will take 20-30 minutes so be prepared for that. 

Once you are able to finally find parking days later, you will be overwhelmed with the amount of things this places offers. From the multiple beers (I believe well over 100 on tap) to the multiple games offered (arcade games, pool, this sliding stone game I do not know the name of) and to the surprisingly affordable bar food offered ($5 nachos, hella stacked high) this bar will not disappoint. 

The bar has 3 floors.

Bottom floor: entrance area. 
2nd floor: beers on tap, multiple tvs and seating, game area. 
3rd floor: extra bar, huge tvs, extra seating. 

Solid sport atmosphere, you will not miss any game as they show every game played. 

If I am every in the city and can find parking in less than 10 minutes, you'll forsure see me stopping by this bar again.
author: James L.

description:
My experience of Golden Gate Tap Room is probably a unique one, as it was during Santacon and packed to the brim. I think we waited at least 25 minutes to finally place our orders at the bar. Nonetheless, I thought it was a really cool place. Huge screens for games, and actual arcade games for you to play too. Large selection of beers on tap. 

It's totally deceiving from the outside, as it looks pretty small. However, once you're inside you have to walk up about 3 flights of stairs to the massive open space. 

Would definitely recommend this place for a drink if you're in Union Square.
author: Emma W.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room is a great place for group outings. Located at the heart of Union Square, I'm sure they get all the tourists mixed in with all the locals, which is why this space is HUGE! This is probably one of the few bars I know in SF that have multiple floors. The second floor is usually where its at though; the most people are there and that's the main bar people go to. They have a great selection of  beer on tap as well as a good selection of cider, either in pints or pitchers. Dark to light beer, you name it! Scattered around the floor are a ton of arcade games and foosball tables, as well as corner tables and long couches people can gather on. There are also a bunch of TV's projecting everywhere the latest game that's on, which makes this a great sports bar especially on major game days.

The bar food here is really good! I've had some of their fish tacos, sliders and sweet potato fries. They are decently priced too especially if you're sharing it! The last time I was here was during Santacon where there was a million of people crowded in the bar and my group of people were really surprised at how quick the food service was once we brought the number to the table.

It can get pretty loud and crazy here on game days (and major drinking days such as Santacon), but it's worth the fun after a few drinks and great company!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Games, booze, food. Perfect combination to catch up with friends and watch the Warriors game.

Came here straight after work around 4:30.  Ordered a bud light, burger and fries.  Burger was cooked perfectly but nothing special.  Fries were nice and crispy. Took my sweet time scarfing it down until finally my friends showed up at 5:00.  Headed upstairs where there were more seating and gigantamous TV's alongside one wall.  Played 2 rounds of skee ball, lost and had to take a shot of Jameson.  I swear my machine was rigged.  It looked like they kind of skimped on the shots but for $7, it wasn't too bad. Once it hit 7:00 when the game started, the place got really packed.  Very diverse group in age and race.  Not pretentious at all.  

I had to leave early to meet up other friends so I didn't get to finish the game.  The Warriors lost so I guess I didn't miss out on much.  Sometimes, you just gotta pull out before finishing.
author: Linda N.

description:
Stopped in for a drink last time I was in SF. Thought this place was pretty cool. Very much a sports bar. Huge big screen tv so you can watch the game (if you're into that sort of thing). Ordering drinks is surprisingly efficient. You wait in line like you're ordering a latte from Starbucks. I actually think this is genius and think more bars should use it. Any hoot, they have a huge beer menu. Personally, in not a big beer drinker but their list was huge so I'm sure if you're a beer snob you can find something you fancy! 

Crowd was pretty cool. Mostly guys. I commented to my husband that single ladies should take note and make a pit stop.
author: Christina P.

description: Pretty good place to anchor in for a few!  Bartender was a nice young lady, there was a chatty gentleman sitting nearby sharing his life story, but he was entertaining if nothing else. Didn't eat, just drinking my lunch today
author: Steve F.

description:
I remember his boxing classes like they were the other day...

"jab jab!"
::whud! whud!::

"jab hook!"
::whud! whud!::

"right left right!"
::whud! whud! whud!::

Except randomly finding myself next to Paris Alexander by the Simpsons pinball actually *was* the other day. I should've looked around for Neungsiam or Bunkerd too.

...And told them to get the PULLED PORK. The bun pillowed upon knife contact; so airy & light. Sandos at other places should take cues from this bread.

Other places should also take cues from having Simpsons video games coughbrewcadecough.
author: Dan B.

description: If you want food while you drink go somewhere else the only reason it has 1star is because of their beer waited almost an hr for food when people that came after us got their food and when the food finally came all of our food was cold I was the only one that asked if they could heat it up and she kindly said she would just bring me a new plate I had ordered the sliders and garlic fries i was 20 more mins and when it came out 1) they gave me regular fries instead 2) the sliders and fries where STILL COLD!  I ended up telling her to just cancel my order
author: Aundrea H.

description:
This place has quickly become one of my favorite bar/venue for groups. 

It has games, a crap ton of beers, and breathing space. That last one is a big deal for me because the last thing I want is to be standing in a bar feeling hot with barely enough space between me and the stranger next to me awkwardly apologizing for accidentally bumping bums. Yeah that scenario is not ideal. 

Luckily this bar has plenty of space. Two floors worth of space! The best part is that there are games! So instead of just standing and drinking or sitting and drinking, you can actually do stuff and drink. It also helps that there are A LOT of beers on tap plus rotating taps for special beers. And if you're hungry, they also have food! 

TLDR; this place is great to watch sports, hang out with large group of friends, drinking beer, and drinking while playing fun games.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
shuffleboard was fun until the work day people evicted us early for a reservation. We thought they were pretty rude kicking us out before the reservation began, and it could have been done more tactfully. 

They reserved so much of the tap room that we couldn't play anything but skiball, and foosball.  That was fun but we can only burn so much money on that before it got old.  We called before and they didn't mention the large reservation, and they only had one bartender until three or so. 

Beer is good here, great selection, but the reservations and food kind of ruin the vibe. I don't recommend this place during the holiday season unless you're reserving most of the joint. 

I had the pulled pork and the fries were mostly cold, and the pulled pork tasted like warmed up Costco pulled pork.
author: Matt U.

description: A busy bar on Fridays night walking distance from Union Square. I came here for the SantaCon and we got there at 5pm. Getting in was no problem and there was so many people. The place has 2 floors that I saw. You go up stairs and at that point I just saw all the debri and sticky floors it was pretty grose. The 1st floor has a pool table and big screen TVs and a long bar. They also have an area for private events. A nightmare trying to get a beer but they do have a lot of types of beer on tap. The place was loud and fun but smelled of sweat and funk. The bathrooms I wont even get into details what I will say is that I walked out with toilet paper all stuck in my shoes. Maybe I will try another day thats not that crazy. But the staff there nees to step up their cleaning skills!!!
author: Theresa G.

description:
Short version: Huge, upstairs sports bar with games, TVs, and a fantastic selection of draft beers; plus hookers!

Longer version: We hit the GGTR after a fun show at the Masonic, and after meeting an old friend at the show who didn't want the night to end. My friend P and I decided to oblige him for a while, but most nearby hot spots were closed at 10:30 pm on Wednesday night. (Hmmm. must not be Manhattan).

But the GGTR was still going strong. After showing our IDs to the ex-linebacker up front, we walked upstairs, sldled up to the bar and stood agog at the selection - on the order of 100 draft beers here. Craziness! (but my kinda crazy) We each ordered something to suit our fancy (I chose Raging Bitch Belgian IPA from Flying Dog - not something I often see on the West coast).

We weren't eating food at that hour, but I scanned the menu - They seemed to have a decent selection of bar food, plus burgers, salads and short list of standard entrees. 

Near the end of our first round, two young ladies in tight, revealing clothing walked up, smiled seductively, and asked if we were interested in some "company". (I can be "slow on the uptake" sometimes, but it was pretty clear to me they weren't escapees from a bachelorette party).  We smiled and politely declined; and they expressed their disappointment, while giving us long, friendly stares. Not the first time this has ever happened, but certainly the first time in a bar or restaurant. Wacky.

After ordering our second (and last) round of beers we noticed these same two ladies had openly approached almost every group of guys in the bar, supposedly with the same opening line. And neither the bartenders or staff seemed to take notice. And how'd they get past that burly bouncer downstairs? (Regulars?)

But I digress. As sports bars go, this is one of the better ones I have been to. There's plenty of space, TVs everywhere, and a whole section of games like foosball, skeeball, pool and arcade games.  Not to mention the killer beer list.  I would be happy to come here and see a game sometime, provided the crowds were not too heavy.
author: Dan B.

description:
Just stumbled upon this place on our first night in San Fran. Decided to give it a go based on Yelp reviews. From the outside you wouldn't know what you were walking into and we were a bit hesitant walking up the winding stairs wondering what to expect but at the top it opens up into an Aladdin's cave perfect for any sport fans. Big scenes and heaps of cool games like pool and arcade machines.
Staff were friendly, helpful and totally awesome. Food was delicious we had jalapeño poppers, the pull pork sandwich and 49ers chicken sandwich all were delicious.
There is a huge selection of beer of tap - anything you can imagine.
 Will be returning soon.
author: Marie W.

description:
After taking the double decker bus tour around the city, my co-workers and myself decided to stop here to stuff our faces and have some drinks. We were also doing a scavenger hunt that day, so this was the perfect place to stop and check things off of our lists (like being kissed by a stranger...haha).

Since we arrived here at an odd time, apparently when their upstairs restaurant portion was closed to prepare for dinner (or something like that), we dined in the middle level (where all the games and action was). We had to order both our food and drinks at the bar, which was kind of annoying because of the long wait. The bartender even forgot to give me my shot of tequila, which annoyed me even more, but luckily the female bartender saw me and remembered what I ordered.

The food was delicious! My cheeseburger was juicy and my fries were on point. Things tasted even better after my shot of tequila!

The have a lot of things to do here. There are pool tables and other game areas to choose from. Whenever I'm ever in the area again, during basketball season, I wouldn't mind watching my Warriors or Bulls play here.
author: Paulamertha A.

description: Great selection of beer and food.  Two bartenders one really nice and the other one could use some work in the personality department.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Came here a few times with friends during the recent playoffs. We were looking for a spot that we might be able to catch a Toronto Blue Jays game, and to our surprise there was a large contingency of Jays fans that formed around the large TV we sat down at.

This bar is up a set of stairs, and has two levels. The first level you walk up to is definitely the largest, and has two large TVs in addition to a bunch of smaller ones. The upstairs level has one large screen to watch, as far as I could tell.

Make sure you come a decent amount of time before the game starts in order to get a spot to watch the game. I tried to watch the Jays here last Saturday, but it was way too packed and college football dominated the TVs instead of playoff baseball sadly.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
Definitely a cool place to watch a sports game or just hang out with friends after work! I came here for the first time to watch a Warriors' game with a couple friends and it was packed!! I can see how everyone would have a good time here, it's loud and rowdy, various cheap beer, and has everything you need for a sports game.

We headed straight for the bar and saw their huge beer selection on the wall!! I also liked that you could spin the wheel in case you're indecisive/don't know anything about beer haha. There was tvs everywhere you looked, so there's no bad spots in the house unless it gets too crowded. There's plenty space and seating, but it was crowded because we came at half time. Try to get here early for a good (sitting) spot if you're coming on game day! With Giants season in full swing, GG Tap Room is a definitely a good place to check out!
author: Tara A.

description: Awesome place. Grate service by the owner!!! Highly recommend. "Must be" of San Francisco
author: Mariam H.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room NEVER disappoints, except on game days, because the line is literally out the door....around the block....and around another block.

BUT, that is because this place is phenomenal. Great food, great drinks, great games...paired with even better company, then you have yourself a 10/10 night down pat. 

They have a large selection of beer that are categorized by draft, which is nice since I prefer wheats and stouts and tend to overlook the IPAs. I've also tried the calamari, fries, and nachos. Nothing to call home about, but definitely better than your average bar food.

I also love how there are games strewn along the border of the bar. Skeeball, pinball machines, etc. You're NEVER left bored, no matter how boring your party is, hehe.

Definitely a go-to spot if you're around Powell!
author: Vee B.

description: We went after Santa Con, maybe that's why it was a little crowded. Their selection of beer was pretty impressive but they tapped out of some of their beers . They have a ton of barcade style games which made the night more fun. I personally ordered a Porter to start out the night and then the Tricerihops beer. Would visit again, but hopefully a little less packed next time
author: Kevin C.

description: Came here on the last day of the 2018 NBA Season. There were 9 games starting at 5pm and 6 had playoff implications, meaning they were important and would decide seeding and who got in. I showed up right at 5pm. There wasn't a single NBA game on. Hell, they were even showing a rerun of an old UFC fight. But not one NBA game. The manager was nice enough to eventually turn on 2 games. I really appreciate that and he eventually put one game on the very big screen.  However, if you're like me, and are a true sports fan, you would expect a sports bar to know what's going on in the world of sports and already have the games ready to go. If you're a real sports fan, this place isn't for you. It has the look, but not the soul.
author: Ismail S.

description:
Worst customer service!!!!! My boyfriend and I - who are loyal customers / have attended multiple company events came to watch our hockey team in the playoffs. The bar tender downstairs told us to ask our server to change a channel on a smaller tv because the larger screens were for another game WHICH WE WERE FINE WITH. We found a seat asked our server who was rude and short and said I have to ask the bartender (who I just had talked to). The server came back and said sorry can't change it go upstairs. We got up went upstairs and then were presented with even worse service. The waitress ignored us, the bar tenders were broing out and not paying attention, etc. We sat down to watch the one screen with the game and it was blurry - couldn't see anything! We then asked the bartender if we could maybe put it on another tv and he directed us back downstairs where just were and were REJECTED service. 

Finally the manager comes by. He says sorry your game doesn't matter when the main game comes on we are changing it. I asked to get the owners number - his parents - and was told his parents own it and his family and too bad. 

 We are never coming back again. Horrible customer service and no love for their clients.
author: Bri C.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars to go to in SF! Went here for a couple friends bdays and also this past weekend for SantaCon. This place is fun because there's multiple levels and GAMES! Pool tables, shuffle board, arcade games and more! Plus they serve appetizers with a large alcohol selection. The fries here are pretty good and everything else I tried was mediocre. I've had the chicken wings, quesadillas and nachos. 

Minus one star because some of the bartenders are mean and inconsistent. They'll give you a shot to the brim for one, then the second shot you ordered 3/4 full and then give you attitude when you ask to make it even -.- these two shots were order at the same time too.
author: Leah A.

description: If you're here to watch a sporting event (NFL Sunday, March Madness), they certainly have you covered in terms of TV's.  Lots of different screens to watch lots of different things.  The beer selection is also excellent, and their servers were very nice considering the atmosphere and the crowd.  They have games here too, but its your standard arcade type games.  It's also 3 levels, but surprisingly, even that's not enough to hold the crowd hat can build here.  Only knock really is their food. It's just standard bar food IMO, nothing special.
author: Andy V.

description: DO NOT try to plan a group event here! They are so non-responsive. I filled out an inquiry form through their website over a month ago and am still waiting to get a written proposal. I'm trying to plan a birthday party with approximately 40 guests. To be fair, I got an email response with a copy of their menu for large groups within a day. But since then, it takes a week for each reply. And sometimes I have to email twice, "Just checking in on my previous email", to get a response. Granted, I made a couple changes and had follow-up questions since my original inquiry. But still... the response time is so unprofessional and from the other reviews, it's a common thing here. The concept of this place is so cool, it's just too bad the poor service means I'll never go back.
author: J B.

description: Check your tabs at this place they WILL try to overcharge you if you aren't paying attention... and probably most of the time succeed.
author: Chris T.

description: Very bad service on the third floor. I wasn't acknowledged while waiting at the bar for 15 minutes. I had someone else go up and they were rude to her. Won't be recommending this place to anyone.... it's too bad bc they have Johnny Utah pale ale.
author: Marilyn M.

description: Horrible service!!!!! Burger was good but they delivered the wrong food first then 3 tables had no mustard or ketchup but staff doesn't care. Fun atmosphere to watch games but don't expect good service.  It was good bar food whenever you get it
author: Judy B.

description: Terrible place! Left my Versace glasses there wanted to simply get in touch with the bar and the phone number listed is to someone not even onsite! Couldn't even get a solid answer as to where my glasses ended up. Stay away!!
author: Henry H.

description:
Kevin H:

It was on Saturday the 18th on the top newly renovated floor. Bartenders was a dude with a beanie and I think glasses. I asked him if he can play sound for all star weekend (after asking my waitress and she said I needed to ask bartender) and he said no for the reason that if he played around for all star game be would have to for all the other games (which made no sense since there was no sound anyways). A few other tables asked for sound and was turned down by waitresses saying Bartenders said no. Love the bar but bartenders don't seem to know sports for a sports bar
author: Arnold N.

description: The bartenders came off a little pushy and arrogant. I know it's late in the evening however seem like they're a little put off by someone asking them questions about drinks. For a city with a lot of options that type of attitude isn't very cool.
author: Steve Y.

description: This place had great drinks and a really cool atmosphere. I really liked the old school arcade games that were there.     The prices were reasonable. Order food while you are there...you won't regret it! We had fully loaded tots that i would definitely order again. The only problem we had was it took a long time for the waitress to take out order. The food came out quickly tho.
author: Kayla M.

description: I only go to Golden Gate Tap if I'm trying to watch a sports game. It's a great spot to watch any bay area sports team. It gets pretty crowded if it's a big game so I would recommended getting there early and saving a spot for your group. It's open seating on all the floors, there are giant  screens and TVs everywhere. There's a decent amount of brews on tap and the bar food isn't half bad either. Easily accessible by both BART and MUNI from Powell station.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Really enjoyed grabbing a beer here. Huge selection of beer and large screens everywhere.

Along with a large beer selection the place itself is huge. Multiple stories makes it not too crowded and there is ample seating.

As an out of towner I think this is a good spot to hit if you want to watch a game or drink some local brews.
author: Jacob C.

description:
Whoa!  

I was blown away by the 3 floors of spacious bar layout with project TV screens, arcade and video games on the side as the extra dibs to this happening tap room!  It's rare to see a big bar like this in SF - especially in downtown, prime spot!

What makes this bar even more awesome is their complimentary nachos.  It was like a warm, welcoming offer!  They have the norm of bar foods, such as burgers and fries.

They offer a wide variety of beer!  I really liked their strong IPA, Tricerahops!  

This bar is a great get together at the tip and heart of Union Square!  Cheer-io!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Great place to watch a game. There is a bunch of beer to choose from. Can be loud...but its a sports bar.
author: John V.

description: Food was good, no waiting in line, but the service was a bit lacking.  There wasn't anyone really eager to serve you anything here.
author: Beatriz R.

description: Nothing fancy here, but this bar is a great hangout spot around Union Square.  It can get pretty busy here, especially during a sports game, but it is also a pretty big place.  They have a large beer selection here.  Shots are also pretty cheap and you get a pretty big shot.  My biggest disappointment though is the wheel to spin for a drink is always broken.  This place is still a lot of fun though with some arcade games and just a lively environment.  The inside of this place really feels a lot like Dave and Busters, but not game focused.
author: Bryson L.

description:
This was a very cool place.  The bar was upstairs and had a cool atmosphere.  There were tons of sports pictures and figures around.  The bar was very small, but the room was big itself with arcade and other games.  There were lots of TVs too.  The service was solid.  

We ordered 3 items, the wings plate ($17), short rib tacos ($9), and the nachos ($5).  

The wings plate came with 4 different types with 4 of each I believe.  The flavors were dry rub, buffalo, teriyaki, and BBQ.  The wing sizes were solid.  I was not a fan of the teriyaki wing too much, but the buffalo and BBQ were outstanding.  The buffalo was a traditional buffalo sauce and had a nice kick to it.  The BBQ wing was just right.  I did not try a dry rub wing.  

The short rib tacos were solid.  There were 3 to an order.  The meat was very tender and succulent.  The corn tortilla I was not a fan of, but I got passed it because of the meat and the special sauce that was present. 

The nachos were a disappointment.  I was not a fan of the cheese.  The chicken was solid though.  I thought these nachos were missing something, maybe jalapenos or some type of spicy ingredient.

Will I go back?  Yeah definitely.  Very cool atmosphere and solid bar food.
author: Dan M.

description: I really want to like this place. Have been here a dozen or so times. 3rd floor gets 5 stars easy. But it's not always open. 2nd floor has much different vibe, seating is variable. And let's say the service is not always with a smile.  All ordering is at the bar which can be a log jam. Had the fried chicken sandwich today, didn't feel like their best effort, a bit overcooked, bun was on the stale side. Right after the Warriors game but that shouldn't be an excuse. Meh
author: David H.

description:
Came back here because we had a good experience 2 years ago. Well, not so good today. Tables were not getting cleaned after people left. Only two staff members working the tables on the 3rd floor. We sat at a dirty table  because it was busy and we didn't want to lose the table thinking the waitress (Brittany) would come clean the table and take our order. Nope! 
My husband went to the bar and placed an order with Alaina. While we were waiting for our food, it took Her 40 minuets to finally come to the table only to ask us if all the beer bottles and dirty glasses were ours. (They were left from the previous customers) she didn't even ask us if we were okay or if we needed anything. 
It took almost an hour for our food to come out and the assorted wings for $18 were all buffalo wings and they were all cold. Our potato skins...all cold. The Burger was the only thing that was warm. We saw the waitress stop by a couple of tables asking if they were doing good but she never came to our table. 
We ate the food because we were so hungry but we are not coming back here again. Too bad. Our 1st time was real good.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
Great bar for watching Warriors, Sharks, Giants games - but be aware that this place has gotten so popular that they've started charging a $10 cover on game days. They also have a $1.50 charge to play shuffleboard. And dirty bathrooms - but it's a bar so what more could I expect. 

Other than that, the bar is huge - two floors, near Union Square/Powell Bart station. Making it a great option to meet up with some friends and have a good time over arcade games, shuffleboard, air hockey, or a glass of beer or two. PSA: Just don't come empty handed because everything costs a good amount of money.
author: Annie L.

description: This place is great for work happy hours. There's lots of space for multiple people, and they have a great beer selection along with a full bar. There are fun games to play and the food was great as well. Inexpensive food , 5$ for a huge plate of nachos or fries , and it was super tasty ! It's in a prime location, and the decor was fun also. The reasons I'm not giving it 5 stars - 1, the happy hour sucked. Only 1$ off drinks, really? 2- the bartender was really rude. I think he thought he was like a funny jerk charming type of guy,but he wasn't. 3- happy hour was only drinks, not apps or food.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Really big place!  They have a great bar selection and the place is awesome when its not too crowded.  Service is great, food is alright, but its what is expected. What bothers me is some of the people that frequent there.

Went here to watch some of the Dub games last year during the playoffs and man it was packed and fun at times.  But sometimes you'll get people that are there that are negative about people cheering for sports there.  Dude, you are at a sports bar... people are going to be watching their team during playoffs.

They looked like some young tech kids that weren't from the area so they were mocking everyone cheering for the teams. Word?

Word to the wise for you if you are these people, don't go to a sports bar after work if you don't like sports or the team in the city you work in.  Take your ass down to some trendy hipster bar and pay $12 for a bud light there.  *mic drop* #dubnation
author: Cliff S.

description:
The environment was awesome to watch Sunday football but the service was absolutely terrible. When we first sat down, tables were half full but there was no waitress in sight so we went to the bar to order drinks. When the waitress, Karla, eventually made her rounds she seemed annoyed and disturbed that we chose to grab our own drinks rather than wait for her. It took over an hour for us to place a food order with her...and over 45 min to get nachos. Tables who ordered after us were served before us and actually finished their meals prior to us getting ours or even a simple acknowledgement from the waitress. We had to inquire several times if there was any update on our order.

Once we were ready to go, it took her over 30 minutes to close our tab and forgot which card was ours, most likely the reason for the wait. 

Not sure if they were understaffed or if she was having a bad day but our table was no doubt ignored by the waitress. No remorse for the unexplained wait either.
author: M K.

description: Went here for a company event/happy hour. In love with game concept... so I think it would be perfect with hanging with friends or a first date. Huge varieties of tap beers and decent happy hour prices! (I didn't get a chance to check out the food!) If you order a drink with a server it may take a little longer so I suggest going straight to the bar if you're on a time crunch and with a large group.
author: Breon W.

description:
Since yelp defines 2 stars as "Meh. I've experienced better":

I've been going to sports bars for some years now, and I know what to expect. You get a beer, and hopefully your food comes before halftime. However, GG Tap wasn't great. 

Went there for the season opener of the Dubs. Put in our order at 7PM, and don't get our food for an hour. I know this ain't micky d's, and I'm not expecting super quick service, but a full hour to get our food???

Granted, the server/manager wanted to make it up to us, so ended up comping us a dish. 

2-3 drinks/person + bar food for dinner = $35/head.
author: Nathan K.

description: I love it here! Gets really crowded during happy hour but place is huge. I love their games and their pool tables. Great place to watch a game. Tv's everywhere! 3 floors! Every floor is really big. Great place to meet with friends. A lot of tourists tho, but it's all good. Still like coming here
author: KB B.

description: Really enjoyed this place, good service & it was a fun atmosphere. Right next to a lot of different things. It's just a little loud but if you're going with a big group & wanna play a little pool i would definitely recommend.
author: Elisabeth R.

description: They don't understand sports or how to change channels here. Three tvs on filler for 30 min meanwhile one live game on off to the side?! Pathetic.
author: Rahul H.

description: Had a great time here for the first time.  Great drinks and fun games! Was here during MLB playoffs and crowd was great!
author: Joanne P.

description:
This review is for a small private party I planned for a team offsite. I sent the GGTR an email a few weeks before my requested date, and they responded quickly and helped me build a menu. I ended up having to change the date extremely last minute, and they were able to accommodate us. 

We had a small group (approximately 15-17 people), but we had enough food, and a great server who kept our area clean, and our drinks full. The food was really good, and the space was a great size for us. 

It was my first time here, but I'd definitely come back to watch a game and eat some more of those sliders and short rib tacos.
author: Melissa S.

description:
With the spring season upon us, love is in the air. My friends are all going on dates, and I'm just sitting here with a secret crush on... Golden Gate Tap Room. Well, it's not so secret because I gush about how much I love this place to my friends all. the. time. What can I say? It's been 8 months since my first visit, and I'm still in the honeymoon phase. I hope it's not unrequited! 

I'm a simple kind of girl - give me a huge selection of beers ($6-11), big TVs to watch sports, and some food when I'm feeling buzzed, and I'll be a happy camper. Why can't dating be this easy?

Sorry bougie people, you won't find fancy cocktails here.

It's definitely a mixed crowd, but everyone drinking there is chill. Bartenders at the bar are fast with your orders. One of them even recognized me cause I go so often. Should I be embarrassed or proud!? (Serious question.)

There are a handful of bars I love in the city, but Golden Gate Tap Room is by far my favorite. #LoveYouLongTime
author: Christine S.

description: Three stars for the atmosphere and beer list. I have been siting at my table for 25 minutes and was told that there's only 2 servers working a Friday night shift with major league sport games. Asked the food runner AND busser for someone but got nobody. Maybe some acknowledgement from one of the servers would have prevented me from walking out. Order from the bar people.
author: Hannah C.

description:
My boyfriend and I found this place on yelp and it is awesome!

Initially It was the yelp check in offer that first got our attention. Check in for free nachos! It's perfect for 2-3 people. They drizzle cheese, bacon bits, and green onions all over tortilla chips. Free stuff, especially free food, is awesome, but that's not the only thing that impressed us.

Their TV screens are humongous! It's almost as if you are at the real live game. I'm not a huge sports fan like most Bay Area people are, but I actually really enjoyed watching the Warriors play on those huge screens.

Of course a sports bar has to have pool tables! They are placed right in front of the tv screens (but it's okay since the screens are so huge). We played a few rounds. 1 game costs $2. If you pay $5, you get to play 3 games. These pool and tv screen areas (2 total) can be reserved ahead of time for your group of friends. I would love to celebrate a birthday here!

Other amenities include shuffleboard (this seems to always be taken!), skeeball ($1 per game), a few arcade games, and fooseball.

The bar is really cool too. For those indecisive people, pay $6 to spin the wheel that will help you choose which kind of beer to drink. If you get lucky, you can land on a spot that gives you both a beer and a shot!

I can't wait to tell all my friends about this sports bar!
author: Lincy H.

description: SARAH IS LIKE THE BEST!!! I would honestly give her 6 stars if I could. great service. she is a keeper.
author: Fatima P.

description:
Perfect mix of locals and tourists (which is saying a lot for a bar in Union square). Their happy hour goes til 6, and it's pretty good with $3 shock top and $6 tequila shots. 

Two levels and it fills up pretty fast. They have a bunch of massive tvs on the top floor for all you sports fanatics. Biggest plus side to this place- all the games! We killed at ski ball. Several shuffleboards and pool tables too. Make sure you come with cash! 

Food was pretty decent. Truffle fries were good as were the tacos. 

Overall, I would come back. Not my favorite place, location wise, but atmosphere here is fun and laid back.
author: Steph D.

description: I used to love this place. However now the bartenders are incredibly rude and I wouldn't come back here.
author: Laura C.

description:
ERIC! (Erick? Erik?) With the Cool Shirt! (Death is Certain; Your Life is Not shirt)

Thanks for being a cool dude. Your Moscow Mules were delicious. My date and I really enjoyed ourselves. Keep up the stellar work, man :)
author: Rachel B.

description: First of all.. the food was amazing. Second of all.. if you're looking for a fun place to go on the weekend and have an appetite for yummy greasy American food, this is the place. Plus, they have arcade and video games. Service was fine. Server told me it was better to order from the bar and from there it was fast. Will be back!
author: Nikki K.

description:
Let me start off by saying I've been to this bar multiple times, and each time has been really fun.

Last night, my group of friends and I went to celebrate here since two of them graduated college the same night. We were having fun and keeping to ourselves when two of the security guards came to kick out one of the graduates. She had drunk alcohol and was tipsy, but was keeping to herself at our table and drinking water to sober up. She wasn't causing any trouble to anyone. The two security guards (both Causcasian males, 20-30 y/o, one skinny and one large) kept refusing to listen that it was her graduation night, she was NOT causing any trouble for anyone, and did not give any explanation for why she was being removed. I honestly believe that it was just because she was a small female and they felt like they could do it to her; there were many other graduates and large groups besides us and they weren't bothered.

My group of friends and I won't be coming back here any more unfortunately, which sucks because I really liked this place. But the two guards basically ruined my friends' graduation night.
author: Michael N.

description:
This sports bar is massive! Two floors with TVs galore. There's not a wall, that does not have a TV on it. 

This place has (3) skee ball stations, (4) shuffleboard, over 8 pool tables, modern arcade games, lots of seating, and tons of beers on tap.

Didn't get a chance to try the food but it looked like a great quality selection.
author: Alex G.

description:
If you're looking for beer, wings and to watch a game, definitely hit this place up.  If you're looking to sit down for dinner, keep walking. 

I have come here a couple of times after work for a quick happy hour but have never stayed long because the place is normally pretty packed and there hasn't been a good place to sit and relax.  I will say, the wings are awesome and their beer selection is great.

Ultimately, great sports bar in the area that is worth checking out if you're looking for a place to watch a game.
author: Katie R.

description: Came here to watch a quick Sunday football game on our vacation after the husband did a quick search on Yelp. It's two stories but with lots of seating on both floors. We say at the bar since that's more of my scene. I'm not sure how many taps there are in total but it stretches across the whole bar (I'd say easy 30+) and the bartender we had was quite fun to talk to. I love IPAs, that hoppiness and citrusy flavor does it for me. So it was nice to try several different ones and the bartender was able to recommend different ones based on what I liked. As for the games itself, giant projectors on every single wall. You can't miss any of the games. It's most definitely a place to go to when I come back
author: Grace P.

description:
Bar that has a large selection of beers and also fun games to play.  There are 2 shuffleboard tables, 1 fooseball table, I believe 1-2 pool tables, and also some arcade games.  

There is also another floor at the bar but I think because it wasn't a busy weekend, they closed that section off.  It's pretty easy to rent a shuffleboard table, just leave your ID and credit card and they charge by the minute.  I think it averages about $6 an hour and what's nice is that if you don't play a full hour, they only charge you for how long you've played.

We got a pitcher of beer pretty easily and you have lots to choose from.  It looks like they also do spinning wheel to choose your drink but they weren't doing that on the night I was there.

It's a chill place to come for a few drinks and play some games.  Nothing crazy, just a place to hang out with friends with some light entertainment.
author: Matt K.

description:
This place is so much fun!  It doesn't have ticket games or a prize room like Dave & Busters, but it's got plenty of music, booze, food, sports and bar games to keep you and your friends busy all night!  We played whack-a-gator(?), skeeball, foosball and shuffleboard all while enjoying beers, fries and wings!

The food and the beer came out super quick, and our waitress was very fun and friendly!  I'm not from San Francisco, but if I'm back, this will definitely be a place that I hit up again if I'm in the mood for a fun time with friends!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Excellent atmosphere, bar tenders are great.
So many beer on tap, pool tables, ski ball, 2nd floor good for watching sports with buddies third floor karaoke. Why go anywhere else when everything for you nightlife is here. The bar eats are great a definite must when I visit the city.
author: Eric S.

description: Heard great reviews for this place, we are visiting and wanted cold beer and good food. Although the place was busy, we received poor service. Took over an hour to get our food. Asked a waitress for an update on our order and was ignored. Also talked to a barback and made excuses for our food being late. A couple showed up after us and received food before us..... didn't know wings took so long. It's unfortunate because this place has a great sport vibe.... update, never received food. Wanted to pay tab and left without eating,.... while bartender wanted to over charge for "pitcher" never ordered in the first place. Ran credit card, and refused to give us voided receipt copy.
author: Teresa C.

description: For a sports bar it is a nice divey feeling. Great happy hour crowd. Didn't try to food but overall for drinks and watching sports you can't go wrong here.
author: Kim H.

description:
In the heart of downtown San Francisco is slim pickins. Mostly everything is to catch the eye and wallet of the typical tourist. Golden Gate Taproom was totally that. 

I would come here when the World Cup is playing and I'm rooting for my Portugal. Or maybe if the Brooklyn Nets were in the NBA finals. Or maybe on a lazy and fun Sunday afternoon with friends to just relax and play pool and chat -- which is how I discovered this place.

Overall, it's meh. But they do have a ton of TVs and screens for sports lovers to watch your sports.
author: Priti K.

description:
Awesome place but it gets super crowded with no seats during a Warriors game. We sat by the bar, and when I say "sat," I mean stand by the bar b/c there was literally zero seats. Our bartender, Bryan was the best! Made great drinks, great service. He messed up our order b/c he couldn't hear us but only charged us for what we ordered and gave us shrimp puffs on the house. Then when our order didn't come in, he made us a second order and gave us free drinks. We might come back but maybe when it's not as crowded.

Food was delicious. We order the $17 variety tray of different chicken wings and the truffle fries with two different dipping sauces. Drinks were also on point. I had the Moscow mule and classic margarita. My BF ordered a few random "exotic" beers like chocolate something whatever. I'm not a fan of beer but he liked it.
author: Lily W.

description:
I am so happy I found this place. Not far from Union Square shopping. Big sign reads GOLDEN GATE TAP ROOM. Up a ton of stairs but totally worth the travel and they do have an elevator. Two yes Two floors of drinks, food, sports, comfy seating, arcade games. I felt right at home as soon as I walked in. This place is huge and so is there beer selection. Divided into categories so you can easily find your style of brew be it IPA, Porters, Ales or Stouts, there were at least 10 taps per type of beer. Even cooler than that, The WHEEL OF BEER for those who just cant decide, decked with actual beer bottles of the choices, pay $6 and the bartender spins the wheel. Wherever it lands that's your beer. You also have a chance to win a shot of whiskey too.

Like I said before this place is huge. They reserve what I want to call semi private viewing areas for guest to enjoy more intimate seating to watch the game or just chat with friends and co workers. With large projector style screens and booth seating these are some of the best seats in the house.

As for the food. We ordered from the GAME DAY menu, boneless wings with the sauce of the side 8 bucks and nachos with chicken and bacon $6 bucks. Wings were great, not overly breaded and freshly fried so they were piping hot. Nachos were okay I found the nacho cheese to be cold, kinda disappointing but the beers were also a deal $18 for 4 IPAS. I saw some delicious burgers come out and the street tacos sounded pretty good too. 

Overall Golden Gate Taproom was a pretty good time. Noise level was pretty low despite the music, fans yelling and everyone conversing. The placed filled up pretty quickly after we arrived but service remained quick and friendly. I really really like this place. Now I know where to get my post shopping brew from.
author: Genoa D.

description:
I like this place because its huge and TVs everywhere but if you don't get in by maybe 5pm? or even 4pm there will be a cover charge. It's a bar and its huge, in my opinion there shouldn't be a cover. FYI $10 cover charge. 

Average bar food. Good selection of alcohol. Services varies, totally depending who you have in your section. And barley a line at the womens restroom. haha! Overall its a really good place to hang out with your friends for a Warriors game. 2 levels filled with charis, tables and TVs, which is pretty awesome!
author: Sandy B.

description: A definite tour trap being so close to union square, but also probably the best known sports bar in town. If you are going to watching the Giants, or the Golden State Warriors, this is probably the best venue in town. But you'll need to scout out a table a few hours in advance to get the table on lock. Try any of the beers on tap, or spin the board to land on a random brew.
author: Ross S.

description:
How did I never know about this place? Probably because the outside is small and easy to miss but the inside is huge - think Dave and Busters meets San Francisco.

Even on a busy night (Friday night with a Warriors game), there was still a place to sit (with some work) and not long of a wait at the bar. There are a TON of beer/stout/cider options. The bar food is... bar food, but even a cheese quesadilla tastes pretty good after a couple beers.

With all the huge TV screens, it was a good place to watch a game. Now I'd like to come back and play some games (pool, shuffleboard, skeeball).
author: Cristina S.

description:
I have been here several time now with my husband. Found it randomly while staying at the SIR FRANCIS DRAKE across the street. And we love it. And have to come here at least once on every visit.  It is super low key and chill but has enough room for people to spread out. They have pinball, arcade games, skeeball...and so many tvs!! I love that we can watch all the sports games that are on. We have even brought in baby once earlier in the day for some food and pinball. I love that it's a hidden gem ;)
**tip, on the weekends after a certain time you have to show Id because it is a bar afterall. 
It's safe to say  they have over 60 beers on tap!!!
author: Kimberly P.

description: This place was excellent, but only the environment might not be the best for most people. I personally like that kind of sports bar environment so I was pleased by the atmosphere. The food was excellent we ordered chicken wings, garlic fries, and a alcoholic beverage for 21.00 which is a great price for how much food we had. The service was excellent and our food didn't take long to come out at all. So for my overall review of this place is that if you enjoy the sports bar atmosphere and food from sports bars you'll love it.
author: Ryan R.

description: Crazy crowd during finals but bartenders handles it well.  Jalapeño poppers worth the wait.
author: Amanda J.

description:
I took a star off this review because the service sucked pretty bad. After about 20 minutes and getting our own drinks from the bar, my husband finally went up to a waitress and asked if she could help us. She was wearing a winter coat inside (?) and looked like she hadn't smiled in years. 

We ordered apps thinking we would go eat real food later but liked our food so much we just ended up ordering more apps! Really liked the garlic fries and the fried shrimp. We had a great time people watching and sitting in our dark corner with a view onto the street below. We will be back next time we are in town.
author: Reba B.

description:
Came here for a work gathering the other night and I got to say, the food is great!! I LOVED the fried shrimp it was SOO juicy. The taco was mediocre. The drinks were also okay, not super strong. My favorite part was definitely the shrimp. The chicken wings were also pretty good too! Theres plenty of people here and it was definitely popping when we got here. They play a variety sport games so theres plenty of rowdy guys watching sport games. Theres plenty of post work career men, and they also have some games to be played. I didn't play any of the games, but its definitely quite a chill place. It's like a Dn B but on a smaller level. 

Parking is horrid. Theres no place to park here so if you come, bart, uber, or lyft!!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room is a great non-cheesy (almost) version of a shorts bar in downtown SF! When it comes to sports bars, most have crappy food and smell funky. Golden Gate Tap Room is large enough that it doesn't smell bad, actually has GREAT beers on tap, and is a good food option.

They do have covers for big games here, so be wary. We hosted a company happy hour here with 20+ people and it went swimmingly... there is so much for everyone to do (games)!
author: Kerry G.

description:
A great place to watch a game and chill. The bar is HUGE with two levels and lots of TVs. Finding a sports bar with lots of screens is kinda hard to do in SF. Food is decent; typical bar food. The service is slow when it's somewhat crowded and WAY worse when they're packed. One time we had a server that checked on the table next to us 5 times and never stopped by us and we wanted to order. We finally had to flag her down at which point she said she'd be right back and it still took her 10 minutes. There's a lot of games - pool, shuffle board, etc.. which is fun.

Update 11/7/16 - I'm updating this review from 3 stars to 2. On multiple occasions I have been here, the food takes FOREVER to come out. This past weekend, we waited a good 40-45 minutes after ordering. And then they messed up my order so I had to wait an additional 35 minutes to finally get to eat - even then it came out wrong but I didn't want to send it back again. A note on the brunch menu - it's pretty limited and there aren't any vegetarian options except to order the item without the meat if possible.
author: Lisa D.

description:
This is a cool spot. I came here with my coworkers for a bite to eat and to have a few drinks. Let me just say that if you're a beer fan this place is beer heaven. They have 100+ beers to choose from. I felt like a kid in a candy store. The fact that they also have arcade games and tons of TV's was pretty awesome too. It's a pretty huge place but the seating is somewhat limited. So note to self avoid going in big groups.

As for the food, I had the flame grilled cheese burger with an order of truffle fries. The fries were meh as well as the cheese burger. The burger was way over cooked after having asked for medium-rare. So that was a bit of a let down.

Another thing is that you have to go up to the bar to place your order. Kind of a hassle because the bar area can get pretty packed. So double fist it if you have to.
author: Karina T.

description:
Not bad. 

Probably the best sports bar in downtown. Went here to watch football on a Sunday and they have separate screens available covering most games. Buffalo Wild Wings type of place. Good beer selection as well. Had to dock one star for the fact that there is a pool table right in front of their big-screen TV on the top floor. So while you and 30 friends are tying to watch a game, anyone can walk up and start playing pool, obstructing your view. Staff was unsympathetic to our requests to close the table during games. Odd.
author: Joshua L.

description:
Pretty cool place. I didn't expect much since it's so close to Union Square and the entrance from the street is just a doorway. However, this place is HUGE and has a lot to offer. We met on the top floor where there was an entire wall covered in screens to watch the various games that were on at that time. The food was decent (ordered the sliders) and the service was good. We didn't get to scope out the floor below except for a quick glance as we walked downstairs to exit, but it looked pretty cool too. We were there on a Friday night and it got pretty busy by 6-6:30. If you want a table, get there early. Also, in the back of the top floor was an area that could be reserved (I heard it had a pretty steep minimum though, so it's only good for large groups or those that drink a lot).

Tip: don't come here for a meet and greet (which we did) because it was way too loud to have a really good conversation without yelling and getting a headache. Awesome place to just hang out with friends and watch a game though.
author: Susan G.

description: This experience was horrible. Our waitress took our order, didn't check up on us for an hour and after we complained we were met with attitude. Matt, the manager, then took over for the waitress. He asked us what we ordered to get it moving. Our nachos quickly arrived there after half eaten and cold. We pointed this out to him along with the fact that our pitcher of beer had run out and we did not have any silverware. He asked us if we also wanted cash to go with our order. What a fucking dick. Go fuck yourself matt.
author: Erin V.

description:
Repeat after me: This place is not a sports bar! You do not want to watch the game here because you will not be *able* to watch the game here!

My girlfriend and I showed up here on Sunday, promptly in time for kickoff of the Raiders vs Chargers game. We got seats in front of the big screen and we ordered our drinks and about $50 worth of food.

By halftime, a group of about 30 people were standing in front of us and blocking the TV from every angle imaginable. We talked to the staff, who were polite and friendly, but they couldn't do anything because the birthday party was booked by the owner.

It turns out that the owner of this "sports bar" actually booked a birthday party in the middle of the biggest TV in the bar during the one of the biggest local rivalry games! We watched about 15 Raiders and Chargers fan leave the bar to watch the game elsewhere and, soon, we did too.

At no point did anybody warn us that there was going to be a party in front of the TV. Instead, we were duped into spending good money at the bar and then having the game yanked away from us before halftime.

When we talked to the staff about the disturbance, their hands were tired because it was the owner's group of friends. Additionally, when we talked to the people at the party about trying to stay out of the way of the TV, many were friendly, but the owner *who was there with them* would not talk to us or even make eye contact with us.

This owner has poor priorities and does not know how to run a good sports bar. As an example, do you know what else is in front of the big screen? The pool table.

Also, from what I can see on their website in retrospect, it looks as if they really want to be an events space instead of a sports bar, so maybe that will be better for them.

In short, don't come here if you're interested in watching the game: The space has probably been rented out and you won't be able to watch it here.
author: Charles H.

description:
Not quite your average sports bar, but yet a typical sports bar at the same time. Plenty of tv's all around, so you'll never miss a minute of the game. Plenty of beers on tap for every palette, and arcade games for those not into sport or for the down time during a time out or half time. Need I say more?

Even if I'm not in the Union Square area, I'll tend to recommend meeting at GGTR because you're bound to have a good time and meet everyone's expectations.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Typical.

It's a sports bar full of city locals & tourists. It looks life a fun place, but it's like you typical sports bars with ok food. The place is crawling with sports gear, sports related activities, and sports! Go Sports! Don't get me wrong, I am a fan of sports & I can see where this place would be more festive, but I guess I came at a wrong time because this place didn't seem that enthusiastic about the sports happenings. Anyway, the beer is good & despite it being a sports bar, the glasses they use cause they have pretty funny sayings. You'll have to check it out to see! Anyway, if there was a big game, I would come here, there are 3 levels & it looks like there would be a lot of seating and enough tvs to watch sports! Go Sports!
author: Joyce D.

description:
Beer selection/TVs/games: fantastic. Prices: pretty good. Service: maybe the worst I've experienced at an SF bar. Usually when I've gone the service has just been run of the mill bad, but my visit yesterday was truly awful. Among other things: 

-When a patron asked the bartender to recommend a good bourbon + something to pair it with, he made fun of the guy. Said "We have a lot of bourbons and a lot of 'somethings', so just pick one." 

-I showed up 30 mins before the World Series and asked a different bartender if he could put the game on a certain TV for me. He told me that they couldn't switch channels to a game until it was on (no one was viewing the TV I requested). I asked if he could at least promise to put the game on when it started, to which he told me to return to the bar at the start time and ask again. This is absurd; I've never seen a sports bar do this, ever. 5 minutes before game start we had to flag someone else down, who reluctantly put on the game for us.

-I asked if the third floor was going to be open, and the bartender shrugged his shoulders at me and said he didn't know/urged me to get on with my drink order. (The whole concept of a sports bar is: I'm paying a markup for drinks in exchange for you putting my game on. So the 'game' part is kinda important.)

-Servers demanded credit cards upfront as soon as we sat down, which may not be typical but is fine. Except that they also refused to switch the cards over that we had already put down at the bar. So we had to run to the bar, try to close out, and give the servers those cards in the middle of the game.

While SF doesn't have many good sports bars, I'm not wasting another dollar at GGTR. Service is prohibitively bad and ruins the experience.
author: Brian R.

description:
I was visiting SF and my friend who lives in the city brought me here for a drink.  The first thing I noticed as we walked up the stairs to the bar is that this was an absolute sports bar.  As soon as we got inside I noticed tons of Tvs and projectors showing the football games, it was a playoff weekend, so it was pretty darn crowded.  Besides not being able to grab a table this place was awesome!!  They have an amazing beer selection and it's nice that they have it separated by the type of beer which makes choosing a beer a lot easier. 

I was actually able to come here the next day, but we were warned that if we wanted a good seat we had to show up before the placed opened up...boy am I glad that I took the advice.  We showed up 15 minutes prior to opening and there was already two groups ahead of us.  By the time they opened the line was down the block.  So once we had a great seat, it was time to order food!  We tried the nachos, fries and wings (typical bar food).  While it wasn't the best it was good enough.  

What really made this place was the ambiance that all of the Tvs, sports memorabilia, arcade games, and even some shuffle boards created.  This is honestly a fantastic place to come to grab some beers, hang with friends and watch some sports.  Oh yeah, the pitchers ranged from $18-21 depending on the kind of beer you get.
author: Jesus H.

description:
We wanted to watch the World Cup and my friend recommended this place. It was an excellent choice. The place is less than a year old and definitely look fresh and new. There are a lot of televisions and seating for some prime time sports watching. There are a variety of sizes of television sets and seating - booths/tables/bar seating. They have a good selection of alcohol and snacks. Mostly bar food. The waitresses are pretty attentive and the prices aren't too bad. 

Nice spacious restrooms. 

They also have gaming stations from hunting to tekken. 

Check in on yelp for some free NorCal nachos. =D
author: Sarah C.

description:
This sports bar is awesome! I love how big and spacious it is.
They have lots of games from skeeball, to shuffleboard, pool, and some arcade games.
They have a lot of screens to watch sports on too. 
I love the location. It's right by Union Square. The building has an old San Francisco feel to it. I Love it.
author: Edie G.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room is very cool place to watch a game or grab a (reasonably priced) drink. I met bachelor #952 (just kidding) there and we sat at the bar. What I don't understand is why the bartenders kept asking to see everyone's stamp on the hand. Shouldn't they trust that the bouncer properly stamped people at the entrance?

After a couple of drinks, I was feeling hungry and we ordered boneless barbeque wings and a beef quesadilla to munch on. I don't know if it's because I already had a buzz; I thought the food was super tasty! I almost wanted to order more to eat but I didn't since I wasn't planning on paying.

Everything was going well until the bouncer literally pulled the stool from under me. It was still fairly early (~10pm on a Friday) and he was determined to remove all of the seating from the bar. I definitely took that as a hint that it was time to leave.
author: Yi Z.

description: I would never come here again and left before finishing my meal. I had to go to the bar for service while sitting at a table. Every food item or drink i ordered took 30 minutes to get to me and server only stopped by every 15 minutes. Bad service, bad food, no drinks equals bad time.
author: Michael G.

description: This is a great place to escape the hectic SF streets. Yummy food, drinks and friendly staff. If I could I would go every night, I would. Love the vibe!
author: Sarah D.

description: Game day snacks are cheap! TV Screens for football on every single wall! This is the place to go for game day.
author: Eva L.
Vee V.

description: Terribly run. On the first NFL Sunday, they are understaffed, using new software, you have to get in line to get beer and food (which took 30 minutes).
author: Alex P.

description: Security guards kicked us out when it was 1:20 and we had 2 pitchers left.  'Nuff said.
author: Jingsong W.

description:
Sat at side bar table and waited almost 30 mins before service. Waitress was great, but she had a whole floor during a SF Giants playoff game. Calamari and wings were cold. Food sucks here, but its a sports bar. 

Late at night, a whole bunch of prostitutes hang out in front of this place and the cops just watch drinking coffee across the street. I don't get it. The gals will talk and walk with you down the street in heels and skirts and they are cute and nice, but cant believe that SFPD doesn't shu them away. Crazy!
author: Brian A.

description:
I was so excited to try this place, but was so disappointed, for multiple reasons! First, a "tap room" typically implies a place with expertise in craft beer. A couple of the rotating taps were out, whereas others were beers easily secured in the local supermarket. I even asked about one, in particular, and was told it was a "sour", but it was a saison that I know is not sour. Again, maybe small differences to some, but for those big into beer and expecting that type of treatment at a "tap room", it was disappointing. Not to mention, our beer took 30 minutes to come out of the bar....

Then, the food. It also took forever, and then, two orders came out - neither of which were correctly made (these were not complicated changes!). The person who brought it then implied that we must have placed two orders, and that it was on us to notify our server of the change to our bill needing to be made. 

Lastly, the person who brought our food offered to bring the ingredient missing from my plate, assuring me it would not cost extra. Twenty minutes later, it came, after I ate the burger... and we were charged extra for it. At this point, I just wanted out of here desperately. 

I don't even know. This review is a mess, because this place was truly a mess. I would recommend figuring out an identity (if it were marketed as a "sports bar", not a "tap room", I would have had a different reaction to the beer situation), and cleaning up the food service substantially.  Very disappointing.
author: Casey Z.

description: not much to say that hasn't already been said. great place to meet up with colleagues etc to watch any sort of sporting event. i didn't try the food. i had just one gin and tonic and it felt watered down...more like a gin soda water.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Just do drinks the food is tasteless and cold I won't order here again the service is fairly slow too not bad if your super buzzed when you land
author: Steve M.

description:
Security was keeping a watching eye on me and my friends. Food was ok, nothing special.
Service was ok. Pretty loud music but hey thats the occasion.
author: Maria R.

description:
Came here for happy hour (don't think they actually have happy hour prices but that was the time of day I stopped in). Really fun place to watch any game on tv. Stayed here for a few hours watching some football game and had a great time. This was my second time here and It was even better this time around. 

Ended up ordering 3 different beers at the bar and sitting closer to the pool tables watching the game on the big screen. We were there so long we ended up ordering food which was exactly what I needed. We decided to split a few things so naturally we got the mac and cheese, chicken fingers, and a bahn mi chicken wrap - all were really really good. The mac was super creamy and amazing. 

My only complaint is that the servers that walk around were not the most friendly. We asked them if they took drink orders and they said no we had to go order at the bar which i thought was a little strange but it was busy so I get it, still kind of a weird experience as a customer. 

Also when we went up to grab another beer at the bar, the server took our food away! i was not even close to being done - the mac and cheese was only half way gone. i'm sorry but does anyone leave half of their mac and cheese ever? the answer is no. There was also another chicken finger and a few more bites of my half of the wrap. I was not happy but i got over it.

Overall, it is a very fun sports bar with a good beer selection and a fun environment. I'm sure i'll be back again.
author: Ilana B.

description:
I've been here a total of two times. The first time would have garnered a four star review if only because our waitress at the time was a bit flustered. She took a while to get to us and forgot to put in some of our orders, but otherwise was a really sweet girl and Betti apologetic. As someone who used to be a server for a larger chain restaurant, I understand that everyone had an off day, so I don't blame her. It was beer week and things were crazy, and they had run out of the stout I really wanted to try. 

The second time really made up my mind to give this spot a five star review. I went in on a Sunday night and it was pretty empty. I was even told by the staff that it wasn't normally like that, buy it did steadily get a bit more busy throughout the night. The bartenders were awesome. I never caught their names, but our first bartender was a gentlemen with glasses and a hat, and be recommended my first beer to me, even giving me a taste. I've never really liked porters, but the one he had me try was very good ! Our second bartender, and the one that stayed with us most of the night was a very tall gentleman in a vest. I believe he mentioned that he was from Atlanta! He was awesome and had great recommendations for me as well. 

The jalapeno poppers and the calamari were great, but the rib nachos fell a bit short ( ha ha cuz they were short ribs. Get it? I'm not sorry ). Overall, the food gets a four from me, but it was pretty typical bar food anyway. I wasn't expecting anything super gourmet. 

The vibe is great, the staff is awesome, and the food is decent. A great spot to play some arcade games and drink beer with the gang, or even for a super casual first date ( for beer lovers ! ).
author: Christine H.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon with some coworkers. Walk up the stairs to get to the first floor and you'll find arcade games, ski ball, and shuffle boards. Also, there are countless tvs and big screens around the room. There is a second floor, but I didn't get to check it out. 

The reason why i left one star off is because the service is lacking. It seemed as though they had plenty of staff, but many of them standing idle doing nothing. Chatting with their friends, sipping a fountain drink, or walking around not greeting any customers. It also takes awhile to get tables cleared. There were about 3 to 4 people behind the bar and it took about 10 min to order a drink (the bar wasn't even crowded). With their service lacking, I can say that when you do get service, they are friendly. 

They also serve food. Their "bunch of fries" is a little misleading. It says "onion rings, truffle fries, garlic fries" which led me to think the order came with all three (i'm a natural fat ass. LOL). Anyway, you had to pick one. Nevertheless, the fries were good and the sauces that came with it was supplementary. 

Overall, great place with very sporty decor, games, and huge tvs. I hope their service picks up and staff are more attentive to their customers.
author: Jenna T.

description:
This is my second visit to this place and I just love it. 

1. Lots of space, multiple floors, to mingle around and find your spot. 
2. Always a fun and hip crowd (mid-to late 20's and above). 
3. Decent bar food if you're going straight after work. 
4. It's a perfect place for a game night -- lots of TV screens to watch the big game. 
5. The staff is SUPER friendly!

Definitely a place to hang out!
author: Tré S.

description:
New FAVORITE sports/dive bar /games/hangout spot in Downtown SF! 

1.) It's HUGE. 4 full floors of hundreds of TV's, bars, people, etc. Everyone who comes in is amazed and mouth-opening awestruck by how huge it is for the city. It's like stepping into Narnia.
2.) It has $1 skeeball, pool, video games, sports statues, shuffleboard, etc. I'm in love.
3.) $5-6 beers and $6 bar bites (really good quality food like truffle fries, short rib tacos, chicken quesadilla, wings, burgers, etc.
4.) It's super clean and not dirty divey, though in a nice fun way without being boughiey (is that a word / spelling?) or overly fancy.
5.) It's next to Union Sq in the best possible location. 

Let's go! Free skeeball and shuffleboard butt whoopings from yours truly.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Great place to watch football! We were across the street at the Sir Francis Drake hotel and we're talking to some Seahawks fans trying to find a place nearby to watch the game. A woman happened to walk by and recommended this place and said it was a hidden gem. 

We were surprised when we walked up the stairs- the place is huge! Tons of tv's everywhere and also some cool couches to sit on in front of the big screen.

I did think the service could have been improved, we rarely saw our waitress and kept having to go to the bar to get our drinks and food. I overheard one of them saying they were short staffed.
author: Elaine Tiffany P.

description: My boyfriend and I came here visiting the city and were highly satisfied with the crowd and service. There was a wide variety of games to play with a great beer selection. We didn't come to watch a game, but venue was large with lots of tvs ! Highly recommend when nearby :)
author: Katie G.

description: If your looking to watch a Warriors game, this is the place to be. There was a line and cover charge of $10, standing room only. This is a locals spot/ dive nothing fancy but great vibes. Tons of different beers served. The only reason it's getting 4 star is because the lines to get a drink were so long it took a whole quarter to get a pitcher. More bar tenders would be great especially during play off times. Also never buy just one beer always get a pitcher and avoid peeing at half time or when the quarters end. Lines are crazy
author: Lorna N.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room is one of the great gems in San Francisco. It's one of the few places in the city where I can beat both friends and strangers alike at foosball, pool, air hockey and shuffleboard IN THE SAME NIGHT! Just kidding.. I usually lose. Luckily their full bar + massive beer selection makes losing that much easier (take it as you will). Here's the Chris notes:

+ Full bar: Pitchers are around $20, no formal cocktail menu but my orders are usually between $8 - $14, smart ass remarks are on the house

+ TONS of space: 2 floors, 2 full bars, 2 stages of awesomeness. Great place to bring large groups. Get there early if you're watching a game / fight / etc. to grab a table because the place fills up.

+ Food: Offered but I'm usually on a liquid diet when I come here.. You know.. Beer, whiskey, etc.

+ Bar games: Pool, foos, shuffleboard, air hockey, etc. It's like a mini D&B without that "kid friendly" nonsense during the day time (I've never actually come here during the day but I can imagine). 

Many pitchers have been won and lost on these battle grounds. The good news is that everyone becomes a winner after a certain point of the night. Swing by, grab a pitcher and watch some sports on one of their massive projectors.
author: Chris W.

description: Place gets busy. Don't expect to get a seat but they have decent prices on drinks and a decent amount of games to keep you amused inside. It's deff a place you have to check out at least once if your in sf.
author: Alonzo T.

description: Happened to walk into the bar on accident, but it ended up being a good accident. Great selection of beer and lots to choose from. I didn't stay long enough to eat, but I was tempted to make new friends and sample from random people's plates :). This place had a good selection of arcade games to entertain you, along with giant screens to watch the 49ers lose on since no one obviously goes to the games, and you need plenty of beer to drown your sorrows lol. Awesome bar!
author: Mark S.

description: Great place is only good for beer, watching games and even playing games. I wouldn't ever eat anything here again.
author: O K.

description:
Kind of reminds you of DnBs, besides the lack of arcade games but it's a popular happy hour spot for locals and conveniently located near Union Square to cater to tourists.

Happy Hour beers (till 7pm) were $4, and in the words of a tourist from Orange County, "WTF? That's no deal!". Yea well, this is SF and any craft pint for $5 or less is a deal to me. All those new craft beer bars/pubs are charging $7-$10 for a pint now. Meh! Price point aside, they do have a better than average craft beer selection for mostly $6, enough to satisfy those who are new to California's craft brew scene but you can now also walk half a block down to Hogwash or to Hopwater Distribution for an expanded and impressive craft beer selection.

Expect average to mediocre worthy bar food. My buffalo wings were dry and the popcorn shrimp were okay when doused in sauce.

Place appears to be managed by Cantonese? A bit odd for a sports bar in my mind but this is SF after all.

Gotta try the Wheel of Beer next time, these are always fun!

ISSUES I encountered:
Playing music from the digital Jukebox. The jukebox vendor has an impressive amount of tunes, even EDM tunes! Except upon playing one song, the bartenders promptly reset the music since it wasn't to their liking, a waste of a few bucks.

Skeeball, middle lane ate a dollar but the downstairs manager managed to help out, think it was a mechanical error since it played fine afterwards.
author: Steven C.

description:
Why the low reviews?! I actually like this place. It's a go-to for all the Warriors Games even though the line outside gets a bit ridic out the door. Once you step in though, you'll realize that the place is ginormous. Every floor is FILLED with TVs, projectors, and games (video games, shuffleboard, skeeball)! Lots of young working people and millennials... right up my alley, I guess.

Crowded places always means slow service though. Expect to stand at the bar for awhile trying to wave down a bartender. The upside is that drinks are avg price ($5-7) and you can grab a pitcher for less than $25. Honestly, it's not bad. I'll find myself coming back here to cheer on the Dubs for the rest of the season along with hundreds of others at GGT.
author: Sally C.

description:
Dave & Buster's-esque? 

Ummm, there's a grand spanking total of...

TWO. ARCADE. VIDEO. GAMES. http://bit.ly/1aEfiyH

"Adult arcade" my (    I    ). Unless, I missed the "happy ending" section?

OTHER NOTES
*From the owner of Lori's Diner mini-chain and Sear's Fine Food.
*Golden Gate Tap Room is just another sports bar for tourists (think Jillian's) and is NOT "Dave & Buster-esque" as advertised by the media. 
--Movie theaters have more arcade video games than Golden Gate Tap offers.
--They do have pool tables, foosball, skeeball, shuffleboard, and tons of TVs though.  
*Full bar with over 100 beers with plenty of beers on tap.
