*Reasonable pricing for a touristy area; most beers and small bar bites are under $7.
*Very spacious venue (200+ capacity) that can accommodate large groups. 
*3 stars is for donating part of their revenue to charity. I'm a sucker for charitable efforts.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Great place to sit down and be ignored by servers. It has potential, plenty of variety of beers, fun atmosphere. Several servers have passed by but in 25 minutes not a single one has stopped to 1st "just a minute" let alone take my order.  Bartenders friendly enough. Interesting place with bad service = I won't be back. Too many other choices in the area.
author: John D.

description: I signed up with a yelp account just to give this bar 1 star. These guys lost my driver's license after I gave it to them to check out the shuffle board discs. Now have to go to the DMV and get a new one. Fuck you Golden Gate Tap Room.
author: Matthew F.

description:
The place is great! Close to union square! Where basically most people are in San Francisco. Perfect set up for a sports bar. Great workers. And very big! Only drawback, you can't see ufc fights here. 

Great place to watch and live sports event. The food is exceptional, typical sports bar food. They have a lot of beer on draft, I think from 30-40. So if you're a beer person come here. Pool tables, tvs everywhere, ski ball, and even some video game machines, street fighter!

Late night the Juke box comes on. Not as loud as other places but you can tell what's going on. Open late! Haven't had a bad experience here. And if you forgot your charger, they have a charging station. 

The place is huge, even when there is a lot of people there's places to sit and you won't bump elbows with people. Will def keep visiting.
author: Gustavo A.

description: A great place to catch up with friends over a nice cold beer and arcade games. I love their extensive beer list, nice bartenders, and ample space. Afterwards, walk down one block to Union Square to take some funny, drunken pictures!
author: C C.

description:
This should be a regular stop for anyone in SF.  Came in tonight, and the place was packed.  That didn't stop Eric from providing excellent service every step of the way.

If I ran a restaurant or bar, I'd recruit him immediately.  Thank you Golden Gate Tap Room and Eric for a great evening.  Unexpectedly great service!
author: Joe B.

description:
This place doesn't get old. 
This is my friends & i current hang out spot.
The sell food, appetizers, and drinks. 
Food is good
Fast paced to get your drinks.
Great ambience. Just by the end of the night (12p-2am)there could be drunk fights. But security easily kicks them out.
author: Jocelyn R.

description: Great sports bar. About 60 beers on tap. Tons of games and tvs everywhere u look. Come early to get a table before any big game. It gets PACKED here. I usually come two hours early to snag a table and just order food and play games until the game starts. Lots of fun to be had with friends from shuffleboard to basketball, skeeball, Pool, arcade games, etc.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Where to begin! Who knew a place like this existed! It's pretty darn huge! We came around...9:45, just as a warriors game was ending, oh boy you better come early if you are planning to watch the game. if you come just as it ends, it's actually perfect too! because everyone usually leaves!

We had to wonder around for awhile but snagged a pretty large table in the back of the second floor. Then as more people left we were around the couches by the pool tables. 

The only thing that kind of irked me was when I tried to place an order with a waitress and she said oh at the bar...BUTTTTT the other tables around me, were placing and getting orders from her!!! What a bitch. -___-

but it's ok, because the bartenders are nicer...well the larger guy with a funny mustache was really nice. He had a Golden Boys Pizza tshirt on and THATS where we munched afterwards!

I think shots weren't TOO expensive. But we'll probably be back! Great spot to have bdays!
author: Christine M.

description:
Located right off the main drag of Powell this place aims squarely at the tourist market and for the most part hits it dead on. 
It's multi level and offers skee ball, pool and those basketball dunk game thingys with tons and tons of televisions. In other words, it's a sports bar.
There's tons of beer on tap, although at any given time a half dozen or so taps will be out, there's still the other 94 or so to chose from, and the odds are good that you'll find something you'll like.
The food is at best mediocre and at the worst completely inedible. I've had mixed results from the staff, sometimes they are pretty hep, other times they are just doing time until they get off and can do something they actually want to do, and it totally shows in their treatment of you.
This is a decent place to go with friends, drink some beer, get loud and mess around on some games or watch a game.
To summarize, bad food, cold beer, sports bar
If that's what you're looking for this is the place. 
Make no mistake though, there's much better places to drink in SF.
author: Steven W.

description: Typical bar food and bar atmosphere. Kind of like a small Dave and Busters with bar games and lots of TV's. Dirty and loud but big selection of craft beers. Had a few appetizers and they're all fried so starter food selection is nothing special but you there mostly for the games and beer. Mac and cheese was extremely disappointing!!
author: Tiffany Z.

description:
Ok so.  If you're here, you need to be here for reasons.  Don't just go here on a whim.

1) You're a bro.  Welcome.  These are your people.
2) You're a drunk college kid.  Welcome.  These are your people. (Spin that stupid wheel)
3) You're a visiting Silicon Valley guy and your company made a reservation here for your big mixer.  Welcome. This huge cordoned off area with beer tabs on the floor and the projector screen directly overhead and the speaker blasting into your area... will CONTAIN your people.
4) You're here to watch Sportsballs.  Welcome.  These are your people.
5) You're already drunk and you're waiting for your piano show to start nearby.

Prices weren't horrible ($7 for a craft beer, $8-11 for good imports).  Service wasn't horrible (even though it was packed).  Appetizers were flat out disappointing, and a little nauseating, honestly.

Skip the complimentary nachos with check in (See nausea, listed above).  Only head here if you fall into one or more of the five groups mentioned above.
author: Lacey C.

description:
Good food; very busy and a bit expensive. Great beer selection.

It's up several flights of stairs, and seating was hard to come by. Service was iffy, and they couldn't give me a copy of my receipt when the waitress cleared our table and took my copy with her, but they were able get a reprint after 20 minutes.

Lots of drunk people, which means they over-serve people. I'd go back, but I'd bring cash and not go on game night.
author: Jacob H.

description: Endless options of beers! Cool hangout for friends. Great entertainment.  Beers are cold as ice. Didn't have food but who needs food when you have icy cold beers.  Ask for Brian for an in-depth conversation of beers and history.  His knowledge will blow your mind.
author: Eve J.

description: Great drinks and trust me on this lot of freaking options and love the size of their TV, for anyone who loves sports this is the bar you wanna go and watch your fav team play. Love going here.
author: Bimarsh S.

description:
Check my credit Card the next day- find the bar charged my card again without my approval. They charged me additional $7. The bartender was so lost when I closed my tab, he asked me how many beers I had so he could charge me. Apparently the bartender didn't believe me and charged me again. Let's see if they will actually fix this or if I have to make an complaint with my CC. CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD FOR UNAUTHORIZED CHARGES

.......issue was easily resolved by management.
author: Neil R.

description:
I'm going to give it a four for MY experience. 

First, this is not an area to drive to. Downtown SF, a bar, tipsy friends, trying to find parking? Probably not the place to drive to. We took the muni from south San Francisco and it was quick walk after getting off at Powell. Much better to muni/bart in rather than attempt to find parking. 

We went to watch the Warriors play the Rockets. 

We had a big group and we also managed to snag a table which was pretty lucky as we got there around 5. Good WARNING: If you come here for a public event of some sort ie basketball games/sports watching you should come early or suffer having to stand around. Watching people try to chat and hold pitchers of beer at the same time looked quite sad. 

So we were there about a hour and a half early, but good company made it fun. 

Our waitress was really nice and let us know since it was going to be a busy night that it may take awhile but that we wouldn't be forgotten. Upfront honesty like that is always appreciated. 

Our group got garlic fries and nachos, everyone seemed to enjoy them. Between everyone people got hard ciders, ipa, and different pitchers of beer. I'm not an IPA fan...but the guys enjoyed it.

Honestly the atmosphere was really good for lack of words. It wasn't sketchy or divey and even with us all watching the game and it being EXTREMELY packed I never felt unsafe being there. It was actually a really enjoyable bar to be in, the energy was really exciting even with me not being a basketball fan. 

I would definitely come back and watch a game here again. A very enjoyable experience for me.
author: Jay K.

description:
Service was amazing! Drinks on HH? Also awesome! Food...only so-so.

Came here on a Monday afternoon before having to head to the airport. There wasn't many people, so service was quite quick. We grabbed 2 seats at the bar since the pool tables were taken. 

The bartender was attentive and gave us their full beer list. The menu is pretty extensive, and they had some good selection on there that I have not seen before. The downside...they were out of everything I wanted to try! So I was disappointed in that.

We also got nachos. Besides the fact that they had that "liquid gold" cheese, there wasn't much nor didbit taste awesome. There was barely any bacon in it, so that can be improved.

I can't really give a proper review as I wish I came in during a game. It is spacious and definitely enough TVs for anywhere you sit or stand. Defo give this plave a try!
author: Jane F.

description:
I would normally give this spot 3 stars but I'm pumping it up to 4 because of two things.
1) The waitress was super helpful and friendly.  She was proactive and anticipated what our needs were.
2) They have a wide range of different beers on tap including my favorite - Belching Beaver's peanut butter milk stout.

The location is convenient and the have pinball, skeeball, and other games going on, along with several large tvs broadcasting the Olympics.  Nothing else really stands out and aside from it's gimmick being a sports bar with games, it's an average watering hole.
author: Tammie S.

description:
A random girl handed me her drink as she was getting kicked out. 4.5 stars

The staff is always clearing dishes to maintain a clean look. They also have a sense of humor when we wanted to hold onto a plate with only two fries left. Every. Starch. Counts.

Lots of games and tv screens to watch games.
author: Linh P.

description: We went in for lunch and to watch a football game. The bartender only got half our order in and wasn't helpful when we went back to get it fixed. Overall service was pretty poor. The food isn't that great either. They did have multiple TVs with different games on though. I wouldn't recommend it or return.
author: Carly F.

description:
Came here after work to welcome our team from Japan to the city. Typically I like this place, never had much of an issue but will never be back. This review is for the tool of a "security guard" who feels the need to publicly shame a group of people who have absolutely no idea what you are saying. 

A few of the people with us had forgotten their passports at home and we're not aware they wouldn't be allowed to drink since they were let in. A few minutes after beer was brought to our table, security walks up to one of our visitors and starts chastising him about not having a stamp and how he was already informed at the door he would not be able to drink. The entire time this poor guy has no idea what is being said to him as security tries to kick him out. 

I called the guy over and explained they are from Japan and speak hardly any English (something you think they would be used to in such a touristy area). I was condescendingly told how he would have to check with his associates since it was "so busy" on a Wednesday night and he had no problem kicking us all out and clearing our table up. 

As the guy was gone we try and explain to our group exactly what is going on, meanwhile our friend from Japan is sweating bullets thinking he may be getting arrested. Once security comes back he feels the need to make everyone from Japan without a stamp raise their hands up in the air, again they have no idea what he is saying, and makes the one guy in particular raise his hands all the way up as high as he can so people can see they don't have a stamp. They are foreign not stupid and certainly not children. 

I understand the law and the rules, however, instead of making yourself look like a complete ass, try and understand exactly what is happening. Our company pays for us to do these types of events as team building but in the future our money can be better spent elsewhere. We ended up leaving early and closing are tab sooner rather than later. 

Rant over.
author: Nate S.

description: We've been here a few times and have always enjoyed it. They have great service. All the bartenders are friendly, quick and efficient. They hustle and are able to get your order from three or four people deep from the bar. They are pretty amazing at how they'll yell out to you as soon as you make eye contact so be ready to order. I know that can be kind of hard with their huge selection of beer but read the menu and get your order ready. The food is actually decent too! We've had everything from the Fries, Sliders, Calamari, Tacos and Wings. You order and they give you a number stand to place near you and just hang out and don't worry. They will find your number no matter how busy it is. If you're looking to catch a game or just play some arcades while hanging out or if you have a large party gathering for a birthday, Golden Gate Tap Room is your place. They have two floors so it's big and they can accommodate big groups.
author: Jen L.

description: The atmosphere is great but the food took long and came out cold. I have been here a few times and this was a first. Not sure if it's the staff but disappointed.
author: Marc A.

description: Found this place while strolling around Union Square.  Fell in love after 10 minutes of being there. Tons of really cool games to choose from. Shuffleboard, skeeball, pinball, smash the alligators. SO MUCH FUN!  Everything seemed to be maintained really well. We didn't have drinks here so I can't comment on the service, but I really appreciated the water coolers throughout the bar.  Will definitely come back for drinks and more fun.
author: Melinda D.

description: One of my favorite sports bars, and it seems to be the same for many others, it's a great place to watch games, lotsa tables and couches and big TVs, plus a ton of games like skee ball, pool, buck hunt, and the one where you slide discs across a sand surface, there's 2 levels too, a pretty big selection, so many I had never had before, and the food was pretty solid, i tried the quesadilla which was very big and the nachos were also good, on a non warriors game night it was kinda dead but I could still appreciate it
author: Daniel S.

description: Golden Gate Tap Room is one of those places I want to love but just can't.  Sure, there are plenty of games and a ton of beer on draft but the place just doesn't do it for me.  Walking in, this bar is massive, and also sticky.  I found myself there recently and felt like I was walking in mud my shoes were sticking to the nasty floor, It was first thing in the morning so this makes me assume that they don't do a great job mopping up after a messy night.  The beer selection is extensive, but the prices are a bit more expensive compared to other spots in the area ($6-$10/draft).  The games are fun and I am sure this would be a great happy hour work spot but unless you get there early most of the games are taken for a majority of the night.  I haven't tried the food but my friends have and said it was pretty sub par.  Worth a stop for happy hour (Monday - Friday until 6PM) for cheaper beers, otherwise, there are better options in the area.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Best place to watch a game around Union Square... 2 floors of space with plenty of TV's and other fun game room toys to make it a great place...
Get here early for your seats...
author: Tony H.

description: This my favorite gameday bar in the city! 2 floors and 2 bars! Yes! On the second floor they have a couch area to sit in! Yes you have to get there early to get that set up! The beer selection is awesome! The sitting arrangement can be challenge if you dont get there early. They have tons of TVs to accommodate what everyone wants to watch. They have arcade like games that you can play in between rounds or while you are waiting for the beer line to go down! This place is adult chucky cheese for adults that serves awesome beer! If you are looking for an awesome environment to watch the big game at! You have found your home!
author: Kyle W.

description:
My team made reservations for a lunchtime happy hour before the holidays and had a space on the 3rd floor reserved for us. This place is really nice for a sports bar. Clean, lots of space and seating, and there are arcade games and pool tables. And big TVs for those of you watching sports.

The service was really good too. Can't comment on how it is during normal bar hours, but our server came around frequently to check up on our drinks and to take orders for food. He even joked ar

The food here is pretty standard bar food - nothing fancy but definitely not bad either. My group had a variety of food, all of which were pretty good for bar food (I've definitely had much worse). There's nothing I'd recommend in particular, but I don't think you could really go wrong with anything they have. Just depends kind of bar food you like. There's also a really good selection of alcohol (beer, wine, ciders, hard liquor).

==========

-SLIDERS - Pretty good. Meat was cooked well
-SHORT RIB TACOS - Pretty decent too, but I liked the sliders better. I added the tomatoes and scallions from the nachos since these tacos just had meat and some cheese.
-BONELESS CHICKEN WINGS - Average. A little dry on the inside, but the outside was nice and crispy (and surprisingly not greasy). We had hot sauce, BBQ and ranch dipping sauces
-BONE-IN CHICKEN WINGS - Also average. Greasier than the chicken tenders but not as dry on the inside.
-NACHOS - Average. The bacon, tomato and scallions make for nice toppings, but the nachos get gross and soggy if it sits in the cheese for too long
-ONION RINGS - Nice and crunchy.
-SWEET POTATO FRIES - Average. Thick fries
-GARLIC FRIES - Average. Thin fries
author: Jessie L.

description: A co-worker kept telling me about this place and I finally got a chance to check it out after a recent company party because it was nearby.  For them to handle hundreds of us showing up at once, was awesome and showed what great service they had.  This place is huge which is great because there aren't many places in the city we can go.  They had happy hour on the beer where pitchers were $15.  We ordered the steak skewers and nachos.  The steak skewers seem a little overpriced for the amount you get but both items were very tasty.  They have huge screens and were playing the Thursday night football game.  Very cool place to hang with co-workers or catch a game.
author: Amanda K.

description:
1 star for : Great selections of beer. 

1 star for : very chill ambiance with dim lighting and a few old arcade options (pinball, pacman etC). 

1 star: pretty large space. great place for a big group. 

-1 star: Bartenders sorta suck. Per boyfriend, he made multiple eye contact with the bartender  but they were slow to acknowledge/approach him......When a bar is not super busy, it shouldn't take 10 minutes for a dude to get his BEER. 

-1 star: ....read above, any BAR with lazy or standoffish bartenders = lame. Wish they were more friendlier. 

we were prepared to drink a ton that night  but due to the annoying bartender, we bounced and found the Rye.
author: peachpie p.

description: Awesome beer selection! The old resputan porter is delicious if you like dark beers with a strong coffee aftertaste which I happen to love. Cool vibe, pool tables, trendy but casual. Didn't try their food, just went for a quick drink after sightseeing with my girls!
author: Melissa M.

description:
This place is huge! GGTR can best be summed up in list form:

Yays:
Big TVs for games
Huge beer selection + wine + ciders +++
Skeeball - 9 balls for 4 quarters
Pool tables
Shuffle boards
Lots of comfy seating for small to large groups
Two stories where 2nd floor has all the fun stuff and 3rd floor is for dancing I think
Great hours for after-work to late crowds
Great service, great servers - don't forget to tip 'em :)
Close to Powell bart station

Nays:
Slow elevator that may sometimes break
Street parking only (of course)
Only 2 stall women's restroom (for such a large place, this is no bueno)
author: Sarah W.

description: Lots of TVs, beers, games (shuffleboard, arcade games, pop shot, etc.), and food.  Great beer selection.  Food is your typical bar food (wings, calamari, etc.), so wouldn't come here just to eat.  Great for groups.  Have been here from a range of small group of friends to an office party (rented entire venue) and had a great time.  One of my favorite sports bars in nob hill area.
author: Kevin N.

description: Dirty, terrible service, nasty food and cockroaches. Dives are cool, but usually the food is decent and the service is mediocre. This place - none of the above. Just don't go.
author: Jen S.

description:
Best place to catch a live game. I was here to watch the warriors game yesterday and had a great time!
They have large wall screens and a bar which comes with equally good appetizers. I am not going anywhere else in sf to watch a game, this is it!

Tip: if watching a big game, make sure to get here 2-3 hours in advance. 
Or, you will have a hard time finding a table ;)
author: Neil S.

description:
Awesome place with wity huge screans and projector to watch sports. 
The drinks are appetizers are great. 
It's kind of surprising to find such a cool spot so close to China town
author: Juliana B.

description: Perfect to watch games, good food and plenty of beers, but just awful service.
author: Markus U.

description: If you're going to charge $10 cover for the SuperBowl viewing... at least fix your crappy speakers so we can hear shit. Worse ever.
author: Eddy X.

description: There's nothing else like it anywhere in SF. Great place to kick back and enjoy a few drinks. Large and plentiful screens for your favorite sporting events. Friendly staff is always a plus.
author: Jeff Y.

description:
Not exactly sure how many stars to give this place.  Their selection of beers is pretty awesome, and they have a spinner too, which I dare not risk.  The venue is quite large, and feels a little too much like a chain restuarant.  

The food is well, it's bar food, and the vegan selection is unsurprisingly limited.  I had the hummus and chips, which turned out to be hopelessly bland, and got nachos and cheese with my Yelp checkin - I didn't eat that of course, but it was fake cheese and bacon, and didn't look at that great.  

We also tried the Indiana Jones pinball machine - very disappointing - it's in a dark spot under a TV, and seems to not be in that great working order for reasons which are hard to characterize, except that we've played it elsewhere. 

Still, the staff are nice; definitely go here for the beer, and the dizzying array of TVs if you're into sports (I'm not), but don't stay for the food.
author: Peter N.

description: Awesome place to hang out after you have been shopping and walking around all day in the city.  They have tons of beer on tap from all over the place.  I was particularly happy to see Heretic beers here.  This was definitely a cool place, there were several tables and a bunch of different games you can play.  We didn't even realize there was a third floor until we were leaving.  On St. Patty's day we walked in with about 5 people and we were able to get seating right away.  We all liked our beers and sitting right at the bar we got instant service.  They had TVs in there with the basketball game up.  It was  a loud place but all the more fun because it was a bar.  I would say it loses a star for being kind of a mess.  I understand they were really busy, but there was spilt beer, chicken bones, napkins, empty glasses every where so it wasn't the best look when you are looking around.  Great location, just past saks fifth avenue.  Gave us a great place to hang out to drink a beer and rest our feet! Will definitely be coming back.
author: Michelle S.

description:
This place is like a smaller DnB's. I didn't know what to expect when we planned on coming here, but I was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is very laid back, nothing too crazy. There were people here for happy hour after work, people here to watch the games, etc. There were 2 huge projectors which I thought was really cool, tv's everywhere you look. Perfect for any sports fan. There's a huge selection of beer, big plus. I really enjoy the shuffle board they have. Spread out throughout the room are some video games for everyone's entertainment, as well as a few pool tables. Definitely a good place to chill.

We ordered a few appetizers, they were alright. Everything taste better when you have a few beers in your system. 

Definitely a place to checkout if you're in the area and want a beer or wanna watch a game.
author: Hev Z.

description:
This place is great!
From the outside it looks like it's probably a small dive bar. Walk in and you get something completely unexpected! There's so many beers on tap (probably like 40) to choose from. They also have a great mixed drink selection in their menu. The place is 2 levels and full of games, TV's and stuff to do! The top floor is more of a sports bar/restaurant area. Great for watching games because of all the TV's and monitors with sports on almost every wall. They have good prices and also have happy hour on a sunday afternoon! I'd totally love to come back here with like 10 of my friends. I could easily hang out at this place for several hours.
author: Steven H.

description: Solid sports bar, with ample seating. Food was just average and your typical bar food... Tab ended up being really cheap after some beers and a few apps.
author: Janet H.

description:
I never knew this place existed! My friends and I randomly stumbled upon this bar on a Friday night and were pleasantly surprised. The vibe was great and there was plenty of entertainment all throughout the establishment. 

This is pretty much like those family fun centers you used to go to as a kid...but for adults! I saw plenty of beer (the beer menu almost fills up the entire wall), food, and tons of flatscreens showing which game is on at the moment. There's also a variety of entertainment such as arcades (deer hunter hd, pacman, tekken), shuffleboard, pool tables, and skeeball. I did see plenty of seats and tables as well as an area that can be reserved for private parties. Eveyone seemed very lively and the place is well-lit unlike some dim sports bars I've been to.

My only complaint is that the floor was pretty sticky when I went and that the place closes fairly early for a weekend. I would've wanted to stay past the midnight closing time but sadly that was not the case. Hopefully, I can make a visit earlier and the floor will be cleaner.

This is a great sports bar in the city! It's only a few blocks away from a parking garage (Sutter-Stockton) and there's no cover charge. I will visit again with a bigger group of friends to watch a game sometime!
author: Chris M.

description: Love this place. Lots of fun things to do. Fun place to watch a sport. Food is good and lots of beer!!! Highly recommend to try some of them. Many games and fun activities to hang out with friends and watch some game. Location close to union square.
author: Khanittha K.

description:
Really cool spot for sporting events or just to hang out. It's huge and has a ton of TV's so there's no bad seat in the house.

Beer selection is good and there's plenty of arcade games to keep you occupied if the TV sports aren't your forte.
author: Tien N.

description: Walked in the bar went up to the counter and a man with gauges and tattoos was very rude to us. Did not even order walked right out. Felt very unwelcome. Probably won't go there again, it's a shame because it looked like a fun place.
author: Kelsey A.

description: I came here from Los Angeles to catch Game 4 of the NBA Finals just to be disappointed.  Upon entering there was a long line and the bouncer highly encouraged that we pay $20 a head to get in (party of 8).  We paid the moneys up front just to find out that one of our people was blocked out and not allowed in.  Additionally, I was mistaken for another individual and kicked out for no reason.  The manager who claims to be "Josh Kim" and his assistant "Grace" pointed me out because of my ethnicity and because I owned a North Face jacket.  This made my visit to the Bay terrible and I would never come here again.
author: Brian S.

description: This place was gigantic and had an amazing amount of beers on tap.  One smallish problem, only one TV dedicated to Premier League Soccer.  I recognize that college football is king there but only one TV?  (See some of the other reviews - even baseball doesn't get as much air time). Geez the place is friggin' huge, I mean like a warehouse (it is an old warehouse probably).  Anyway, totally recommend this place for sports in Union Square.  Cool old vibe.  Service is not the best but its a bar, just get up and order your drink.
author: James D.

description:
Update: Came here for game day to watch the Giants in the World Series yesterday evening. What a GREAT place to watch a game! TVs everywhere so no matter what direction you are facing you won't miss out. And some very large good quality tvs at that... 

BIG fan for game days - I will be back!
author: Krista S.

description: Came here to watch Warriors vs Thunder. Good atmosphere and crowd. Their Sauvignon Blanc and Sparkling Wine were good. Nachos were bland  and wings were not crunchy or flavorful enough. Wait staff and security were nice. :)
author: Daniela L.

description: I love love love this place. It combines drinks plus all the classic games from your childhood in a fun environment. Bartenders and staff do give nice pours so make sure to tip them well. If you have a big group, def make a reservation esp if the Warriors are playing. Great place to watch sports, centrally located in the city and they can accommodate large groups since they have 4 floors! This is my go to place!
author: Jen C.

description: We came in twice while visiting union square, once in the afternoon and once in the evening.  The service was super slow during lunch and there was no one in the place.  That evening we got late night nachos and they were highly disappointing.  The chicken was so bland and there was no flavor to the nachos at all.
author: Brandy H.

description:
This is a college type bar. Great beer selection but food and service are mediocre at best. I stopped here wanting to get a snack before dinner. We ordered the nachos and it came with no salsa, no sour cream and was liquid cheese. Not even the real stuff. 

If you're looking for sports, beer and cheap food with slow service. Than this is for you!
author: Heather P.

description:
I came here for a work event, and it's a nice big space to hang out, have some drinks, and play arcade games, skee ball, shuffle board, foosball, and pool! The food is not bad and they have a lot of beers on tap. Staff is pretty friendly and attentive. Fair warning is that they are located on the third floor, and that they are located in Union Square so driving there would be a bit tough. It seems to be a popular place for companies to have events - I'm glad mine chose this place!

Bonus points for that alligator smashing game from the good ol' Chuck E Cheese days :)
author: Anna V.

description:
Had a great time here with friends watching the Warriors game. Got the loaded nachos and it was good. The service sucked . But the environment looked cool
To hang out . To drink and eat bar food it'll Do.
author: Christina U.

description:
We went there to celebrate my friends afterwork birthday party. After spending the few hours and few hundred there $, one security guy approaches tells us to leave. I was surprised, there were no logical connection why we were thrown out. Two security guys Fred and Namath were very rude. My wife got manhandled and pushed down the stairs, she injured her ankle... considering she didn't even resist them. She basically got thrown down the stairs just for asking their names. It was not fair to us. They talked and acted very dishonest and very offensive. My sweet wife could barely walk later and her work was affected for months because of this accident.

This is not how customers or anybody should be treated. This was so far the most devastating and humiliating bar experience in San Francisco for us.

No words, no human connection, just brutal manhandling... so sad and never again that place.
author: R. L.

description: Great place to watch any big games but you have to get there early! I prefer the second floor without all the games. Have met some really nice people here who let us sit at their table. Food is pretty basic bar food that is never bad!
author: MacKenzie B.

description:
Pretty decent sports bar close to Union Square.
A lot of beers available.
We didn't get to try any food, but it looked decent.
My only complaint would be the large projection TVs aren't that easy to see during the day time. 

If I was close to Union Square and wanted a sports bar, i would for sure come back.
author: Binh D.

description:
Busy place.   Nice crowd,  and wide range of beers on tap.  Started with Old Rasputin stout by North Coast Brewery.  Reasonably priced appetizers, I am torn between the Cabo Calimari and the Beer Batter Prawns.

went with the calimari.    Very good.   will try the prawns next time.
author: Bryan J.

description:
Exceptionally great selection of craft beers without a doubt. 

But...the bartenders have horrible people skills.  Poor service overall but the beer selection may override the bad service. 

The appetizers are nothing special either but again they have a great beer selection.
author: Brutus G.

description: This place is always overcrowded and they never let you know when they have private events. The management never answers the phone. Highly suggest going to north beach or another bar nearby. Went to watch a game and as soon as I get there I found out the upstairs was closed and all the tables were taken.
author: Lewis F.

description:
Atmosphere overall was great. The food was good. However, our "server" Karla was extremely rude and inattentive. She made us feel unwelcome and as if we were an inconvenience to her. She talked to us as if we were infants.. 
Primary example: when we first sat down she walked up and pulled out her notepad, didn't say a word, and looked at us like we were supposed to tell her what we wanted. At that point we had not yet been welcomed, given menus, or knew if we had to order at the bar or how it worked. We asked "do we order at the bar?" She responded with "nope" in an impatient and rude tone. Had to ask to be given menus. My friends and I were honestly in disbelief at how rude she was, and it continued on throughout our entire experience there. Never been treated like that in my life in a service type industry. Home girl needs a xanax or a new job that doesn't involve being nice to people.
author: Carly P.

description:
My husband and I were visiting SF on the weekend of a big NCAA rivalry game, and we found this to be a great place to watch some football. There are several large screens, plenty of smaller screen, and the staff seemed more than willing to turn on whatever game you need to watch- from football to soccer to baseball. 

It did have that "bar" feel of sticky floors and half-cleaned tables, but if you're only there to watch a game you aren't so concerned about those things. 

P.S.- Try the sweet potato fries!!
author: Mandy L.

description:
Holy sports bar Batman - this place rocks and just generally because it's a super fun place to be! 

We do these in the UK but they have about 1% of the activities to do (think pool, maybe darts if you're lucky) and this place was rocking and rowdy at 5pm which is usually a good sign. 

There's some amazing craft beers on offer - pretty well priced and the staff are happy to give you a taster and make you some cool recommendations. 

Wifi doesn't need a password and they're super strict on ID outside before getting in the building so make sure you bring yours.

A great place to drink if you're off to the Baseball down the road.
author: Jonny Q.

description:
This place is so fun. I love the chill atmosphere. 
I'm a big fan of sports bars in general (I used to work at one) because I love playing some competitive games while I drink. They have skee ball, old school pinball, shuffle boards, a pool table, etc.
author: Kristine B.

description: Three story tap house. Got to suck if you are wasted trying to get up/down those stares. Lol. The beer is reasonably priced. The food kind of reminds me of boxed stuff you warm up in the microwave. The employees are cool, very accommodating.
author: Lindsay R.

description:
My friend wanted to check this place out, thought it was a good meeting spot since one of them works DT. Another friend checked out the website, said the happy hour lasted until 7. However just checking now, there's nothing on the website about happy hour so I have no clue what he was talking about lol. 

Anyway, the happy hour deal was $2 off any draft beers, and ended at 6pm. That was it. No specials on food, etc. Their normal price for draft beers is $6, so $4 for a beer is pretty cheap! Truffle fries came out to $6...though they were pretty tasty.

The ambiance is pretty nice though, which is why I'd return. It's very spacious, spread out, compared to any other bar I've been to. They have huge TVs for watching games, which is nice. They also have shuffle board and a variety of other fun bar games like billiard, etc. 

Fun place to hang out after work (if I worked DT)!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: My team and I had fun having a drink here before the Warriors final. It wasn't crowded yet and we played some bar games. The problem came when it was time to close out my tab. There was 1 bartender and 1 bar back on duty and it was starting to get crowded. I went to ask a bar waitress how I can easily close out my tab. She had a really bad attitude even though as she stated to me way too many times, she was just starting her shift. I was not asking her to close out my tab but she kept interrupting me telling me she couldn't close it out. She was incredibly rude. Someone should teach her that you catch more flies with honey!
author: Rogelia G.

description:
Beer
Giant TV screens
Beer
Pool Table
Beer
More TV screens
Beer
Skee ball
BEER
Food
More beer
... Etc.
You get the idea.

Located in a busy place like downtown, Golden Gate Tap is very spacious for a group of friends who want to play some games, check out sport highlights, and drink. Adulthood never sounded more fun!
author: Margaret W.

description:
We were here this past Sunday (2.14.16) early evening. The NBA all star game was on so it was a bit crowded. We managed to find a seat in front of one of the huge TV screens. Our server was very attentive and efficient. After the game we wandered around the place playing various games such as Skee ball, pool and pinball. Our server managed to find us and kept our drinks flowing. I wish I had gotten her name since she did such a great job. 

Later in the evening we decided to have a bite to eat but unfortunately the second floor was closed. We were able to get a couple of seats at the bar and we did order some food. We got a couple of beers to go with our food and waited. After 45 minutes of waiting and no food (the bar tender never checked on us in this time) we were able to flag down one of the bar tenders to find out what happened to our food. A few minutes later we were told that the kitchen lost our order but we would get our food soon. It ended up taking nearly an hour to get our order of jalapeno poppers and a quesadilla, something that should have taken no more than 15 minutes. 

The entire time we were waiting for our food we were sitting at the bar. Not once did the bar tender ask if we needed anything or even notice that we had not received our food. It's not like he couldn't see us since he spent a fair amount of time serving the young ladies several shots that were sitting right next to me. 

Over all we did have a fun time.  We will probably come back again at least to be able to check out the second floor too. It's just that the wait for the food left a bad taste in our mouths (pun intended).
author: Jim P.

description: Bloody Mary Sucks, don't ever order it. The place is alright however from a fun standpoint.
author: Marco G.

description:
Looking for a good pint of Guinness in San Fran, or is that just me? Well if you are looking for one Tap Room is the place to go. 

Much more than just good pints of the black stuff, Taps also provides great pre baseball game destination. Loads of screens, pool tables and most importantly Skeeball. This was my first experience of Skeeball and it turns out I could be a world champion. Saying that I must have ploughed in at least $20 in the $1 a play machine learning how to play.


I really enjoyed The Tap Room, not just for the beers and screens but for the atmosphere. This is a real American sports bar - plenty of rowdy banter and good fun, if you're looking for more than a pint go here!
author: Stevie M.

description:
Went for the Warriors game had a great time. Josh the manager was accommodating to our large party that straggled in and Kelly our waitress was exceptional. 
Great place to watch sports. Multiple screens showing many different games. 
The different floors each offer something unique. For the non sprouts fan there is pinball and other fun to occupy their time. 
Definitely recommend
author: Amy P.

description:
When we first walked in and looked at the vast beer menu, I was stoked. Looking at all the games around the room and smelling the fresh popcorn, I thought to myself, how could this place only have 3 stars on Yelp? 

And then the evening commenced. I felt like a child when the bartender furrowed her brow as my friend and I ordered two Hoptologists, and she warningly said to me, "Okay, you know that's 9% and it's a 20 oz bottle?". She may as well have patted me on the head and told me to go play with the other kids while she served my male friend with a smile. 

I guess I give off the vibe of being a dumba$s blonde chick who doesn't know what beer to order, so she twirls her hair and bats her eyelashes and just gets "what he's having" (which I have never said), or the one that "sounds the coolest", or "has the prettiest picture", but I just want to say to all the patronizing bartenders out there that I've been encountering as of late: I enjoy beer. I like hoppy, strong IPAs, and in large amounts. This is not, in fact, my first rodeo, and I would prefer to be treated like an adult when I present my ID and my cash and ask nicely for the beer I want to drink.

So, 20 oz, 9% beers in hand, we strolled around the giant space to a table by the window and watched the hockey game on one of the many big screen TVs. The atmosphere is fun, with a  kind of nice college town / young professionals / older professionals kind of feel to it. People were playing skiball, pool, and shuffleboard, I saw a bunch of people eating massive burgers and I realized how hungry I was.

We ordered the Pulled Pork Tacos, which were dry and flavorless and covered with sour cream and red onions. We were both literally dumping Tobasco sauce on them just to give them *some* kind of flavor. We also got the California Nachos, which were thin strips of fried tortilla covered in nacho cheese sauce, green onions, a few measly crumbles of bacon, and some kind of (no doubt) canned, chilli-looking substance. Needless to say we were underwhelmed, and the portions are pretty small, but at around $4.50 to $5.50, it's not too terribly expensive. 

We ordered a Tricerahops each and then scampered out into the windy SF evening and onto our next locale. I doubt I'll be back anytime soon, but I will say that it is a clean, huge place, good for groups, not too expensive for where it's at, and a seriously awesome playlist (that may have been a fluke, but still). It has a chain restaruant feel, like BJ's meets Dave and Buster's but with a huge beer menu.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room is huge!  It's two stories of bar that is nestled and hidden within the border of Union Square and the Chinatown gate.  The inside is very spacious, maybe the most spacious bar in the downtown area!  The bottom floor is usually more crowded since they usually serve mixed drinks cocktails downstairs only.  Since my group was so big, we all went upstairs where it was more spacious and less crowded.

Our server was working it as she made sure to check up on us every ten minutes or so.  It's just too bad that I had to go downstairs to get a mixed drink and then haul it back upstairs.  The appetizers were fairly cheap although their basic burger was $12 so when in doubt, I recommend getting lots of apps and entrees only if necessary.

They have a decent amount of beer to select from so in that regard, beer snobs like myself will be satisfied.  They also have shuffleboard which can incite a lot of passionate trash talking due to the intensity of the sport combined with alcohol consumption.  I think I'll be back if I was ever back in Union Square and wanted a cheap quick drink.
author: Ben H L.

description: On a crazy busy afternoon, one server (Carla) for a room of 75 people killed it independently. Nice bar for games, but they should have called in a second server. Carla deserves our props
author: Sophia N.

description:
Stopped in on Saturday, 5/7/2016 while waiting for an event with work. 
Not bad at first. Waitress failed to mention the beer labeled as a pale ale I was blindly ordering off the menu was an apricot beer, but my fault too.
She brought our pitcher, introduced herself as Karla, and let us know that she would help us with anything else we needed. At that point, we were ready to order some appetizers, but she was in too much of a rush to stop. 
About 10 minutes later, we finally flagged down another waiter. He comes and takes our order, asks for a card for the tab, and I let him know the tab is open already. He tells me I have to put my order with Karla then. Without us asking though, he went and gave Karla our order. We can see their frustrated exchange, but not hear them. Finally, she goes off towards the booth and he comes back to let us know the order is being put in. 
Five minutes later, the wrong order comes out. We again try to get Karla's attention and are again ignored. We get the other waiters attention again and tell him about the mess up. He looks at what he wrote down (the correct order), rolls his eyes, takes the pulled pork nachos and goes to talk to Karla. About ten minutes later, we've finished all the apricot beer we could drink, and we're ready to go, but finally our regular nachos and jalapeño poppers come. We're ready to leave, so we eat somewhat quickly and again, Karla is nowhere to be found. Finally, after about 15 minutes, my wife went to the bar and asked for the check. 
Outrageous. Beer is bad. Food is worse. The service will have you questioning their continued existence. 
Oh, icing on the cake: I was charged for the pulled pork nachos that we didn't want, didn't touch and sent back to the kitchen.
There are many more places in this area to get food and beer. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Brian F.

description:
What a gem! I'll have those nights where I don't feel like a club, but feel like a drink without all the games of chatting up strangers at the bar and all that shenaniganry. There comes in GG Tap Room! What a cool find of beercade like fashion. A huge location with a great selection of drinks. 

I'll have to try the food next time and see if it lives up the experience, but enjoyed playing all the games. Maybe I'll come here for my next sporting event, but the prices on the arcade games seemed a little pricey? Otherwise wow, what a find and can't wait to come back again someday for the next Giant's World Series victory :)
author: Joseph L.

description:
The pros: great option for brew on draft & sports games on tv especially if there Bay Area teams.

Cons: hard to find a table, won't play audio for patrons for sports game audio, whack music, some of the staff appear to be annoyed if asked the same questions. 

50/50: Food
author: William L.

description:
I came to Golden Gate Tap Room for the first time this past weekend during SantaCon. While coming during a crazy event like that isn't ideal for first impressions, I still enjoyed my time here.

There was only a 5-minute wait outside to get in, and I liked how it was on the second floor with nice views of the Union Square area. There are games everywhere - pool, foosball, shuffleboard, old-school arcade games and more, with a good amount of seating as well. However, during SantaCon it was packed! It took us about 30 minutes to just make it to the front of the bar. We ordered 2 pitchers and found the only empty spot left to awkwardly stand and drink for a while until a small table opened up.

A couple more friends came later and had to wait almost 45 minutes in line outside to get in. I understood it was to regulate the flow of traffic during a busy event, but the line at the bar had almost completely disappeared at that time.

I'd love to come back and experience this place when it is less crowded! Despite the long lines, it was a good first stop on our SantaCon adventure and had fun energy to get our group pumped for the next location.
author: Olivia M.

description: Literally stumbled upon this place while heading to Ruby Skye around the corner. When we all saw the signs advertising their selection of craft beers, we knew we had to check it out. Upon entering, we were surprised at the size of the place and even more stoked that they had video games! From ski-ball to pinball, this place had something fun for everyone and bonus for the huge tvs. Though seating/a table can sometimes be a struggle to find, we always seem to be able to find something to accommodate us. Though service can be a hit or miss, the homies and I love the variety of brews they offer and their food isn't too bad as well. Overall, if you're searching for somewhere to kickback, grab a beer, and indulge in some bar food while watching a game or playing a game, then definitely check out Golden Gate Tap Room.
author: Cristal C.

description:
This place is awesome! Nice big screen tv, projector, loud people having fun while watching the game. Cool crowd. This place gets super packed for games. 

Everything I tried as far as food has been really good as well. The boneless buffalo wings are bomb! I highly recommend coming here if you're trying to watch any sport games. Super fun
author: A H.

description:
A nice sports bar to watch the game.

They have a big screen in the middle and lots of tvs all around.
They have a large selection of beer so if you are in downtown and don't want to go far, this is the place to go.
The prices seem reasonable.
They also have small bites which are inexpensive.
author: Heejin L.

description: Come here for a beer and to watch a game . Great tap list. Know you're coming here for the drinks not amazing food. Also lots to keep you entertained other than watching games - shuffle puck etc.
author: Jessica N.

description: A wonderful sports bar in my hood. This place is so fun to watch Warriors games but it gets packed!! Get here early!
author: Jane H.

description: Came in here for a quick drink...ended up staying for a couple rounds. Really friendly staff, tons of beers on tap, and good beers at that. It is in downtown SF, so be prepared for tourist. Still a great bar and lots of things to enjoy.  Good food, good brew, and they have so many games: Pool, Shuffleboard, arcade games and more.  Will come back when I have more time.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This is the biggest - and quite possibly cleanest - bar I've sen in SF. To top it off, they have skiball, pinball, shuffleboard and other random games to play. Don't know what to drink? Spin the wheel and it'll choose a brew for ya. 

Service was great, but the security guy was SKURRY! Our group of eight or so peeps rolled in and, since the place was empty, he followed us and stared at us the ENTIRE TIME. I felt like the guy was waiting for a chance to regulate, so after a few drinks, we left.
author: Farrah A.

description: Nope. The hospitality in this place is horrible starting with security down stairs. Over a  hour wait for wings and French fries. The ambience is cool but the service is horrible.
author: Amy R.

description:
A bit pricey but has an awesome variety of bar games that make it a fun place to check out. 

Its your typical sports bar.
author: Danny Y.

description:
This a decent attempt at buffalo wild wings in a city that is pretty against chain restaurants. Seriously if anyone has been to a dave and busters, a buffalo wild wings, or even a wingstop would be very let down in this place. 

They have the outer shell of one of these places but its just not as fun. There are a few games like deer hunter, some fighting games and pacman going on but the place is really crowded and no one seems to want to actually have fun here. The prices are also what you would expect in union square san francisco. Incredibly expensive. 

I have to say they have found their niche though. In a city that doesn't have anything like this except maybe urban putt you are going to have a lot of city folks and tourist flocking here and they have that. It is crowded all the time but is like a tech revival of a sports bar. It just feels inauthentic. I don't want to play shuffleboard next to people in suits. It just feels weird. 

The food was decent and fried which is all you need in a place like this. Really though you come here to watch sports. It is a great place to go if you are looking to watch the warriors or 49ers with other fans. It gets incredibly packed then and there is usually a line out the door so be prepared. 

There is nothing special about Golden Gate but it will get business and positive reviews from people who don't know there is a whole world of places that do what they do better. But for what it is and where it is it is a decent option for a city incredibly lacking in sports bars.
author: Nick R.

description:
In a city full of dive bars, gastro pubs, and specialty cocktail lounges it is nice to have a place like Golden Gate Taproom.  The place is fairly new and is huge. Lots if screens, games and tables.  You almost feel like you are in one if those sports bar/entertainment center in the suburbs.  

Lots of beers on tap and fully stocked bars. They have a decent happy hour and drink specials.  The food is standard sports bar food. Mostly fried finger foods and meats between carbs in many different forms.  

It is very spacious with two expansive floors, but can get really crowded on big game days/nights.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Situation:
- Friday happy hour after work with some friends

Pros
- Lots of beers available
- Good happy hour prices
- Takes credit cards
- Lots of TV (of all sizes)
- Large space
- Not too far from BART
- They have various games (Skeeball, Shuffleboard, etc)
- The service was pretty good

Cons
- Food is okay
- Near Union Square, so lots of tourists, definitely not a locals place
- Bathroom (Men's) is very small
author: Dipesh G.

description:
WARRRIORSSSSSS!

I've been going here for a while, but mostly for Giants postseason games. I was there when the Giants won the last world series. The atmosphere was amazing then, but I wanted to wait till I experienced a Warriors playoff game here before writing a review.

It was an amazing atmosphere. Everybody eyes glued to the TVs, aws and oohs on every play, high fiving random people, people cheering "Lets go warriors" at the top of their lungs.... It felt like I was in Oracle Arena! 

This place is huge. Theres 3 stories, so it can fit many many people. There are projector TVs, arcade games all over, air hockey tables, foosball tables, shuffle boards, and San Francisco related artwork and sculptures trickled throughout. They seem to put new things in there every couple of months! Last week during the Warriors playoffs they had a statue of Nate Thurmond sitting in the front of the entrance. 

The food and service here is decent. It's hit or miss on whether you'll get really good service. The food is typical american bar food, nothing really stands out. They have a lot of beer on tap, and they range all from $6-11. Pitchers are $20-25 dollars. There are no fancy cocktails. 

Overall, this is a great place to enjoy a game and have some brews with your friends. Each time I come here for any game the environment is always great. It's my favorite sports bar.
author: Allen C.

description:
Golden Gate Tap Room is a standard when picking a spot to watch the game. With 100-plus beers on tap and offered at a fair price you're sure to quench your thirst and leave happy... if your team wins. 

The space is HUGE. There are two (or three, I'm not sure) floors of vintage games, shuffle board, pool tables and countless flat screens. It's an adult playground appealing to all kinds. The food is typical bar food; but the truffle fries are insanely delish.  

If you're looking for a table to sit and watch the game, better come early! This place gets packed but makes you feel like you're watching the game with 100 of your closest friends. High-fives all around!
author: Emily E.

description: Two story sports bar, massive TVs everywhere, local brews, great pub food... Place to be near Union Square!
author: Tyson H.

description:
NEVER AGAIN!!!!! 
The good food was overshadowed by extremely poor service.  When my party arrived we were the only customers in the restaurant and not only did it take us almost half an hour to get our food but our orders were completely wrong and the waiter was uninterested in serving us. When we received our checks we were over charged for our meals after the manager had apologized for the poor service and promised a 20% discount....very unprofessional. I will never visit this place again.
author: Joe H.

description:
Would rather give it a 2.5 if that were an option.  Will be first to say, overall, I like watching games here as it is the best space & really the only true sports bar in the city.  It also has a pretty legit beer selection.  

However, the big complaint here is that it is not even close to being prepared to handle large crowds like there were for the Warriors games last night.  There are only 4 bartenders, but space is big enough to have probably 1,000 patrons.  Not a good combo.  The other problem is they don't have anyone bussing tables.  Since most people were with groups, most people tried ordering pitchers, but with a hundred plus person wait at the bar, no one could get served since they ran out of pitchers due to not having any bus boys.  It took 40 minutes to get served and that was only because I had my friends bring back our empties and have them just refill our old pitchers.  

Another big issue is their servers are worthless.  I've been here even on nights when there isn't a crowd and have had to go to the bar or go walk and find the servers standing at the front on their phones.  They make ZERO effort, so another reason for a bad line at the bar as well.  

Last night, they closed down the kitchen 5 minutes into the game.  Most people came here directly from work and not able to eat anything.  This is a big problem for a sports bar to not even come close to having their kitchen prepared when you know it is going to be a big night.  

And last but not least, it is absolutely ridiculous to charge a $10/person cover.  Yes, it was a fun experience because you're able to watch with a lot of fans and have plenty of TVs.  But this is the only sports bar I have ever had to pay a cover for and this is for a place where we couldn't even get more than 1 round of beer and zero food.  

It's a shame to see, as this is a really cool space and has a lot of potential.  But the management & staff need to get their sh*t together before I could recommend anyone going here........
author: Sean W.

description:
Who knew!?!

Tucked away on Powell once you've passed the actual Union Square and are doing your best attempt to traverse the hill looming before you is the Golden Gate Tap Room, which from it's lack of street frontage* I assumed wouldn't be much in the way of a place for a group of people to hang out for the evening.

How wrong I was!

GGTR is huge. Yuuuge! There's plenty of room in this new-looking bar with clean floors for lots of large groups to congregate and plenty of televisions on which to see the games (all HD)**.

Have some folks who have no interest in watching games? Well, they should play some. Ski-ball, shuffleboard, Big Buck Hunter, pool ... about the only thing they are missing is pop-a-shot and a jukebox***.

In addition, they claim to have over 100 beers available, many of the craft variety. They also have a wheel of cheap beer which you can have them spin for you and then buy what it lands on. And, if you luck out, it might come with a shot of fernet.

Food is basic bar snacks, with nothing particularly impressive (the buffalo wings are surprisingly spicy) so bringing food in is a no-go, but if you fill up before you get there you won't need much in the way of food.

This is a really good place that I'd happily go back to to watch games, or play them, or hopefully do both at the same time.

* - You have to take an elevator (or I think there are stairs) to the second floor; the only thing that faces the street is a tiny, doorway-sized entrance and a small sign.

** - And probably not on Sunday afternoons, but if there's not a major event going on they're pretty happy to change the channel to whatever game you're looking for if they get it.

*** - The old wurlitzer in the back is a heavy, beautiful paperweight.
author: Danny P.

description:
The place has a great selection of drinks. I have nothing to complain in that aspect. 

I have to admit that the service and security here did not impress me. The bouncer at the front door acted as if he a sergeant attempting to intimidate anyone that came into the door. 

My friend and I were playing one last pool game before the place shut down when they turned off the lights and kicked us out 10 minutes before the place actually closed. I had 2 more billiards to pocket when the same man who was in the front door came up to me telling me, "that's the last ball you're going to hit" as if he was threatening me. I understand these folks want to get home but that's not how you tell your customers to go home. Horrible man just horrible. Anyways, the place would be awesome if these guys weren't patrolling like its freaking jail.
author: Antonio C.

description:
The restaurant is dirty and understaffed. There was one waitress for the entire third floor, which is large. Getting our bill took 30 minutes. 

The bartender (only one) did not seem all that interested in serving customers.

It's a limited bar menu and the food is not terrible. I recommend ordering something that doesn't require utensils, because you might never get them (we didn't).

It was very crowded (they play all the NFL games), I suppose the management doesn't care about service because people keep coming.
author: Tal E.

description:
SO CRAZY that a I NEVER KNEW THIS EXISTED until my friends who are from out of town dragged me in here.  I ALWAYS walk by this place but never knew what it was.  I just assumed it was a ghetto grunge bar down the block but NOOO it is not!  It's actually a very clean and well laid out sports bar with GAMES!  Who doesn't love some pool tables and ski ball?!?  Very cool, this is a great hangout spot and I'm coming back here later this month for a birthday hangout event... I WILL try to play some games then.  You can basically drink some of the most choice micro brews available and they have a check-in deal for free nachos which I got for my friends.  The bar is very busy so you'll have to be patient while waiting to order. 

We watched a Oregon College football game and Stanford.  I made a drunk bet on Oregon losing the game and lost $50... sad panda haha.  But what's $50 between friends eh...?  I could basically placed by dunk sports bets with my other drunk friend and act like a douche for a while.  There were a lot of college like kids who didn't have to go back to school yet hanging out here to watch the game.  There are the one off drunkards who will start talking to you like crazy out assholes.  They are entertaining to a certain point... that is until they start acting and sounding like Debbie downers.  And then this one dude thought I was a CEO of Uber cause I had an Uber shirt on, so ridiculous haha.  Luckily the apartment is within close proximity to this place so I gracefully passed out after a day of drinking shenanigans.  GREAT PLACE to hang out with Friends and watch some sports.
author: Kenny P.

description:
Large space and no waiters, so for every round one of us had to leave and stand in line at the bar. Food is awful and arrived cold.
Two stars for size and beer selection.
author: Pickles P.

description:
I wasn't as impressed as others were.  Smelled lie stagnant water.  Noisy.  I'm just too old ;)

The did have Chimay white on draft, which is rare.  Minus points for the hipster bartender not knowing what Chimay white was and having to explain that it's the triple on tap.
author: T F.

description:
Not going to lie, the decor of this place is awesome. Love the 2nd and especially 3rd floor bars. Have been here several times and its a great hang out spot with large selections.

Only thing that needs improvement is the attitude of some of the employees. I've been here about a dozen times and its always been hit and miss.
author: Jonah M.

description:
Perched atop a winding set of stairs, Golden Gate Taps is what I would call a professional man cave!  As you climb up what seems to be 2-3 floors of stairs to this man cave, the first thing you will be greeted by is a wall of giant flat screens playing the latest sports.

Beyond that are numerous booth and table seatings, 2 full sized shuffle boards, numerous arcade and pinball machines, pool tables, and 3 skeet ball stations!  Flat screens is once again, noticeable everywhere.

Once you arrive at the bar, which is to the left of the entrance, you'll have a full bar to cater to your food and beverage needs.  Undecided what beer you want to drink?  Ask the bartender to spin a giant beer wheel, and they'll serve you whatever beer it lands on!

Appetizers were reasonably priced... Roughly $10 for sweet fries / truffle fries, which comes with 2 dipping sauce and solid portions.  A pitcher of beer is about $20.  Solid!

If you are strolling Union Square or want to watch sports with a group, I highly recommend visiting GG Taps.
author: Richard H.

description: Plenty of seating, ordered food which came out fast but was not hot as expected. Atmosphere causal, with plenty of beers on the menu.  Server working alone, but she managed.
author: Kevin K.

description:
great place to catch a game, 60ish taps, but TERRIBLE food.

i used to come here for lunch every week for their $10 burger, fries n beer special, typically during a giants day game. however, that $10 special is now $12, and they use a different burger patty now that is even more frozen (is that possible) and greasy and unappetizing. so after the beer, its essentially $5 for a shitty burger n fries. not terrible, but i started branching out on the menu. ive tried the fish n chips, bbq fried chicken sammich, and a couple other things and none of it was good. if it werent for the many beer options, great sports viewing, and location on the same block as my office, i would avoid this place for lunch. they just opened a spot in san mateo across the street from caltrain, so ill try that out soon.
author: Gionni B.

description:
A hidden gem in Union Square for late-night shenanigans. 

Stumbled across this place by accudent recently: we were looking for a place to sit down and catch up, and this was one of the only places on Powell Street still open after 10PM on a Sunday night. We came upstairs, saw the bar and old-school video games, and we were hooked!

Drinks are top-notch, the clientele are very low-brow and "real", and it's just an all-around fun place to be an adult and kid at the same time. One star off for the security guard with a bad attitude and didn't inform us about checking ID's until *WE* asked *HIM*. Other than that, this will now be one of my secret spots in Union Square for late-night drinks and fun.
author: Maurice R.

description:
I want to like this place so much. I continue to go even though I know the bar service is bar far THE WORST in SF.  There can be 3 people at the bar and they will be in the weeds.  Except for the bartender in the Orioles cap, not a single other bartender has ever had any kind of urgency or efficiency.   

Today, there were 2 people waiting to order a drink, there are 2 bartenders;  one of them can't figure out the terminal and calls the other over.   After 3 minutes of this, enters another person behind the bar. All 3 of them stare at the terminal, trying to correct an order.  Hey!!  There are 3 terminals and the line is growing, get on it and serve!  They think it's solved, and 2 of them leave the bar (and now more than 10 people waiting)...but wait it isn't working and the 3rd leaves the bar, leaving no one at all behind the bar....and no one is being served.  

Advice to management:  Fire everyone aside from the guy in the Orioles hat.  Make him manager and hire a new team that works like he does.  Also, get rid of your obviously awful POS terminal.
author: Drew M.

description:
The only thing I like about this place are the large, abundant TVs. That aside, go somewhere else to watch a game ESPECIALLY if you're a Bay Area native.

The place is constantly crowded and filled with afterwork bros who have no idea what is going on but just want to be somewhere with people. The servers and bartenders are really nice but slow. I understand that it tends to get quite busy during game days but I'd expect them to be a bit more expedient than they are. It almost always takes forever and a day to get a drink or food. Something as simple as nachos (which are gross, btw) should not take 30 minutes. 

Three stars but only for the nice staff, truffle fries and huge TVs.
author: Angela H.

description:
GGTR isn't going to surprise you if you're not a fan of sports or bro bars. It is what it is here, but is that really such a bad thing? 

Plenty of TVs to go around, good bar grub, and an excellent selection of craft beer littered across the wall makes this an perfect choice when looking for a place to watch the game. Bring a group of friends, bring your one friend. If you like arcades, feel free to bring quarters. I suck at shuffle board so also feel free to beat me at that as well. Just an overall fun place to go.
author: Eric L.

description:
Labor Day in SF, decided to stop here after roaming SF :)

The Giants game was on the big screen. 
They have 2 big screen areas & TV's plastered EVERYWHERE! It's a dream, actually.

They have pool tables in front of the two big screen but the big screens are so big that even people playing pool in front of it didn't bother me.

They have a ton of beer on tap, I am guessing why it's called the Tap Room :)

When we went in, we had to go to the bar to place our orders & ask for a menu.

The bathrooms are super clean :) Always a plus for me.

There were a bunch of bros at the other big screen watching a college football game. Yup, I said it, bros. lol.

Looking around, it would be an awesome place to rent out for a Superbowl party of a Bachelor Party. Just sayin'
author: Camille C.

description:
I came here with a group of college friends as it was one of my buddies' last night in town before heading back to school. 

We ordered a few pitchers of beer to start as we played a game of pool. The selection on tap is great as I tried a few beers I've never heard of before. We ate dinner here and the food is about standard for what you'd expect out of bar food. It does the job but it's nothing you crave later on and definitely not the healthiest thing you could be eating. I split a banh mi wrap and jalapeño poppers with a friend. Thought they were both solid but the sauce for the poppers was so good that my friend and I ended up dipping our wrap and fries in the same sauce. Yum. 

We had about 4 pitchers in total and moved from the top level after 12 to the lower one which was pretty popping. This is overall a fun place to go with a group of friends if you're looking to just hang out and drink.
author: Manosai E.

description:
I am in love with this place!! This place is really a sports fanatic and love everything old school type of person dream place to be. 

I came here on a Thursday night - football night, and it wasn't too crowded but it was definitely live in there. The food was good. Wasn't anything special but I would come back and eat again. And of course our waitress was amazing. I wish I could remember her name but she always checked up on us and made sure we were good to go!

What made me fall in love with this place is the whole ambience of this place. Huge TVs everywhere!!!!! Imagine watching all your games everywhere. Yes. Insane! And on top of that, get some drinks and start playing those arcade games! Ah. I'm lost for words. 

Def will be back and hopefully post some pictures of the place for you guys. I was having too much fun to pull out my phone! Except for this picture of the free shot I won!
author: Hepsie C.

description: Wow, i come to this place during football season  every week, good service and food... today i go up to the third floor because the second is under renovation and i sit.... and sit.... and sit for 10 min without anyone coming to the table not even busy. I see someone from the bar coming my way he smirks at me and walks past. What crap was that about? I leave 15 min later and i see this guy smoking outside without any care of the world....  what  pathetic service! Maybe my money wasnt good enough for this owner and establishment.
author: John C.

description:
Fun place to watch the game!!!
Even if you can't get a seat there is a TV from every angle. Thought it was super cute there was a line for the Men's bathroom & not the women's.
Wish it wasn't so busy we could of played shuffle board.
Lots of Bronco & Patriots fans.....
author: Jacqueline M.

description: My friend wanted to take me to the best kept secret of SF, THE GOLDEN GATE TAP ROOM.  It's a sports bar with a full bar, video games, and parlor games.  The place is surrounded with TV and two gigantic project tvs.  Perfect for the Warriors playoff games.  We needed a drink before we headed out to Lucky Strike.  Order a pint of Guinness and a game of shuffleboard.  This is a great place to go to to root on your GIANTS, WARRIORS or NINER team, son
author: Chris P.

description: Meh.  Touristy, loud and expensive.  Certainly not somewhere to go for dinner - or to watch sports.
author: Terry C.

description:
To preface, this is a very, very cool bar on the inside. They have a great layout and it's just a very cool atmosphere. But this also has to be one of the most pretentious bars I've ever been to. Everything is overpriced (not even by SF standards) and the food isn't that great.

I've been here many times with my friends, but on one occasion, stone cold sober, the bouncer eyes me and asks me if I'm drunk. I get that he has a job to filter out people who are going to destroy the establishment, but that's just a weird thing to do. Aren't you paid to actually do a good job?

Everything is dirty. I think they try their best to make it seem like this is some sort of pseudo-classy sports bar, but they just have an identity crisis because this is still a place where people are throwing up in the bathrooms, and there's just bodily waste everywhere.

To people who are willing to pay a cover, you're an actual sucker. It's not about whether or not you can afford it, but why would you actually pay to watch a game on TV that isn't even a marquee PPV. Whatever marketing Golden Gate has been doing, it's working. As far as bars go, this is where basic bros and their female counterparts go.
author: Jared C.

description:
One word: skeeball!
Also, they have one of the largest beer selections in the area, with cocktails, food, and big screens to watch any game while you wait for your arcade game to clear up!
author: Kacey C.

description:
When traveling for business, it's always hard to find a spot to watch your team and enjoy some good food. Having a Monday night game with my favorite team while I was away on business, I needed a place to stop in and catch the game, and Golden Gate Tap Room fit the bill. While the food was good, service was very, very slow and took a while to get everything together.

Atmosphere - San Franscicans will appreciate the local sports theme, and this downtown bar has it. From the 49ers and Golden State Warriors decor, along with brick walls and worn wooden floors, this place is definitely great for football! I counted at least four projection screens and a host of TV's, although some areas were reserved for private parties. A generously stocked back bar and a host of stools around the bar provided a good walk in experience here.

Waitstaff - I'm not sure why they didn't think they would be busy, but I counted three waitresses in a bar with about 125 people. I guess they weren't expecting many out of towners, but they were strongly overmatched on service. I had various people including a manager ask me if I wanted things to eat, but my order came out staggered, didn't get my beer until I was 1/2 way through my meal.
