Waitress did come over at the end... to give me the bill.

Food - Game day food menu is pretty good. Started with boneless wings which were meaty and had a nice tangy sauce. Meal was the San Fran Sliders and fries. Fries were meh, but sliders were a bit greasy, but good. Since both items were on the 'Game Day' menu, only wound up spending about $20 on food, but a few dollars more on the fine beer selection. 

Intangibles - Great walking distance from many of the downtown hotels in this district, and they keep security manned outside to keep certain elements (i.e. homeless) outside of the bar. Had many sections reserved for guests, may have been for the later home game because place was 1/2 full and many were standing. Runners told me I had to buy drinks at the bar, but manager asked what I wanted and brought it out, some confusion between staff here.

Overall - If you are in a cheap hotel with no cable, or want to get out and catch a game, Golden Gate Tap Room is a fairly decent spot. Decent food and beverages, and a good theme, this place would have ranked higher with more help. Chalk it up to a rookie mistake and if you're in town and need your sports fix, this would be a good spot to catch up in.
author: Christian B.

description:
This bar was AWESOME. It was definitely one of my favorite places to visit. 

This bar had a wide selection of beer and other types of drinks. They had a beer roulette wheel. Basically, they had an upright roulette/wheel of fortune wheel with a bottle of beer in each peg. If you can't decide on a drink - you spin the wheel and whatever bottle the wheel lands on is your beer. I think this concept is so much fun and a great way to help those like myself who can be indecisive at times!

I'm not a huge fan of E.D.M., rap, country, and the typical music you hear at the average bar. I was elated when this bar played Rage Against The Machine, Tool, Metallica, AC/DC, Nirvana, Pearl Jam, and similar music. Not only did they play awesome music like that, but they kept the music at a reasonable volume so I didn't have to yell and scream at my companions. 

On top of the beer and the music, this bar had arcade games and shuffle board for the patrons. I was able to rent really nice shuffle board pieces for 10 cents / minute and played shuffle board on one of their really nice table tops.  

I will DEFINITELY make a return visit to this bar if I fly back to San Francisco. Dare I say - this may be one of my all-time favorite bars tying with the Radio in Tel Aviv and the Signature Lounge in Chicago.
author: Justin V.

description:
Walking into this place, you get this ambiance of a vintage themed restaurants, with one of a kind pieces and beer signs everywhere! The set this place up real nice.

I first went to the Bar and Grill, the experience there was terrible. Not sure what was the waiters problem, but he was not friendly at all. We went during happy hour and the food (although cheap) was mediocre. The waiter didnt even come to us to see if wanted to order more drinks.

We then went to the second floor to taste out their beers and boy they did have a huge selection but the trend on the service was the same. The bartender lady had this face of "hurry up and buy" attitude in which we did.

I would recommend this to people who wants to enjoy the beers and the ambiance and dont care much for the service or food.
author: Ladonna A.

description: Great beer selection and great staff....Eric is a terrific bartender, he was super helpful while I was trying to navigate the extensive beer list.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I'm kind of surprised that Golden Gate Tap Room's reviews weren't that high?

Came here only for an hour on a Friday night.  It wasn't packed, but there were a shit ton of people there.  It'd be pretty hard to fill up this bar because it's so fucking big.

Things I loved:

1) THEY HAVE MAGIC HAT #9... and a lot of other beers that you can't always find at normal bars.  Beer selection is awesome.
2) Shuffleboard!  I love.  And skeeball and a lot of other random games.  There's a crap ton of other shit to do besides stand around.

I'd probably call it the "wreck room" of union square / downtown.  Great for large groups.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Not the best place for food but definitely a good bar for a casual night out, good place to start the night off at. Definitely recommend coming here with a big group of friends, plenty of seating and room to hang out. They have arcade games and shuffle boards so there's always something to do. They have a pretty good beer list and the bartenders were really nice. We tried to order a birthday cake shot for a friend's bday, they didn't have the ingredients so the bartender gave us a free shot. 

Make sure you spin the beer wheel, the beers on there aren't the best but it's always fun to see what you're gonna get.
author: Jane G.

description:
The first time I went to the Golden Gate Tap room it was a really busy night due to Sharks, Giants, and Warriors games. We arrived and were starving but couldn't order food for a hour and a half because of a large party that practically took over the kitchen. 

We decided to give it another chance and ended up having a really great time. We held a friends birthday/going away party there. It was really easy for all of our friends (about 25 of us total) to create our own tabs to order food and drinks. We sat in a large booth that was right next to the shuffleboard tables. 

The food and drinks were all reasonably priced and we had plenty of options to choose from. We also got to play shuffle board (free!) which made the night.

I would go back to watch a game or with a group of friends but it is kind of out of hard to go there for a casual evening drink since it is right in the heart of downtown.
author: Thea M.

description: I dig this spot! Right across the street from the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. We found it a couple months ago by chance and have stopped back in since. It's upstairs and kind of hidden. Once you arrive to the actual tap room you are surrounded by tons of big screen tvs, pool tables, shuffle board, skee ball, pinball etc. It's a FUN place to visit. They  have a huge selection of beers and a big spinner on the wall for the indecisive.  We watched the Sharks game here for the Stanley Cup Finals on Saturday. The staff was attentive and the food was great. We were surrounded by Sharks fans and all the staff was supporting the team. Also, we will have to keep a look out for the slideshow they will be playing out front as our picture will be posted in it for marketing :) Fun times! Thanks and we will be back!
author: Laurie R.

description: Plenty of TVs and a decent a beer selection but the blonde foreign server isn't the best at serving.
author: Sherman S.

description: Walked by here dozens of  times and decided to finally go in.  Loud sports bar about sums it up.  Lots of tvs.  Lots of games to play like pool and shuffle board etc.   seemed like a fun enough place to come watch the game and have a beer.   However be prepared to spend a lot on your drinks.   It seemed like a bunch of locals hanging out but two beers and two shots was $36 plus $5 for tip.   Ouch!!!  Tourist prices for sure.   And the shot was a pretty short pour.   Don't think I'll be back but only because there's a lot of other options if you live here like myself.
author: Thadeus K.

description: This place was poppin on a Saturday night! Great place for a group of friends that just want to shoot the shit, watch some sports, play some pool, ski ball, and drink.  Very laid back feel, almost like a David n Busters without tons of video games. Music was on point. Not too loud that you couldn't have a conversation but loud enough to bob your head to.
author: TRACY R.

description: Nice ambiance. Great place to catch a game.
author: T S.

description:
I brought my coworkers here last Friday as a going away party for an employee who is leaving the company. I was really disappointed in the service and quality control. 
We arrived around 330PM and ordered a round of margaritas. I understand that this is mostly a shot/beer kind of bar, but if you have a full bar, you shouldn't complain about making a cocktail. The first two rounds of margaritas were really yummy, but then we were asked to close out our current tab as they were switching shifts and new bartenders were coming on. No problem, except for the fact that the new bartender made the most disgusting margaritas ever and was rude about it too! 
I find this unacceptable when you are spending a hefty chunk of money at an establishment. It's a shame because our office is around the corner and this could have been a go-to spot for us. But we will drink our margaritas elsewhere.
author: Anna K.

description: Horrible service!  It looks like a fun place but we have been here 30 minutes still no server, we finally went up to the bar and got a couple of beers.  We are visiting from out of town and wish we could have hung out here and had some food. I guess we will go somewhere else these guys don't want our $$$$  The bar tender was very nice, the only reason they got a star!
author: Sandy L.

description:
No air hockey table :(  
Thought there would be one based on yelp reviews. Why is it so hard to find an air hockey table in this city!!
author: Nao D.

description:
Shocking that a place like this is hidden in the Union Square area.

Maybe it's the long stairs that keep out a lot of the more obvious tourist trade. 

Still, a great bar, good selection and great service.

PS: Check in and get the nachos. we ended up ordering two more rounds so mission accomplished Yelp/GGTapRoom. Mission accomplished.
author: Mike V.

description:
What isn't to love here? Skeeball, shuffleboard, TV's everywhere, arcade games, pool tables, and dozens of craft beers on tap, how could you go wrong?! I've been here a couple times, and have had a blast each time. It's perfect for someone with ADD like me who needs activities while they drink. Came here for a night with the guys most recently and had an awesome time. 


PRO TIP - Spin the wheel of beers if you're feeling brave and can't decide!
author: Steve T.

description: I am giving this place 1 star and would give less if I could. Your experience starts with a "security" guy at the door. Laughably, he acted like he was a bouncer at the most exclusive club in Manhattan. Next you get to climb 2 flights of filthy carpeted stairs to reach the bar. There you find unbussed, sticky tables and no one around to care. Beer menu is fine, but the food is awful.  In my life, I have never had nachos I could NOT eat.  They were awful. Hard, not fully cooked potato skins and greasy popcorn shrimp completed our disappointment. We couldn't escape this filth hole fast enough. We came to see a specific game, watched a quarter and fled!  Find another sports bar!!!
author: Lisa S.

description: Such a fun place for a big group of friends, especially if you want to celebrate your birthday or a life achievement. You've got everything there. Humongous screens for TV projection, you could watch the games while enjoying your drinks and food. The truffle fries are enough for two and the wings hit the spot. Can't choose a drink? You can spin a wheel to help you decide on a beer or cider. Wanna play skeeball, fussball, or shuffleboard? They have it all for a small price.   Just avoid it on a popular game night since there will be a long line outside the door, unless you don't mind waiting a while!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I came to watch game 5 of Warriors/Cavs 2016 here and had a bad experience. First of all, there was a line around the block to get in because they only had one person checking IDs. Secondly, security, falsely, accused me of cutting in line. Lastly, the place was overcrowded and all the tables were taken so I stood while servers bumped into me and asked me to move every other minute so they could bring quesadillas and beer to seated patrons who paid the exact same $10 cover as me while I had to go to the understaffed bar to get drinks and order food. Why is this place, apparently, popular? I have no idea!
author: Samuel T.

description: Went on a Friday night and surprisingly not packed. We found a table right away and we're getting our food and drinks pretty quick. As soon as we got there we were literally the ones picking the music for most of the night! A lot of the games were being occupied for majority of the night too. Especially the pool tables! But it's a really cool place to go if you wanna watch a game or just have a chill night
author: Melissa P.

description:
What a fun place! Never thought I'd be giving a sports bar in Union Square five stars...

You can't tell from the outside, but this bar is MASSIVE! Two giant levels - floor one is full of games - from pool, to shuffleboard, to skeeball, to arcade games, and more... And somehow it doesn't even feel cheesy. Covering the walls are giant screens for watching whatever sport you came for. The top floor has more tables and movie theatre size projector screens, visible from even the very back of the bar (and like I said, this place is huge), 

The food was surprisingly tasty. Better than your average bar bites, and a lot of options - to name just a few highlights: fried pickles, giant beer battered shrimp (mouth watering), salmon, salads, sweet potato fries, hummus, calamari, Bahn Mi...and also the more traditional bar food like wings, quesadillas, nachos, etc.

There were five of us; we each had 4-6 drinks, 7 appetizers total, and paid around $30 per person including tax and tip. 

I wish I'd found this place earlier in the football season!
author: Jessica C.

description: Oh, I don't get the low bartender yelp. I had a tab and finally got a table. Great experience!! Both at the bar and the table. Honestly, I can not recommend this restaurant enough. Even though they were packed, Stephanie and Brach rocked!!
author: melissa l.

description:
Yeeah, so I'm going with 3 stars on this one but will also say I 100% want go go back. 

Check it:

They have sweet games and an awesome vibe. However next time I go back I will definitely attempt to reserve a seating area. (we snuck attack stole some bar stools and had 9 people crammed around a cocktail table...skilled. I know!) 

Old school arcade games, yup! Ski ball, oh yes! Pool, foosball, shuffle board, and tons of TV's everywhere, absolutely!

Food? Mediocre at best, but hey, it is a bar.  Bonus points for having TONS of beer on tap with a tasty variety! 




All in all, we had a fun time and enjoyed the different games and activities they had to keep us entertained!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Just up a flight of stairs, with the ski ball lights beckoning you forward, is the entrance to Golden Gate Tap Room. Overtaking what appears to be the entire second floor, there is large screen TV's and bar games scattered around this sports-themed bar.

We stopped in on a Friday night and luckily, we found a table but had to go to the bar for all our drinks. I wanted food but without a server stopping by, I didn't have a chance to order anything. The place was busy but not overwhelmingly so at 9:30pm. Given the size of the place, i was surprised that the bar was so small but the bartenders were speedy and moved people along just fine.

Being that I was visiting from Michigan, I asked for a Michigan brewed beer and- what would you know- they had one amongst their large selection. I got that and a shot for my friend and we were all set to move on to our next stop in the night.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I have been here numerous times and had always had a fantastic time.  Good beer and good tvs.  Always tried to get there early for the tables. 

However, I don't know that I'll look at this place the same way after our experience tonight.  Our waitress was fantastic, but the security needs to get it together.  

Luckily, I have never had any issues with them in the past, but have been witness to their extreme militarism.  Tonight though, one bouncer took a drunk patron (who was starting to get unruly,but his friend was trying to intervene) and slammed him on the ground twice, at which time the guy on the ground had a seizure was bleeding.  I understand that security must be tight, but that's something that cops would never get away with.  Security was ridiculous and should be better trained.  We had to call 911!  

GG- I've loved coming in the past, but this put a sour taste in my mouth.
author: H M.

description:
Came here to check out the AFC/NFC game with a few friends. Everyone in the room was sporting 49er gear which was great to see. It made for a really lively and thrilling experience. The down side is, seating is limited so get there early to snag a table before they all fill up. 

Some Highlights

Gigantic Space with pool tables, shuffleboard, skeeball and foosball tables

An amazing assortment of beers both bottled and draft. I believe they have the most beers on tap in SF area. 

Plenty of TV screens to catch any game with great sound quality. They do have projectors but for some reason they sometimes display inverted 

Food is hard to come by, I was told to go up to the bar to order and on two separate occasions was refused service on food....I get its busy but so many people were able to get food, even people near us on the stairs so I'm not sure what that was all about. I hope that food isn't as big of an issue on days that are not as crazy. The prices were quite reasonable and portions were fare but can't comment on how it tasted =(

On really busy days keep your pitcher because they run out and you'll have to wait to order at the bar. Also, if you are lucky and bring your pitcher to the person in the right corner of the room she will fill yours for only $15 versus the bar which charges $21

Overall Thoughts

A great place to catch any sports game but can be slightly frustrating to get food when its packed to the max
author: Eddie W.

description: Loved coming here with my boyfriend for a late night beer and eats. Burger was amazing, loved the mozzarella sticks, my boyfriend liked the potato skins more than I did. Amazing atmosphere to wind down and relax, casual. Would definitely come here again. Be patient when you're ordering, I only saw two girls bussing around, there could have been more but that's all I saw and they were pretty busy catering to everyone.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Worst experience while day drinking, ever.

Ordered nachos and jalapeño poppers, after an hour I asked where they were. They said I took the wrong number and it was my fault.

They said they'd make more to be delivered in five minutes.

Six minutes later there was no food, and my tour bus was leaving. I told them I wanted my money back, and they kicked me down some cash totaling the amount of the food, less tax and the healthy tip I had given them to ensure great service (at least 17%).

Will never go back except to troll their bartenders.
author: Aaron D.

description: If I could gove zero stars I would. The service sucked. We waited almost 30 mins for a waitress to notice us. When our food finally arrived my husbands food was cold. No one even apologized for the inconvience or anything. The food we finally got was not worth the wait either.  I do not recommend this place at all
author: Amanda S.

description:
I really like this place. We came for a birthday party and had the best seats in the house right in front of the big screen and pool table. There was an all around good vibe there.. The service was good and their staff was fun. 

Only complaint; smaaalllll HOT bathroom, but will definitely be back.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I really didn't know what to expect before I came here. My coworker had a birthday get together here so I was intrigued. AND it was game night so I was excited to watch the Warriors play.

I walked into the door and what immediately caught my eye was the fact that bouncer  looked like the weekend minus the crazy hair and there were games directly behind him lol

Anyway the bar is pretty cool... Mix crowd... HELLLA TV's and huge projector screens for the games. Upon check in on yelp you get free nachos which was cool. There's a roof apparently but it was closed when I was there. It was a Friday. Although there is a second floor with pool tables & a cool piece of the Golden Gate Bridge & MORE, even bigger projector screens! The layout made you feel like you were on the bridge. 

Some of the bartenders are sassy hipster chicks that don't know how to make a simple bay breeze but whatever. Not a way to make tips honey boo boos. Attitude checks please!! 


Anyway this place was coo.
author: Jazzmin A.

description:
We were a group of four that stayed around 4-5 hours for the 49ers & Vikings game on September 14th. I feel like the presentation and concept of this place warrants a 5-star review but there were several shortcomings.

* The place was around 60% full, but it felt like 100% or above-capacity. All the tables were occupied but the aisles were fairly clear. It was around a 10+ minute wait to order at the bar on Floor 2. The ordering-points are not delineated very clearly, so people are just congregating around them in a lump not really knowing who was next. We were told there wasn't anymore glass pitchers available for beer, so we had to wait in line later to get a pitcher. Imagine how this would be if the place was 100% full?

* The patrons are basically left to fend for themselves for tables. I'm confident in my abilities to be diplomatic and communicate with people around me when I'm trying to wait for a table, but I could see situations where there would be fights and discord regarding this. Waiting for an hour and then have people swoop in and take the seats. Who was first? There's no system to figure that part out. If security were stationed in sections and kept an eye on parties present and parties waiting, it would greatly help move this along.

* A security guard told us we couldn't stand in a aisle and that we had to move -- understandable -- but he did not present a solution as to where we *could* be. Later in that same aisle people had placed chairs and remained there for a few hours without interruption. When security gives you the feeling of a nightclub along the lines of -- "and you can leave too" -- it's not exactly a welcoming environment for your patrons that are there to give you money and make your business successful.

It doesn't seem like the facility can support the amount of floor space it currently has. Long rows of fixed-stool seating with access for bussers and more TVs on empty walls could go a long way. This feels like a volume store, and the business model can do well with that no-frills approach. Add a stockroom upstairs or wherever perhaps, and more seating would be great.
author: A. W. Z.

description: Average sports bar. Food is mediocre. If you're staying in that part of town and want to catch a game and don't care about service and quality of food, it works.
author: David S.

description:
My new favorite bar in the City ! Clean, nice, no smoking, great draft beer selection, & EVERY bar game known to Man (except Foosball dammit): Skeeball, pool, Shuffleboard, pinball games, PacMan... and all in top condition ! Something like 20 big screens with every game on, comfortable couches, free popcorn...
So much goodness I'm getting tired of typing.
Just go !
author: Robert D.

description: Very welcoming environment for sports fan. Big screens with excellent food and entertainment. If you are a sports fan, you must check it out
author: Leo G.

description: Stumbled on this place while bar hopping. The food was awful. The nachos were worse than anything I could've created on my own at an all night gas station. The service was horrendous. Mostly because our waitress was really cute but...that was it. But we had a great time anyway. The patrons were fantastic. Lots of tv's. Lots of shuffleboard. Overall a fine way to kill a few hours.
author: Dajsa F.

description: Great ambiance to enjoy a game (although they only had the Chargers game on a tiny screen until the Giants one game playoff concluded).  Good bar food and if you get there early enough to grab a table you can enjoy a full day of NFL fun.
author: Brian K.

description: Pretty big spot to go watch some sports games.  I came here the other night for the Warriors vs Rockets.  I came here about 20 minutes before the game started.  There were no tables, but that was expected, but I was able to find a spot at the bar.  Prices are the typical bar prices.  They have a good amount of beers on tap and the food is really good.  Although it didn't apply to me, I did hear them say there is a $20 minimum on your credit card, so just beware (but just order a pitcher and you're safe).
author: Justin Y.

description:
LOTS OF SPACE: This place is great for large groups who mostly want to hang with a little bit of group activity-- I could see this being great for afterwork happy hours, birthday parties, etc.

MEDIOCRE FOOD/SERVICE: At first, you'll be excited by how cheap the food is. When the food arrives an hour later and you realize that the "cheap" $3 dumpling appetizers is literally THREE DUMPLINGS ($1 each??), then it's not so exciting.

GAMES: I was kinda disappointed, expecting there to be tons of games given the "adult arcade" and D&B advertising. However, as other reviewers have mentioned, there's only a few games and it gets pricey to play more than a few rounds of skeeball and shuffleboard. That said, it's still way more games than any other bar.

TVs: If you want to watch a game, I can't imagine that they're NOT showing it with all the screens they have in this place.

So, if you go in with the right expectations, I think this place is a solid hangout spot for gathering a big group of friends who are pretty chill.
author: Sophia C.

description: This place is great. Good prices, great selection, TVs playing every different game, and huge bonus: plenty of space!
author: Shawn T.

description: Amazing food and one of the best beer collections in the city! Service is a bit slow because of traffic, but definitely worth going there. The truffle fries were amazing and was great to have so many wonderful options for IPAd. A must go!
author: Gayani S.

description: I don't think anyone comes here for the food. Food wise- 2 stars. NOT GOOD. That said, it's a sports bar, so you come to drink, eat some snacks and watch the game. Spacious, but during a game day, it is packed, so you need to come at least an hour in advance to get a seat. Might come back to watch a game and get some drinks, but I prefer a less crowded place.
author: Vivian D.

description: This is the ultimate sports bar. Tv's literally everywhere so any game you can imagine will be on at least one of the massive projectors or tv. Appetizers are just ok but a fantastic atmosphere to watch a game. Have a couple shuffleboard tables too so can play during halftime of the big game. If you love sports and beer.....this is a great place!
author: Brady A.

description:
Located in the heart of downtown San Francisco is where you can find Golden Gate Tap Room, Albeit, kinda hidden, above the corner of a Walgreens but right by the corner of Sutter St.

I've been huge fan of GG Taps for a few years, for many reasons. The space offers arcade games, pool tables, shuffle boards, and other array of other table games all for a quarters each! 

Also, I love how the place has HUGE screen tvs everywhere! So, if you want to watch a good game close by, I definitely recommend GG Taps to anyone.

The bar menu is a full bar with all types of beer served on tap. And this spot even has a great HH menu too, if this place couldn't get any better.

And yet it does!

If you're ever in a situation where you and friends or even family want to reserve a cool area, this place is the place to be! Private booth and sections of the restaurants are available to be closed off to private parties. To be honest, one of my first visits here at GG Tap Room  was for a wedding reception, and this place is so fun I decided to have my birthday here too!

I love this place!
author: C M.

description: Great beer selection and lots of TVs. Get's pretty packed on weekdays- especially when there is a playoff game. You can make reservations for some tables though which is nice. Buy pitchers, not pints. Usually the bartenders are totally understaffed during big events, so the wait at the bar can get pretty ridiculous.
author: Vinitha R.

description: One of my favorite bars. Love the food, great beer selection. Plenty of space, lots of billiard tables. Had a blast on my birthday. They have i believe 3 floors? Their food is also very good for bar food. I ordered the calamari and chicken quesadilla. They closed a bit early, but i think its due to their location, not sure.
author: Jetty S.

description:
This place is every sports fanatic dream! Huge TVs, projectors to watch games on walls, arcade games, bar food, and alcohol...all in one place.
The location is so unassuming as well, right in the heart of Union Square, nobody really notices it's there, which is odd because the place is huge (like 3-4 stories huge).
The draft beer selection is very wide, and moderately priced (most beers are $6-7 pints).

My only complaint is the food selection. Lots of bars offer some sort of simple salad (celery with dip, perhaps) to make it feel like you're able to order something healthy. GGTR does not offer anything remotely healthy on their menu, and food prices are somewhat high. I guess that's two complaints, so sue me.
author: Alyssa G.

description: This is a nice sports bar in the heart of San Francisco. The drinks are not overpriced and they have plenty of games and room to move about. Will definitely be back!
author: Jessica M.

description:
The fact that this is the top rated sports bar in SF leads me to the only possible conclusion:  SF is simply NOT a sports town.  

First of all, the bar doesn't even open until 10 AM on Sunday's.  Football games START at 10 AM Pacific so this means, especially considering the line outside this joint, that fans are forced to miss pregame entertainment and the first few plays of the game.  

Second, the drinks come in plastic cups.  Maybe you're average sports fan isn't an environmentalist but I personally watched loads of plastic being trashed in just 90 minutes.  Is that better than the water used to wash glass?  Not sure but I hope they are recycling that plastic despite it appearing they do not.

Third, the food was ghastly.  I ordered the breakfast burrito.  I couldn't finish it.  I am now at a nearby place ordering something else.  I've never met a breakfast burrito I didn't like until the Golden Gate Tap Room.

The service was decent, if apathetic, and there were lots of tvs.
author: Niki K.

description: Best sports bar in San Francisco. I watched a warriors game here and the atmosphere was incredible
author: JC A.

description:
This place is kinda cool because it's spacious, has two full size shuffleboards (though you need to give them your card to get the pucks), and a bunch of arcade games. The bar food is just okay, not much different from the usual and nothing spectacular, but if you are looking for a place to grab a beer and just kill some time with friends, this is a good place for you.

This is also a good place for goodbye parties or happy hour, since it's pretty spacious and charges no cover. I'm not a huge fan of the place but it's a good backup spot if you're in the area and can't think of other plans.
author: Nancy W.

description: Was there last night. Been there before but was tired of getting passed up by the bartenders for other patrons who were there after me. One of the bartenders looked right at me. I started my order and he walked away with his head down. Don't know why. He wasn't the bar back. He then proceeded to help someone else. A bar that moderately on a Friday night and can't get drinks. We decided to leave and take our business elsewhere.
author: Steven B.

description: This calamari was so good!! The price was very reasonable. If they had a marinara sauce for dipping, I could give them 5 stars for food only, The service is generally okay anyway.
author: Yuiko I.

description:
Biggest bar in SF that I have been to yet. I love that there are so many tvs and huge screens so you can get your sports fixed at every angle. The atmosphere is very casual and they have a great selection of beer. The food is subpar, nothing to brag about. I've had better bar food in the Mission. I went on a Thursday night and it seemed pretty crowded already so I'm sure it'll be even more packed on a weekend. 

I would definitely return with a bigger group and try out all the beer!
author: Cathy N.

description: You can say what you want about Golden Gate Tap Room but 4 double vOdka/sOdas later... Pissing in public, Jack 'N the Crack session, stumbling down a set of stairs, 2hr Bart ride home, rain pOnchOs and WARRIORS game on deck will always be the epitome of a gOod time! #cheers #dUbNatiOn #drink2that
author: Joe S.

description: Great beers, huge selection. The bartenders are super friendly and great to talk to. For food, I only tried the calamari. It was meh. I guess okay for bar food, but not great.
author: Cheri E.

description: What a joke. Walked in on a Sunday night and had to get a hand stamp just to order dinner. Went up to the 3rd floor and sat at the bar. Bartender never acknowledged me sitting directly in front of him despite serving several other customers who came after. The place was not even that busy. I looked around and didn't notice a single server in the entire place. Sat for 20-30 minutes without even so much as a glance. You'll starve to death before getting any service here. What a shame, because the atmosphere is really nice.
author: Ed A.

description:
This joint is amazing. Over fifty beers on offer, shit loads of spirits and they even have a SHOT WHEEL!!  

Then there's all the sports on offer on all the tv screens all over the joint. Plus the games on offer too. 

Epic place
author: Lincoln E.

description:
The great thing about sports bars is that it brings together all sorts of people who share a common interest, whether it's in a game, socializing, or just drinking on a weekday evening. The Golden Gate pub is one such place that provides a large, expansive venue for bringing people together under the guise of anything related to watching sports.  There are too many TVs to count, of all different sizes, and strategically placed to divvy up a multitude of viewing spaces. The result? A pleasantly controlled space where you're never too close to any group that might be way more or less invested in a game than you are. 

Besides the wonderfully organized physical space, the table service could benefit from similar attention to detail; placing orders for everything including drinks and food had to be done at the bar. This meant that for all sports nuts, getting refreshments resulted in interrupted game watching, or interrupted game dishing during commercials. Since I was there more for the company than watching a game, it didn't matter as much to me, but it was still annoying having to wrestle for attention at the bar rather than just ordering from our table. 

The food is standard SF sports bar fare (including token "Asian" offerings), at modest prices and modest portions. Despite the absent table service, the service was otherwise outstanding. One of the items we ordered was out, so they encouraged us to order not just anything else as a replacement, but EVERYTHING else we wanted to eat. Sort of ridiculous but much appreciated!

Look for entrances on both Powell and Sutter, and be sure to have your ID ready. Each entrance is well staffed with burly bouncers who do their job well!
author: Ting S.

description: Great beer selection but slow and unresponsive service brought down the experience. Took 25 minutes to get the attention of the server. Ordered wings but they arrived cold. Might be willing to try again but it would have to be during a slow period.
author: Paul K.

description:
I will say I HATE how touristy it can be, BUT after work isn't too shabby. The Warriors / Giants / Broncos (yes, Broncos) are worth the struggle.

Here's the top reasons why I even brave this place:

1. There must be at least 45 TVs in this place. So even if the tallest man on earth is standing in the way of your 5'5" self, well, guess what? I can step 4 feet to my left and clearly see another big ass TV. #winning

2. They have a shit ton of good beers (IPAs). And I love beer (IPAs).

3. GAMES! It's like my inner kid gets to be ADD for a few hours, with booze...

4. Men. Everywhere. (sorry, but it's the truth. And what other benefits are there for a woman who loves sports?)

If you have patience, you can probably brave it. And if you're anything like me, it's usually worth it.
author: Amanda U.

description:
Great bar, tons of space and tvs everywhere. I always have trouble deciding a beer, especially at a place like this with so much variety, so the wheel is great. It's always a great deal and even if you get a pbr, they have a shot to go along with it. No worries though, they have a beer list so you can take your time to decide what you want. 

Best part: skeeball. Yup, drunk skeeball. Take my money
author: Cody M.

description: Crap service.  Crap food.  Came in at 5pm on a Wednesday for drinks and appetizers.  Took about 20 minutes for someone to come take our order.  The microwaved apps came out fairly quick.  Drinks were weak.  Prices were high.
author: David S.

description: Awesome place to watch championship games! Was here for the NBA finals! Great selection of beer! Truffle fries were awesome! And short rib nachos! This is the place to be! $10 cover unless you get there early but the $10 cover goes to charity!
author: Jimmy C.

description: Games games and more games. Really a fun place. Probably over 30 beer choices, decent cocktails and good munchies. Sometimes a bit understaffed so not always the quickest service.
author: nancy w.

description: I love GGTR! The drinks and food are great, It's always an atmosphere I look forward to joining. It's very spacious with a good crowd that's there just to have a good time just like me! If you're a daring drinker, make sure to try the beer wheel!
author: Andrea E.

description: Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. Beers were not as cold as they could have been and a little flat.
author: Doug H.

description: When it comes to sports bars, this place delivers. There are several levels, all with big screens (some bigger than others), games such as shuffleboard and pool and plenty of drinks to choose from. The service was friendly and fast and the prices were on par with what you'd expect in the city. All in all, if you're looking for a place to watch a game, grab a beer and some wings and hangout this place should land on the top of your San Fran list.
author: Rob H.

description: I would have gone here much earlier if I had known about it. A walk up a few flights or stairs, and viola! Super cool bar/pub/hangout. The stairs leading up to the joint are even decorated as the Golden Gate Bridge. They have a ton of beers on tap and lots of TVs for watching all the local games. I didn't try the food, but I plan to next time!
author: Ryan D.

description: Fun place to grab a drink, watch a game, and play some great bar games. Great selection of beers on tap, food is pretty good. Actually went twice during our stay (it was really close to our hotel)...first afternoon, the bartender was great and very knowledgeable about the beers on tap. Second time service was ok...will grant them the fact that the place was a little more crowded that evening.
author: Jeana M.

description: They were simply rude and disrespectful. I love this bar bc of the atmosphere but the staff makes it unbearable. Anyone from the bouncers to the bartenders were unpleasant and I won't be back bc of them. They should work on customer service. You're running a restaurant bar not a jail. Bouncers made me very uncomfortable. Don't recommend whatsoever....
author: Ashield C.

description:
The Golden Gate Tap Room is a neat spot I discovered on my last trip up to SF.  It's surprisingly big and has a nice beer selection with reasonable prices.  If you're having a hard time making a decision (or you're feeling particularly bold) you can pay $6 to spin their beer wheel and leave the rest up to the beer gods.

They have a handful of TVs around the bar showing different sports, but more relevant to my interests they have all sorts of games to keep you busy - skeeball, pool, shuffleboard, etc.  If video games are more your thing they've also got Buck Hunter HD, Pac-Man, Tekken and a Simpsons pinball machine in the back.

To top it all off they've got a Yelp check-in offer for a free order of nachos.  Pretty sweet.  My only complaint - you know in pinball after you start your round usually the "shoot again" light stays on for a while, allowing you to get another ball if you lose the round too quickly?  The Simpsons pinball game has a super short timer for this.  Cut a guy some slack, I'm buzzed over here!  All things considered this is a pretty cool place.
author: Jay S.

description: WOW they have soooo many beers on tap!!  There's a ton of craft beer I hadn't seen other places in addition to everyday beers and a full bar.  It seems like there's something for everyone here.  There are lots of games to play too including pool, shuffleboard, and ski ball with lots of tv's everywhere.  It seemed like a younger crowd with lots of college age looking kids around.  I'd definitely come back to try beers that I wouldn't see other places.
author: Jessica L.

description: Went here after shopping. Loud sports bar.  You have to go up to the bar to order food and drinks. I have no problem with that. Ordered Nachos, they were the worst.  Velveta Cheese over chips , that's it it was gross.  Long wait for silverware and drinks.  This place is only good for drinks, and to watch a game.  Won't be back.
author: Susie S.

description: Great place and atmosphere but any place in downtown San Francisco that uses ball park cheese for their nachos is just blowing it. That's all I ordered so I can't judge on anything else but I hate ball park cheese nachos at a nice looking establishment. If you wanna watch a sports game, have a couple drinks and have fun this is a solid place to be
author: Alex S.

description: It's got the Guinness but no class. Please get this place some proper wait staff that know how to clear and clean the tables. Using bouncers is no substitute. I'm reminded of a fraternity house where nobody cares. Good luck getting a drink at the bar when there's a bit of a crowd. Unprofessional handling of an irate customer drove us away.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
GGTR, thanks for the response to my review :) I do still continue to come by and still enjoy watching games here bc I love the space, bar games, tvs, and all the beers on tap (perfect sports  watching bar really).

Thanks for addressing my concern regarding the food. It's so nice to see businesses responding to their reviews. I have and will continue to visit for games - see yall next time!
author: Margaret O.

description: I thought it couldnt get worse but came back on a Saturday before the giants ws game. 3rd floor bar had every keg empty. YOU ADVERTISE BEER HAVE YOUR KEGS TOGETHER ON A SATURDAY THIS IS ROOKIE SHT. Embarrassing we brought 20 people and the bartender was visibly angry to have to actually do his job. This place sucks-tourists enjoy. Locals don't bother.
author: Raina D.

description:
The bar area is great if you want to get together with a few friends. They're skee-ball, pool tables, shuffleboard and TVs showing any sports that happen to be on. The night I was in, there was a hockey game, an A's game, and an MMA match. It's noisy, but the mood is jovial.

The food selection isn't great - pass on the pork tacos (lacking in flavor) and calamari (batter's too thick). Go for the sweet potato fries (crispier than most places) and chicken wings (who doesn't love a good chicken wing) instead. Then wash it down in one of their 100 beers on tap.

Oh, and it's just a block away from Union Square. Take your out-of-town friends here for a quick drink before seeing the sights!
author: Robert H.

description: Really nice sports bar! Lots of TV's for watching any game that's on. Each floor has its own bar and seating arrangement. We ordered a bunch of food off the bar menu and it was really good. I'll be stopping by here again next time I'm in town!
author: Mathew N.

description: This is a really cool spot with games, lots of TVs, and great beer.  I came here for the first time during San Franciscos infamous Santacon and I understand this was my experience on an event day.  I waited about 5 minutes in line and then met up with my friends upstairs.  They said they waited at the bar for over half an hour to get two pitchers of beer and that they ran out of pitchers for awhile.  After this we were unable to find somewhere to sit so we awkwardly shuffled out of peoples way until we could find a table. Another group of friends of mine had to wait in line for about 45 minutes to get inside and by that point there was no line at the bar and there was plenty of room so I have no idea why they made them wait so long.  When they got there we went back to the bar for another drink and the bartenders were more interested into talking to themselves than helping the guests.  We ordered the nachos and wings and were pretty disappointed in both.  I would like to check this place out again on a non-event day to see how it compares but would probably just stick to the beers and skip the food.
author: Stacey C.

description: As soon as I walked in, I was greeted with a smile and hello by one of the nicest bartenders, Brandon. He helped me select which beer I would like the most based on my preferences and was very patient with me while I was making my mind. I ordered the boneless buffalo wings and sweet potatoes fries. The food was delicious as well as the choice of beer Brandon suggested. The atmosphere was very friendly and the large screen Tvs was more than I could have wanted. 2 thumbs up by far! Thanks Brandon for the best Monday night out after work.
author: Lauren C.

description: Yummy pizza w/ delicious vegetarian options and great staff! Fun environment, good vibes for sure. Would love for them to expand and get some sitting. Even a few tables or a bar outside.
author: Mimzzy G.

description:
Just got done with a party last night. 

This was the 3rd party I've helped plan here, but the first where I've dealt with the staff and I've been to GGTR about a dozen times. We had about 35 people in our group and everyone had a great time. We were upstairs on the 3rd floor which is way better for a party. Felt like the whole place was ours for the first 2 hours. 

Yuli was awesome and the entire staff was very accommodating. My party was a retirement/HH and very informal so I didn't really know how many people were coming. Yuli was great and easy to work with. I had a cake delivered and they gave me a ton of plates and forks for service.  

The bar staff were super sweet and very efficient. I recommend this place for ANY type of party. Thanks GGTR!!
author: Stance L.

description: Great atmosphere & crowd on a Thursday nite. As a beer lover I am thoroughly satisfied & impressed.
author: Tish J.

description: Very cool vibe and the beer list is phenom! A beer and burger for $10 during happy hour; can't beat that!
author: Kayla H.

description: If everyone would stop giving GGTR great reviews, maybe tourists would never find it. This place is the only escape from the tourist clustermuck of Union Square, plus it's the only real sports bar I know of for those of us who live on or around Market St. Tons of beer and ciders on tap, and tv's everywhere. It's pretty horrible. Definitely don't go here but if you do, bring your ID no matter your age. And don't miss the truffle fries.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Arcade games + alcohol = automatic good time.

But honestly, I enjoyed my time here! Spent a fun Saturday night here catching up with friends. We were able to grab a table and talk. The noise level was high, but we were actually able to hold a conversation. We also played some arcade games, a round of pool and foosball. 

There were a lot of beers on tap, and my friends enjoyed their mixed drinks. Overall, Golden Gate Tap Room was a fun time! Would go again.
author: Greg J.

description:
With the warriors on the brink of clinching the playoffs, my group made sure to get here at least 2 hours before the game and I am glad we did. The place got so packed there was only standing room, but even then our waitress somehow still was able to get all of our drink orders and bring them in a timely manner. 

We ordered some apps that I was not particularly impressed with, but that is not why we came and that is not why you should go to tap room. If you are looking to watch the game this is the place. With multiple huge screens and tons of TVs littered around the bar, there really isn't a bad seat in the house. They also have a ton of beers on tap and a great selection from some local brewerys. If you can't figure out which beer you want they have a beer wheel that picks for you and gives you a chance to win a shot as well. They also have a full stocked bar if liquor is more your choice.
author: Karsten K.

description: Lots of beers on tap and good service. Gets a little crowded but what doesn't in SF. Plenty of TVs for sports watching.
author: Paul R.

description: Maybe a bit short on the number of beers on tap. But I love this place and would not mind coming here weekly for a few games and a few beers. Some of the games might be taken up for the majority of the time like foosball but they have plenty of other games like pool, arcades, skeeball etc. Great place to hangout!
author: Ronald F.

description:
Ever go into a place and just expect pretty bad service?
 Total tourist part of town to watch the Giants game ( we won :D ) 
 Worst and best part of the night was we never saw a hostess. We were confused to wait or not. 
We waited so long to be seated that we wondered into the best waiters section ever! 
Way in the back, you'd never think, but best service I've had in quite a long time. And I'm a bit of a snob, cause I've been at it for 25 years. 
Considerate, timely, personable, and always on point.  
 Go Daniel! Only his second night there, (second night at a friggin' sports bar in SF during a Giants post season game) I don't believe it. 
 Awesome. Blown away. 
 Thanks, man!
author: Fabian F.

description: Good ole' fashion Good!!! Had a fun time with me mates.
author: Naim T.

description: Friend took me here. Kind of a tourist trap..located near Union square...however if you can get past that, there's not much more you could want from a bar..good food, lots of tv's for catching a game, and a huge beer selection. It's a three level bar, so there's lots of space to congregate..even on game day..will return
author: Sean R.

description: This place is full of yuppies. I used to like coming out to watch games or even just enjoy a beer, but not anymore. Never enough places to sit, super crowded. I dunno, this place lost its appeal. And their food is just ok, nothing to rave about. If you want a place to actually watch the game, don't go here. It's ok for parties from the looks of it though...yuppy parties.
author: Pamela B.

description: This is a great spot to meet up with friends and coworkers to watch a game and grab a few beers. They sometimes will charge a cover fee during busy and popular game days, but it's definitely the place to be. They have one of the best selections of beers in the city, and a spin wheel if you can't make up your mind! They also have video/arcade games, pool table, and shuffleboard. You could spend hours here!
author: Katarina D.

description:
Note to management:

Your servers really work hard and keep people happy even when you are packed.
Good for you for hiring enough competent staff, bartenders, etc!   Turn up the volume on the game though.....
author: Eric N.

description:
Came here the other night with a few of my co-workers and was not impressed. 

Lots of beer on tap, but that's where the positives end. There were 5 of us (and later grow to 7). The beers took a very long time to come out. We also ordered some nachos, sliders, rib tips, and some assorted things off the menu. The ONLY thing worth getting in my opinion is the rib tips. 

AVOID the nachos AT ALL COSTS. I didn't get a chance to use the "check-in" offer but I tried some of my co-workers who did order it and it was gross. 

The old adage: "you get what you pay for" is absolutely true here. Come here for beer and the free popcorn. 

Go elsewhere for food.
author: Charles K.

description:
If I lived in SF, I would be a regular at this bar. 100 beers on tap?! WHAT!!? The beer wheel is a great idea they have to make up the minds of customers who can't choose. Loved it.

They have everything!!! Tvs, pacman, motorcycle racing games, couches...Every bar should be like this one! Security was friendly which was a nice alternative to the moody security I'm used to experiencing at other places. Skee ball is cool, and I love to play pool so I was happy to see they had a few tables. Lots of seating as well. Great design and layout of the place. I will be back when I go into the city again!
author: Audrey H.

description:
I'm so in love.
This is my favorite bar in the union square area because it has seriously the best beer selection for blocks. This is a great place to take out of towners because they can try local beer in a place with a fun vibe and kick ass views. There are so many fun games to play while you sip and the bar tenders are knowelegable and gorgeous ( especially Stuart and Brandy!)
Point deduction for the food which I find to be iffy, but hey if you've had enough gorgeous beer you could do worse!
author: Molly S.

description: HORRIBLE service! The waiters didn't ask if we needed any drinks so we went half way through our meal before someone came near us and we had to ask. My friends order was made incorrectly twice. I don't recommend coming here ever for anything.
author: Alex G.

description: Good spot for TV and games. Big space on second level.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Horrible service - reserved a table for a group of 15 people. They have us a table with good viewing angles to one of the big screens. Only thing was that it was in the "bar area" and no servers would serve our group.  Made absolutely zero sense and because of this zero tip was given by then entire group. 

Highly suggest that management rethink  their customer service policy.  

Unacceptable
author: Gareth L.

description: Horrible place was real excited to come down here have fun, drink beer and have food.  First no table service then beer was just ok. We ordered some burgers they came out completely cold and not good. Returned and server didn't even seem surprised. Do not come here
author: Olber S.

description:
This place is aaight.  It's like a local version of Dave and Busters.  TVs, a few random games and alcohol.  Not a bad mix of things.

And they have Jalapeno poppers - which is always a win.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
Raging Security Guard Emptied Bar By Screaming at Everyone!  This place might have gotten at least 3 stars for the drinks and bar service.  We sat among sticky tables and dirty glasses everywhere.  There were no servers taking orders, so we went to the bar.

One big problem... They don't have a "last call," so if you buy a drink right before midnight (that's right, they closed at midnight on a Friday night.), you won't have time to drink it before this ridiculous security guard starts yelling for people to "STAND UP!  EVERYBODY MOVE TO THE EXIT!  I SAID MOVE!"  

Honestly, it sounded like we were in the middle of a robbery...or some theatrical Alcatraz tour!  The patrons inside were not loud or unruly, and he treated everyone like criminals.  Several folks had just gotten a drink, and now they are being told that the bar is closed...get out!  

If you close at midnight, fine...but post the hours and stop selling drinks before people need to leave.  Don't take customers' money and then force them out.  

The staff tried to explain that they had apparently been too lenient in the past.  Um...I have to say that there has to be a middle ground somewhere.  From the reaction everyone had as we were being forced out, it's safe to say that these folks will never return.  A few more nights like that, and Golden Gate Tap Room won't have to worry about customers staying late....or, any customers at all.

This guy left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth...shame on the management for letting this happen.  Have a "last call" and find a guard with people skills.
author: Tara Laine S.

description: Stopped in for a couple of beers after dinner.  Excellent selection to choose from.  TV's and games throughout the bar.
author: Mike C.

description:
My friends wanted a bar with tons of TV in the downtown area to watch the game and Golden Gate Tap Room was highly recommended. 

This place is such a hidden gem with tons of beer on tap, old school games, pool tables and shuffle boards.  There is two floors - first floor up the stair case is more casual and the third floor is more of a restaurant type where there is a waiter.  If you come for HH, the first floor is the best - so people can go up and order from the bar instead of having a TAB and a bill splitting headache. 

The best part is they serve $6 jameson shots and $4 beers for happy hour.

Will def be back! 

Ohhhh - if you check in on yelp - you get a free NACHO,.. comes with the spicy nacho cheese tooOooo =)
author: Chanel L.

description: Giving a 5 star review because of my server Ashley. Not only was the food very delicious but she made sure we were getting taken care of. It was a pretty slow day but other then that I like the atmosphere and you get to watch the game on the big screen. Will come back.
author: Lina T.

description: This place is awesome! You can catch a game, get some good food and they have a wide selection of beer. The bartenders are always nice (from my experience), and the crowd is pretty laid back and nice as well. The inside is a bit old and dusty, but definitely a good experience for games and events
author: Minnie U.

description: This place is very cool - lots of character here.  Table shuffleboards, TVs showing all the games, and just a good vibe.  The beer options are awesome.  I take away 1 star because the Cobb Salad is a complete joke.  They put out a salad with a few tomatoes and cucumber slices and that was it.  Huh???  Where's the bacon?  Egg?  The very cool server (who have rejected it before bringing it to the table) apologized and got that stuff for me on the side.  Don't get salads - the burgers look really good.
author: Steve B.

description:
I'm torn about this place. It's a HUGE space and half my company calls this home for happy hour. But for the amount of space they have there's only one long bar and it could work but the reality is on busy nights it doesn't seem to be any wait service. For as big of a space as it is it would be awesome to have quick wait service. If there was then maybe that's the problem. Otherwise it's an interesting space. Could do much better if someone could figure out some better systems to make things easier to get drinks and order food. We were there for a birthday/going away and I didn't even bother trying to order food. Figured it was already hard enough to get drinks. 

Regardless the bartenders work hard and were cool and the pours were fair. Based on how much of a pain in the ass it can be on busy days I'd prefer this place when it's slow.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Solid list of beers on tap, but the service in this place is horrendous. We were at a table for 35+ minutes yesterday and were never approached once by any type of waiter/waitress. I wouldn't know what was on their menu in terms of food because we never got a menu. Kind off odd considering the waitresses had plenty of time to stand around and flirt with the bar's "security" guys. 

If you're in town looking for good beer and atmosphere, check out Mikkeller Bar or Bartlett Hall. If you are looking to play skee ball while watching sports in a loud room, then GG Tap Room is a decent choice as long as you are Ok with walking up to the bar and waiting in line every time you need another drink.
author: Dave G.

description:
Great space to come out to hang, and plenty of screen to watch a game. Shuffle board, pool tables, and arcades to play in between commercial breaks.

I'd hope to think that when it's not busy the bar service is reasonably quick, but when I was there (during Warriors game #7 vs the Clippers), it was absolutely unacceptable. I wanna say only 2 or 3 bartenders were at the bar, and given the size of this place, they should've had a lot more.

Other than that, pretty good beer selection. I'll probably come back, probably not anytime soon, and certainly not during major sporting events.
author: Joon Y.

description: So many beer choices!! There's an entire wall of it and the bar service is actually really quick! The bartenders are all really nice and do their best to take the orders from the people who were waiting first. I tried the apple cider and I would highly recommend it to anyone who loves apple juice because I couldn't even taste the alcohol in it! I'm not a big beer drinker but my boyfriend is and he tried about four of them and liked every one of them! He's a big IPA drinker so he likes to when there are lots of options. If you've ever been to gold spike in Vegas this bar reminds me of it! There's lots of games inside including arcade games as well as foozeball! There's two floors with the bottom floor being really loud and crowded and the top floor being more intimate where you can actually have a conversation! The top floor is also way quicker to get a drink at. There's lockers on both floors to put your stuff in and that came in handy for our rain coats since it's been raining! Definitely a must see if you're looking for great beer and a fun atmosphere
author: Taylor B.

description:
Saw the ad for $10 unlimited beer the past Wed night so I gathered my hip and young colleagues aka HH gurus for a tryout here. Now, we don't frequent dive bars, more so of places like Roka, Barrique, Cigar Bar, Press Club, Trace, where service and atmosphere are more up there.  But this Golden Gate Tap, it's pretty much half divy, half brewery, kinda like Thirsty Bear? Except TB is much nicer and has a more sophisticated menu. 

Anyway, we got there around 6pm and luckily found a long table next to the bar, of course given the look of the place, didn't think the staff is well trained enough to greet us or take our orders even though menus were on the table. So we ordered food at the bar and bought our bracelet for the $10 unlimited beer at another table where we each SHOWED OUR IDs for exchange of the red paper bracelet placed snugly around our wrist proving that we are over 21 of age.

The unlimited beer was only limited to Pilsner and the bartenders repeated that it will run out of supply shortly and will stop serving once it's out like it's some kind of freaking life blood. We dont give a F.  One of us decided to get a round of shots so he went to the bar to get shots.. came back after 10 min to COLLECT OUR IDs because even though he's wearing the beer bracelet, they believe that the rest of us might be 18? *BUZZ KILL 1*

About 20 min after the first round, I decided to get the second round and TOOK OUR IDs with me *BUZZ KILL 2* This time we diidnt want all vodka, I ordered 2 Jameson, 4 Vodkas with Pineapple backs. She repeated my order back questionably and in the most miserably state poured my backs *BUZZ KILL 3* 

After my experience I went back to my table, and yes every single person agreed that those 2 female bartenders were extremely rude, useless, snappy and premium buzz killers. Maybe they just got out of jail? Maybe they have something against ppl like us? Maybe they just broke up with each other? We dont fkn care cuz we pay your bills so you better shape up! or not? Who cares, you just lost 6 customers + our friends.. good luck!

Oh and your food taste like dog poop.
author: Catalina C.

description:
I came here with my cousin for a few beers. The selection of beers was nice however they seemed to cherry pick the most popular beers from each style. That's nice if you're looking for something familiar or if you're new to craft brews. For me though it was a narrow selection of new brews to try and enjoy. 

The place has tons of televisions and a huge projection screen which I LOVED! Catch the game from any seat. They have pool tables, skeet ball and shuffle board. 

I would definitely come back to catch a game with friends.
author: Daniel G.

description:
Do you find yourself on a Sunday in need of a place that can hold 468 of your closest friends?  And they all need a view of a different game?  But 47 of them want to play billiards or shuffleboard?  Then GG Tap Room will sort your out.
Not the best bar food, but not terrible.  Good beer list, from my non-hop-headed brain's recollection.
author: Christian W.

description:
5 stars go to Stephanie! This place is packed and she was still able to give us full attention! This is a fun sports bar which is great for big parties! It's my good friends goodbye party and she is making this memorial!!  

Thanks tap room and Stephanie for the great Thursday night experience! 

Forgot to mention, I came here a while ago for a football game. They have screens everywhere and we were able to watch the game with everyone!

Will I be back here? Absolutely!  But dress casual and leave your fancy purse at home because things can get a little wild...
author: Taylor K.

description: A great selection of beers here, big screen basketball, pinball and pool - all in all, a recipe for a fun night. However, it's too big, loud and noisy for an in-depth conversation. Somewhere better for large groups of college buddies wanting to re-live old times, I guess.
author: Daniel B.

description: This review is for Daniel. We are sitting here now and can't believe how great Daniel is!!!! he's by himself this afternoon and is in charge of helping the whole third floor. If that were me.......id be the biggest jerk! But he is still so friendly and attentive. We are in town for my sisters 21st birthday, and after last nights festivities she was pretty hungover and he took the initiative and brought her a "hangover cure". This place is pretty cool on its own but he made our experience GREAT. We all really enjoyed him and his attitude.
author: Adrienne F.

description: One of the craziest sports nights of the year, Wednesday 13-April-2016, kobes last game ever, the warrior going for the 73 win record, and the Asian manager (I only state his ethnicity so he can be held accountable), allows one woman to reserve over 20 seats upstairs, literally. The best 3 tables in the house. She was even standing bragging about it. One of the servers tried telling the manager it was ridiculous, numerous patrons upset. Unbelievable. Their tables are still empty while people stand around. This is unacceptable. I've never been to a place that allows one person to reserve 3 tables, over 20 seats on one of the biggest sports night of the year.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Perfect laid back place to watch a game.  Beers are cheaper than in most bars and the crowd is pretty diverse.  Lots of tourists but lots of locals too.  The look of the place (particularly the entrance) is pretty outdated and odd but once you are upstairs the atmosphere is ok.
author: R X.

description:
What a disappointment! Honestly, 2 stars is extremely nice for the experience a group of my friends and I had.  

Let me start out by saying this would be the perfect sports bar on SF if it actually played the volume to the game. Seriously... No volume? And just because it's not a niners game? Since when are the warriors not just as important? Rude! The manager has absolutely no idea what he is doing. He literally told me that because other people at the bar preferred music (not even hip music, but old 70s and 80s music), he wouldn't turn on the volume for the Warriors playing the best east coast team. I was shocked, literally shocked. I came with a good group of people where we weren't shy to order tons of drinks and food. Why were the "others" granted their music at a sports bar?

Let's talk about the food. My friend and I ordered the check in nachos (don't bother - so nasty), the veggie potstickers, popcorn shrimp and he had the burger. Somehow, after a few of us eating this, we were all feeling pretty ill the next day. I do not recommend you ordering the food! 

Also, the place reeked of marihuana. I swear, it was the wait staff because after ordering a beer and asking for a glass and not receiving either or for a good 15 minutes made it quite clear who wasn't all the way there. There were too many times where my group had to go to the bar instead of having our waitress help us. 

All on all, the venue is amazing and that's why I am giving it 2 stars. Get a new manager, wait staff and stop serving nasty food and you will succeed. Oh, and maybe play the actual volume to the sports game since you're a sports bar. Thanks!
author: Anastasia N.

description: Great place for happy hour.  4$ beers on tap and theyre cold and refreshing.  Service is good too.
author: Afshin S.

description:
I came here one night to jave a few drinks. Walked upstairs and was impressed for having so many Tvs and a cool place to hang out. 

I started talking to the bar tender and asked if we could reserve  one of the couch spots with the big screen for the niners and carolina game. He said they do not reserve, it all first come first serve. I asked if we could pay a minimum or a fee to rent it and he just kept saying no. I offered a minimum $700 bill and still no.  I thought no problem as our group would just plan to get there earlier.

We come in to the Tap Room on game day and we see the couch area near the bar covered in signs saying "reserved". I asked the bar tender why is that area reserved as I was told no 2 nights prior to that? He said one of the "upper managers" reserved the area for his family. I told the bar tender what happened 2 nights ago and why does the manager get to reserve the main area when you know most the drinks and food will be free. The area was empty but just 5-7 people and the rest of the bar is packed! 

It would be nice to see the owners of the bar there seeing how much money they are losing by the dumbass manager taking up the most prime seating during a big game. The bar tenders just told us that well hes the manager and does what he wants.

We found another area and got some stools and watched the game. Service was decent and drinks came at a good pace after ordering. 

Then we ordered food. OMG!!! Some of the most crappiesr food I have ever had. We ordered a bunch of items and all of them came out bland, messy, and just disgusting.  We didnt eat any of it.

We left during halftime and took uber to Lucky Strike. There the drinks arw a bit more pricey, but the service and food was great!
author: Satish P.

description: Good beers. Went upstairs. Multiple people asked for the Monday night football game sound and they would not accommodate. We were not the only ones asking for the sound but we were told "it's not gonna happen."  Music was not even good. The place has sports all over and did not cater to a sports fan.
author: Byron B.

description:
Love, love, love this place. This is a place of my dreams. A place full of different beers, amazing bar food, and arcade games... Including Tekken!!! 

Great selection of beer. Definitely can call itself a taproom in my book and love how they change the beer list. Has every style I feel like sipping on that day.    

I feel like people have their expectations way too high for bar food. It's as amazing as it gets. This isn't some bougie small platter thing. It's in your face. I like it, has more of a casual/comfort feel. Love the fries, nachos, quesadilla , wings, mmmmmm I have not gotten the burger yet but I will soon. Maybe I will update in the future. Price of food & drink is pretty decent and well worth it especially being in the city and located in downtown. 

With a couple arcade machines, pool tables, and skee ball it makes an ideal spot for a date night or hanging with friends. Arcade machines definitely cheaper than a D&B with the elimination of kids running/screaming around everywhere. Great for my heart cause I get so nervous when tiny kids are crawling/running everywhere and booze is involved. I would say this place is more for drinking and socializing.

This is my preferred meet up spot and its one of those places that has an appeal and attract just about every type of people. There are tourists and locals. Your social drinkers and your daily drinkers. It's great that the place has 2 floors and very roomy. Does not make you feel claustrophobic yet there is atmosphere. One of the best bar/restaurant bathrooms. Meaning probably has a clean kitchen. Love the bar layout. Staff is on point. Always a good experience with them.

Keep it up golden gate tap room!!
author: Cheryl P.

description: Awesome venue is sports and bar games are your thing. If you can't decide what to order, spin the wheel! Shuffleboard is here!
author: Chris K.

description:
A fun place to come to after work with lots of beer/cider/wine, decent bar food and fun and games! Every bar should have fun and games :-)!

Fun tip: The International Language Meetup group (if you're interested in practicing Mandarin, French, Italian, Portuguese, Korean, etc. check this out!) calls the Golden Gate Tap Room their watering hole Tuesday nights. Usually a great international crowd filters through!
author: Christina C.

description: We were visiting from out of town and feel so lucky to have found this place. In a very touristy part of town, this place has incredibly reasonably priced food and drinks and a very relaxed environment. We felt very at home!
author: Rebecca W.

description: If you want to pay a 10 dollar cover for the privilege to pay for microwaved Tyson chicken nuggets called "wings", understaffed bars filled with bartenders who want to take orders with the speed and accuracy of George w. Bush's war in Iraq and a sound system that works for 10 seconds and then doesn't for 10 seconds then this is the place for you!  Be sure to check out the decor they stole from Applebee's! Really an inspired experience. This is the worst bar in San Francisco. Trust me. I've been to a lot.
author: James P.

description: This was a fun, unique place. Bar, video games, and classic skeeball. Only complaint is about the bathroom...the men's bathroom was looking great early in the evening, but as the night went on..the toilet was clogged and the urinal was filled to the brim with piss. Unsanitary and nasty..and both bathrooms were closed at one point...not for cleaning, just closed.
author: Gabriel P.

description:
For being in the Union Square area, it's got reasonable prices for drinks and a great draught beer list. 

Service is okay and the food decent, not great. But in all honesty, you don't come here for the food. 

You come here for the pool tables, the shuffleboard, the giant tv screens, and the general ambiance of a great hangout spot.
author: Imelda M.

description:
Come here around 5pm or 6pm on during the week and it won't be crowded with finance bros here to pound brewskis and scream at TVs. Pretty solid spot to come with your work buddies, drink some beers, play shuffle board, and watch the game.

Great beer selection, also!
author: Andy J.

description: My favorite bar in SF. Often crowded for watching a game. The staff is nice (Julia) and the bar close pretty late, which is cool.
author: Lino M.

description:
Full Disclosure: I'm only reviewing based on GGTR's viability as a NFL bar. And in that case they really should get 5 stars because...

1) They open for the early morning football games. 
2) Sunday Ticket + like 30 TVs
3) Sunday Drink Specials
4) It's huge. Like bring your whole crew huge. 
5) ALL THE GAMES (the actual arcade games)

The food could stand to be better, it really is just your average bar-food. But if you're coming here for that, you might want to re-evaluate your life. 

The wait staff was very friendly, and definitely accommodated my diva like demands of changing the TVs around us to play the games we wanted which was huge. 

I'll definitely become a Sunday regular because this is as close to NFL heaven as SF is going to get. And if the menu improves, the might need to start charging me rent.
author: C. Nikole S.

description:
Horrible management and customer service. I wan to book.a table for a game. The manager said no. Hummm. So he would rather have random guests vs people who would guarantee with a credit card. It's unfortunate that the manager has no business acumen and understands the importance of keeping guests happy. Being in union square that is saturated with tourist you would think that keeping locals happy and repeat guests would be a priority. But not so much here. There drink prices are too low and the bar services are lacking. I will be more than happy to take my hard earned money to an establishment that appreciate good business sense and understands that locals are here all the time and not just during conventions. I have stepped into this place for the LAST TIME!

Better service than here include;
Jones
Tunnel top
Nicks Crispy Tacos
Nickies

Please enjoy better service elsewhere.
author: Ashley H.

description:
Decent spot to get a beer. Best part are all the bar games. Arcade games, skee ball, shuffleboard, pool. Most everything you want is here.

The only knock on this place is one of the beers I got was flat but there were too many people to make it worth it to say anything.
author: Victor C.

description: This place is so poorly managed, the service is awful and they randomly shut down their kitchen because they are too busy. Learn how to run a sports bar and you might get people coming back.
author: Kali H.

description:
This place is exactly A-OK.  It's a bar on the second level, with two entrances to confuse you on either side of the corner it is located on.  When you walk inside you may feel as if you have entered into a game room for adults.  It's very fratty in that sense.

However, there are some decent beers on tap, and they have amazing happy hour specials.  So if you are looking for some cheap eats, this is the spot.  I would hate to see this place on a weekend night however.
author: Super L.

description:
How many complaints about your ALL AROUND horrible service are you going to have to receive before you do something about it? Maybe you're waiting for an overall rating of 1 star? 

Negative 5 stars if I could. I've been here twice now and both experiences were horrible. 

First experience about 2 months ago: 

Sat at the table for 10 minutes. Server walks past and we had to flag her down and ask if we should be ordering at the bar. With attitude she tells us that she'll be with us soon.
