Another 10 minutes go by and she's hanging out with a bunch of servers at the end of the bar yapping away. I thought it was a joke. Finally she Comes over to us and asks us if we're ready to order. We order a couple of beers and chicken wings. Our wings arrived about 15 minutes later, cold. Our beers, warm (poured in warm glasses). We finished our drinks, flagged the server down again and requested our check. I actually got sick about an hour after eating. 

Second experience (thought I'd give it another go): 

Yesterday we went in for a few drinks and had a couple of friends meeting up with us. I was the first to arrive and sat at the table for 15 minutes!!!!!!! Several times the dark haired girl with the lace-back shirt walked past me. My party arrived, still no service. Finally, I walked up to the bar and ordered our beers, albeit took 2 minutes to flag one of the bartenders down who were talking among themselves. I didn't even bother ordering an appetizer after the last experience, not to mention I wasn't wanting to be my own waitress. As I'm waiting for my beer, I see the same (only server I guess) on her phone texting. Was this a joke? I even said loudly as I carried all the beers to the table that whoever was the waitress should TIP ME for doing HER job. Again, our beers were poured in warm glasses. We only drank half of our warm beers and we left. It was seriously that bad.

I thought the first experience was bad, but I thought that maybe it was just an off night. I've come to realize that the bartenders have attitude (except for the guy with the mustache who was actually cool) and the servers are nothing but useless, teenage acting girls who sit at the end of the bar chatting it up with each other or texting on their phones. 

Don't come here for the food that may make you sick, the warm beer and the terrible service. Sorry guy with the mustache, you should probably either work somewhere else or tell everyone else there to get there $hit together. We won't be back.
author: Noneya B.

description:
Closest thing to a beercade I've found in SF. We were walking around and just wanted somewhere to sit and take in a drink in a non-assuming atmosphere and catch the Warriors game. Just stumbled past this and it checked off all the boxes, plus some.

The place is huge. There are multiple televisions bigger than my bed and a lot of space to sit. The bartenders were really friendly and walked my gf through their extensive beer collection. I was a little disappointed they were out of Tricerahops as it's one of my favorites but that was just a minor setback. The food looked bland and not exciting so we stuck to drinks.

The arcade games and game tables are spread all throughout the place. And if you're playing them it's easy to get in the way of people. I wouldn't come here if it was busy, but on a lazy game day it's just the spot to relax downtown.
author: Jacob N.

description: Husband and I didn't know where Togo but he enjoys beer so it seemed like the perfect place. We had the lunch special which is a burger and beer for only $10. Probably one of the most reasonably priced place in San Fran! We went back later after a baseball game and it was packed but we made happy hour and our tab was only $16! Couldn't believe we both had a drink and an appetizer. If we lived there it would be one of our favorite places Togo.
author: Jami M.

description: Came in here right before Happy Hour started on a Monday, so it was pretty slow. Sat at the bar and got our drinks and put in a food order. The bartender that served us was ending his shift so he asked us to cash out. We had no problem doing this so we did. Waited for 2 appetizers for about 30-40 minutes, the food was disgusting but we were starving so we didn't care and ate it, also we had already paid for it. The 2 new bartenders that came on never acknowledged us, so we never got another drink. They did not appear to want to be working. The girl bartender was chomping her gum so bad, I'm not really sure she could focus on anything else. As we were leaving the GM said to a customer "that we are kinda a bar". The place is a sports bar, that only was playing soccer, even though baseball and basketball games were staring. Truly think you need new bartenders that know how to provide service and maybe a GM that knows where he is working at. Will not be returning.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Worst place ever to watch Sunday football. The staff can only tell you what they can't do... Not what they can do.  Doors don't open until 10am... Games start at 10... Can't get a coffee.. You can order breakfast but they don't have butter for toast... Can't hear the games because of dance music being played full blast.... And they "can't" turn it off.. Manager lets her staff deal with customer complaints and refused to come out and talk to the numerous customers complaining.. Even when specifically asked to speak to the manager, she refused to come out... Several of the wait stAff agreed place is nor run well..would never come back.... Leaving at halftime to find a real sports bar..
author: Tina E.

description:
A passable sports bar, crammed with people who don't really like sports.  Great selection of beers.  Prices are about what you'd expect.  This place gets crazy busy,  If you're not in a group of twelve, the waitresses don't see you.  I get that.  It's triage.  

Need a place to kill and hour or two?  You could do worse.  Warning: It can get stupid loud in here.  Not the place to go if you're looking to nurse a beer, or talk quietly with friends.
author: Rob F.

description:
It's a big space and there are plenty of TVs, a few shuffleboard tables, a pool table and arcade games. The space itself is pretty cool. 

The downsides are the beers on tap and service. They advertise over 100 world class beers but they only had 1 IPA on draft that you wouldn't find at any other SF bar. 

The service takes forever. We had a space reserved and it took 15 minutes to get my beers. My wife ordered a club soda and waited more than half an hour to get it and brought it up 3 times, when all they had to do was push a button to dispense it. 

The food is pub food and exactly what you would expect - cheep and mediocre. 

This place fits in great for the location right off Union Square, but if you are a local you already know 20+ places that you would rather go so follow your instincts.
author: Frank J.

description: The Golden Gate Tap Room's a great place to go for beer. They have a wide selection - over 100 available. Price is quite reasonable. There's also shuffleboard and arcade games including Big Buck Hunter. The only downside here is the service isn't the best, but it may have just been because of a huge crowd in the place due to a large conference being in the area. Had the buffalo wings here, too. They were good.
author: Matthew S.

description: It's the Super Bowl and there aren't enough seats, but plenty of room... Don't make no damn sense. The end Felicia.
author: Richard H.

description:
I've also read your reviews after my experience and there are plenty that have the same issues , understaffed and staff not having knowledge of the menu. 
I am a manager in good and beverage for the last 11 years. I defiantly know when service is lacking. This has got to be one of the worst experiences I've ever had. And it's too bad because the set up and space is amazing. 
Staff needs menu training. Customer service training. Empathy training and some need English classes. And you defiantly need to invest in hiring a barback for upstairs. And teach the bartenders of proper pours. A jigger would help. A free pour usually tends to pour over. I heard one other customer tell bartender he ordered a grey hound and only received grapefruit juice. Save that place. Train your staff
author: rebecca r.

description:
Pros: Bar area is huge, 100+beers with a ton on tap, most arcade and bar games you can ask for (golden tee, skee-ball, shuffle board etc.), and a bunch of TVs that will show any major sporting event going on at the time

Cons: Location - Not ideal to come all the way to union square as a local but definitely a good spot for people out of town looking to grab some beers and watch games while staying down in union square. Food is typical bar food, nothing special.
author: Steven G.

description: NEVER AGAIN! This place was packed to the brim due to a Warriors game so I get it to some extent but the drinks were so friggen iced you got nothing for your $ and those nachos were revolting. I also tried to use the change machine to play some games but it was not reading my CC. Total Breeder Bar for them single guys and girls to get drunk and get layyyyed
author: Nick B.

description:
Here's an idea: On game nights when an SF team is playing, staff more people! The space is huge and there are tons of televisions which is what draws people in, but it's IMPOSSIBLE to get drinks from the bar or the wait staff because there are simply not enough people working. 

Here's another idea: Hire competent people. Most of the staff have no idea what's going on or what to do and look like they're experiencing a frantic breakdown. I was there last night for a 49ers game and the bartender was horrendous. She didn't know how to fairly serve those who had been waiting for a while along the entire bar, and kept taking orders from anyone who shoved their way through to the center. I watched her fumble with the register multiple times as if she had no idea how to ring up orders. It was a joke.

Management, the place really is a gem in terms of location and space and it really could be much better if the service turned around.
author: Brittany L.

description: How did I not know about this place already? Huge tvs everywhere. Projectors even. Your classic grubby pub fare (nachos, fried stuff, you know). And shuffleboard, pool, and arcade games (skee ball!). This place is awesome. Service is quick even though the place is huge, and drinks and food come out quickly (again, even though it's huge). Liquor selection isn't great, but it's a tap room. Therefore, expect a very wide range of beers. Yum. The only thing that drags this place down is you won't find parking. Anywhere. Anytime. Major drag. Otherwise, it's super close to lots of other things, so play some games, get a little drunk, and stumble your way to the next bar.
author: Danny C.

description: We went here for the USC v. UCLA football game - great bar to watch sports with a large group, decent prices for pitchers of beer. Centrally located and near a few Bart stations for people traveling into the city.
author: Chelsea M.

description: Great variety of games and events on TVs too numerous to count.  Great free nacho offer for Yelp check in.  During the course of the game I tried several different beers as well as small plate of fried chicken.  Was unique in the sense that they were mini boneless breast filets battered and fried.  Not fingers or nuggets but petite breasts.  Attentive and helpful but not annoying waitstaff.  Oh and yes,  BIGGG screens!
author: Dwight A.

description:
I tired. I really did. I've now been a few times with friends and co-workers, but this is absolutely the worst service I've ever had in the food and beverage space ever.

Here's a pro-tip to the owners: get rid of those stupid stools in front of the bar after 5 p.m. That's just roadblock for your slow, rude, ornery bartenders to fail at their job, attempting to serve patrons properly. You understand that having a barrier of people NOT ordering drinks delays people TRYING to order drinks, right? People--myself included--were almost *throwing* cash at the bar trying to get a drink, but we had to wait for Mr. Richard Move to finish his wings and celery before I could flag down a bartender.

Your bartenders are worse than BART employees on strike. They make too much money for the service they provide. I continue to persuade groups of people to bars other than yours, until your horribly broken system is fixed.

You have so much potential, such a fantastic space--DO SOMETHING WITH IT.
author: Tyler H.

description:
large sports bar, which looks super cool when you walk in, but is ruined by service and poor food. In fact, I can't decide what was worse...the service or the food. Both were rock bottom and I don't see how they could get any worse unless they started cursing at customers when they walk in and throwing rotten food in their faces. 

TVs: It took us over 10 minutes and multiple attempts to get someone to change the channel on the TV's by us from some Access Hollywood type show to a major NBA game. 

Food: The food is atrocious. The chicken wings would taste like McDonalds chicken nuggets, if they were reincarnated, went through 7 lives of living virtuously to improve their lot in life, and were finally reborn gloriously the 8th time. 

The night I went there was a Yelp deal for free Nachos. The Nachos consist of a small plate of potato chips, covered with cold processed cheese and a few jalapenos. WHO PUTS COLD PROCESSED CHEESE ON POTATO CHIPS AND CALLS IT NACHOS WTF. No matter how stoned the "chef" was that night, he could have come up with something way better. 

Service: Theres really no point in going to a sports bar where it takes literally 25 min to get a drink. At one point I looked a waitstaff in the eye and waved, and he looked at me, turned around and went the other way. Douchey bartenders went out of way to avoid eye contact and stand around doing nothing while there were multiple people waiting at the bar, money in hand. Tables were all really dirty, on par with a frat house.
author: Tailor A.

description:
Came here to watch the Warriors game, really great place to watch games or just hang out. They have tvs in every corner and the have projectors going as well. Great place to hang out with friends and just chill. 

Our waiter was Daniel, one of the best waiters there, was very attentive and always made a good effort to get beer or food to the table. With him as our waiter my friends and I had a good experience here. 

The place does start to get packed around 8 so get there early if you want a table. The food here is pretty good for something to snack on while drinking (free nachos if you check in). 

Overall a good place to hang out and kick back. Only downside is when it gets crowded
author: Noel I.

description: I went by golden gate tap for a work happy hour on my way to dinner. I had a birthday gift which was a nice bottle of wine for my friend. They wouldn't let me in with the wine even though it was obviously sealed. The guy at the front said I could leave at it at the door and he would hold it for me. I told him it was kinda expensive and I really didn't want to to lose it. He said 'I will watch it, don't worry'. I stayed for an hour and when I ask him for the bottle, its gone,  stolen from the front. They gave me an 'I'm sorry' and didn't even offer anything to make up for it.  I definitely would have not gone into the bar had he told me it may get stolen. So now Im headed to dinner with no gift, feels shitty.
author: Carolyn D.

description: Golden Gate Tap room is like a hidden gem. You have to climb several flights of stairs or take an elevator up to find it. Once inside, you find a sports lover's dream. So many televisions, including at least one that is movie theater size. Lots of different seating options from the bar to couches to tables. And the games, including pool. The crowd is a bit eclectic and offers up some good people watching. They also have a good beer (bottle bottled and on tap) selection and decent bar food. It can be had to flag down a server, but they seem to have enough of them that it's never too long of a wait. This is a nice little spot right off Union Square where you can go to catch the game.
author: Nicole M.

description: Brought some friends here who were visiting from out of town. It was a weeknight in the summer but it was still pretty busy. There are tons of beers on tap so we were all in our happy places. Cool atmosphere inside with games all over the place (pool, shuffleboard, darts, ski ball, pinball, arcade games, etc.). I've only been to one of the floors but would recommend stopping by just based on that experience.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Located right on the corner of Powell and Sutter. You can't miss it. 

- There's like 20 HD tvs all throughout the bar

- Pool tables, shuffle board, some arcades

- drinks are very reasonably priced. lots of craft beers!

- restrooms are clean

- on-street parking

- walking distance to the mall.

- no waitress service. :(

Overall, a decent "pub" with a great vibe.
author: Niño M.

description:
Pros: Large Beer selection, lots of games, large space

Cons: Terrible food, terrible service, terrible mixed drinks, incredibly loud music

I went with a group of coworkers on a Wednesday night, 6pm. There were a moderate amount of people there - about 150. A girl in my party ordered a bunch of appetizers and our whole group (8 people) ordered drinks. After 20-30 minutes a server brought our food-which is a long time to wait for fries and chicken wings. The girl who ordered said the food didnt look right, but maybe she had forgotten what she had ordered bc she ordered almost one of everything, so our group dug in. After a few minutes, the head waitress walked past our table a few times and then stopped to talk to the server who brought our food. The head waitress then came over to our table and said, "this order wasn't for this table, it goes to that table over there." (she wasnt rude at all, just informative) 

Here's the kicker:

She picks up 3 of the 4 plates from our table, the ones we have already  eaten off of, and walks over to a table about 40 feet from us and serves that food to the other customers...THE FOOD WE HAVE ALREADY TOUCHED/EATEN OFF OF!

Now, everyone in my group works in the food industry and were completely appalled by what had just happened. 10 min later our actual order arrived, and after waiting almost 50 minutes for food we were sort of irritated. 

The food in general was just bad. I've worked with food for years, I can tell when things were made fresh/to-order and when things have been made in giant batches. The nachos-with canned nacho cheese- were cold. The sweet potato fries were cold and soggy. The chicken wings were congealed, the calamari was overcooked and the taco meat was dry. 

The mixed drinks, from our group consensus were not by any means bar-worthy. There was definitely very little booze in them- gin and tonic, vodka tonic. Not complicated. I've bartended for a while and I know how drinks should taste. 

Overall, I wouldn't come back. The food wasn't good, and it took FOREVER to get a waitress to take/deliver drink orders.
author: Ashley H.

description:
We were on our 25th Anniversary trip, visiting SF for the first time.  Happened into the Golden Gate on our first night.  We had such great service and conversation with bartenders and waitress' that we went back at the end each evening of our trip. 
We didn't have a full meal but tried several of the appetizers.  Loved them all.
Atmosphere is laid back / sports bar kind of feel but don't think you'd feel out of place if you came in all dressed up.
We SO wish this bar was in our neighborhood in Seattle.
author: Barbara P.

description:
I have to agree with the yelpers about the bartenders at this place. I tried to be a patient customer yesterday to get a drink and stood there for 10 minutes and was totally ignored. The bartender looked like he was spaced out. I for one will return only if the place gets competent bartenders. I also should mention that yes this place has been open for a short time but by now they should have corrected their mistakes by just reading what other yelpers are saying.

Peter
author: Peter T.

description:
Glad I'm not the only one to have noticed how bad the service is. Was repeatedly ignored by the bartenders on a Saturday night -- yes, it was busy, but it wasn't that late and I'd been standing there for a while waiting to order. At the bar. Not behind a bunch of people; I was at the bar. It wasn't until I finally said, "Hey! I think I'm next!" (after the bartender asked to help someone standing behind me for a second time) that I was acknowledged. Not even an apology. I wish I hadn't tipped. Especially after he shoved the beers at me and beer sloshed out of both glasses before they even reached my hands. Real nice.

But wait, it gets better -- that's not even the lamest part! Ordered another round at 11:50pm, only to come back to the table and be "warned" by a security guard that the place was about to close. Really?! Pardon my French, but those bartenders are assholes for not telling us we'd have to finish our beers in under 10 minutes when we ordered them; a last call warning would've been a lot more helpful. 

To make things even more enjoyable at this fine establishment, the security guard certainly wasn't messing around when he warned us about the place closing at midnight: he got super militant and started yelling in our faces to GET OUT as soon as it was 12 o'clock. It wasn't 2AM. It was 12AM. I get it; we should've been more aware of this special BAR's closing time -- believe me, we were happy to patronize any of the many other places in the neighborhood that actually stayed open past midnight. But seriously, who does that? And guess who won't be coming back?
author: Justine M.

description: I used to love this place, but don't come here early for any big sports games! They'll charge you $10 without telling you there's no seating available. Though, if you don't mind paying $10 to stand for a few hours, the beer section is pretty good. I recommend the Kona Longboard.
author: Joshua S.

description: This place would be cool if they could keep the sound on and if the jack*** security guard wasn't flashing the light in everyone's eyes! I'm sitting at a table and he's concerned with people standing in the aisles. I understand that the aisles need to be clear, but flashing your dumb light in my eyes does nothing but ruin my experience. Quit being a fat lazy security guard and tell people to move with your words and stop creating an issue with that blinding strobe light! RIDICULOUS!
author: Thomas O.

description: Nice spot right in the heart of downtown, half a block up from union square. It's typical SF prices but a good beer selection. The reason it gets 4 stars is mostly because they have good games- shuffleboard table, arcade games, pool tables, etc. I enjoy places that offer things to do other than sit there and drink. It's clean, spacious and well decorated. Good place to check out if you're in the area.
author: Joana Z.

description:
really big space. tons of TV's. Pac Man arcade game. looks like it would be a really fun place to watch a playoff game. 

great selection of beers on tap. the bartender was really helpful and gave me three tastes before i finally settled in on my choice. that sealed the 4th star in my review.
author: Tera K.

description:
Mediocre food that was served entirely cold when supposed to be hot by inattentive yet pushy server.  Congealed nacho cheese (I'm sorry that is not queso fundido, please call it what it is and don't trick your customers by calling things by something different than what they truly are on the menu) and cold sweet potato fries and  pulled pork tacos? 

I asked our server for water and was told it was self- serve but when I went to the self-serve station it was out of cups.  I went to the bar and had to wait for a long time to ask for cups of water and was told by the bartender that I could get water at the self-serve water station. I told him they were out of cups so he gave me two cups. He did not fill my cups with water so I still had to go fill them at the self-serve station and they did not replenish the cups at the station. Seriously? All this for water.  

Additionally, it was way too loud in the space. I was yelling to talk to my friend who was sitting right next to me. 

Definitely not impressed and not going back.
author: Dee I.

description: Took us 45 to drive there ( 15 without the traffic), paid parking, hungry as fuck , ready to watch the fight and we go there and they tell us they don't show the fight!!! WTF kind of big place in a location like that doesn't show the fight. I guess the owner is imbecile and doesn't want to make money
author: Katrine O.

description:
I'm liking this place!  As a beer lover, I can really appreciate a place that has such a huge selection of beer.  The price during happy hour can't be beat...$2 off any draft beer!  That means that most beers are $4/pint.  Now that's a good deal.

I found the staff to be very friendly & accommodating.  The bartenders will suggest beers based on your tastes & even let you try as many as you like.  I'm always up for trying new beer so after tasting about 4 different ones I chose a Belgian beer called Palm.  It came in it's own fancy glass, too.  Hubby went with the old standard, Mirror Pond.  

They do have a few games (I was eyeing the skee ball...maybe next time) but the most popular seemed to be the shuffle board.  There are also plenty of TV screens so this would be a good place to catch the Giants or 49er games.  The place is huge so you are almost guaranteed a seat.

I'll be back for some more beer soon!
author: Erin S.

description:
I've had some super awesome experiences here! I've been here on both nongame and game days. This is the funnest bar I've been to and in a convenient location. It's really roomy, clean, and there all kinds of arcade games everywhere.

The staff is always extremely accommodating and friendly. There's so many beers on tap to choose from and one of those fun wheels you spin for a surprise beer OR a shot and beer. You never lose with that wheel bc everything on it is worth the $5 to spin it. There's also a large variety of finger foods.

It gets pretty crowded on game days--no surprise bc it's an awesome bar. So, GET THERE EARLY! There are TV's everywhere in all different directions and a huge projector screen too. The crowd is always spirited and with a large venue like this the environment is super fun.

On nongame days it's a nice, calm place to hang out after work. They have a great $10 lunch deal for a burger, fries, and a beer. There are plenty of game machines and skee ball to entertain without having a game on TV.

OVERALL: Love this place. Definitely try it on a nongame day so it's not overly crowded and to just get a feel of the place. You'll love it and want keep coming back.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Came here a couple days ago and were only inside for about 45min. 10 of which were spent waiting for my friend to use the bathroom.

Drove here from the east bay and found some pretty good parking two buildings up and proceeded to walk here. It was a friend of a friend's birthday. Entered, walked up the stairs, and walked onto the main floor. Place is pretty cool honestly, the two stars are probably solely for the fact that they had a Tekken 7 arcade game and some other cool ass fighting games that bring me back to my childhood. Anyway, the reason why I didn't rate this place so high was because of the rude bartender. It takes a lot to annoy/anger me because I get it, I work for a relatively busy cafe and customers can be stupid/slow/rude/frustrating, but I was standing there at the bar waiting/trying to make eye contact with the bartender but got walked passed several times so I just waited until I was approached- I didn't wanna be that dick that whistles/flags down the bartender, I can wait. A minute or two later, of course as I'm turned away from the bar talking to my friend [BECAUSE I'M WAITING] the bartender wants to yell "GUYS. You gotta pay attention". Excuse me? So whatever, alright, I ordered and walked away. Came back afterwards for another drink and knew to "pay attention", wait, and not face away from the bar. Unfortunately, I got the same bartender and ordered. He nodded and walked away then took someone else's order and came back. He tried to take my order again and yelled "What do you want?" and as I repeated my order he yells "you have to speak up you're at a bar". K, Mr. Rude Bartender. It took everything in me + my friend to not yell at him. Are you having a bad day or something, sir?

Point blank, I'm not coming here again. My friend and I refuse to provide service to rude folks.
author: Grey S.

description: Massive sports bar convenient to hotels and theaters. Great screens. Crowd can be loud, too loud to hear the games, sometimes excessively loud plus drunk. Food was adequate for sports bar. You may have to insist on your game staying on your screen.
author: Jim D.

description: The venue is nice, the drinks reasonably priced, but the large staff is just not trained or managed well enough to handle a rush.
author: David A.

description: Awesome sports bar with LOTS of TVs! Definitely a great place for football sundays.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Take into account I went there during one of the World Series games. The place was packed, which was good. However, the service lacked greatly. Understandable for how swamped it was. 

Once we received the food everything tasted pretty good and the selection of beers you just cannot go wrong with.

The atmosphere is just awesome for a sports bar. Noisy, exciting. With lots to do including pool tables, foosball table and so on.

I suggest ordering the big pitcher, it stays cool and you get the most bang for your buck.
author: Bruna S.

description:
I believe this place recently opened maybe 4-5 months ago. I'm surprised there are such few reviews, since this place is awesome!!

1. The place is so spacious! Lots of tables and lounge areas for get togethers.
2. Tons of TVs all tuned into various games for the sports fans
3. 100 beers on tap...around $4/pint! Love it. (Try Magic Hat!)
4. Food selection is pretty cheap. Most everything was less than $10
5. Entertainment galore: skeeball, foosball, pool, and shuffleboard! 
6. Free popcorn. You had me at free. 

Great place for a quick drink or large get together gathering with a group of friends! Fun times!
author: Jenny K.

description:
I can only write about this place as an event venue, but to that end, GGTR has it made.  With a full kitchen upstairs (the food comes from Golden Gate Grill, which is on the 3rd floor), built-in entertainment in the form of arcade games, pool tables, and really nice shuffleboard tables, and an ample selection of booze, our team had nothing to complain about.  

Pricing is reasonable, staff is friendly, and they were able to accommodate our last minute change of plans the week of.  

Food is decent bar fare, and they have enough speciality beers on tap to keep our beer aficionados content.  It's a hipster Dave and Busters, all grown up and livin' on his own in SF.
author: Cherry L.

description:
Nowa is the shit. I came in here the other day. I wanted to play some of the games that they have here. Noa and all of the other people that served me where amazing. They had a lot of people to deal with but I
Did not feel ignored for a second. I would recommend this place to anyone on my experience on the amazing staff and awesome happy hour.
author: Michelle v.

description:
My friend had been telling me about this place ever since it opened but I was a little leery because I'm more into "dive" bars. Well last weekend we decided to go for "Sunday Funday" I'm so glad she convinced me. We had a great time. We sat at the bar. Ordered some Calamari and Queso Dip and was totally taken care of and felt welcomed by Tim the bartender. He really is quiet funny. I wish I could remember the name of the sweet girl that was also working and the Barback's name but non the less. You guys rock and I will be back. It may just be before or after the Dive Bar. ;)
Almost forgot............. My Bloody Mary was Awesome!
author: lisa v.

description:
My high school's 10 year reunion was here and I thought the place was pretty bomb. The place was way better than I expected, and everything about it was pretty good.

I don't really drink so I couldn't really say anything in regards to the beer selection, but it seemed like a really cool place. It was classy and not janky looking. There are pool tables and other arcade games. The food is very reasonably priced. All and all a good experience.

Definitely a 5 star experience. I do agree that the service was a little slow, but it seemed that all my classmates had a great time and I definitely wouldn't mind hanging out at this establishment again.
author: Kevin B.

description: Push past the cheesy signs and decorations and once you are upstairs you'll find a nice and unpretentious grill/ Tap Room. With 50 taps and 50 bottles this place has a seriously respectable beer selection. It's owned by the touristy Lori's Diner people but don't hold that against them, this place has a lot of potential.
author: Manny F.

description:
Cool place, always packed

Shuffle board and buck hunt are the reasons we usually go by
author: Corbin B.

description: Love this place. I was introduced Golden Gate Tap Room by a coworker that made this location his second home! It's big enough to where everyone is not elbow to elbow but it also gets enough traffic so the place doesn't feel like an empty bar at all. Plus you have a great selection of beers and you get to show off your skills, or in my case embarrass yourself, in shuffle board.
author: Brayant W.

description:
Best sports bar I've been to in the city thus far.

1) not overcrowded, but enough people to make it an awesome atmosphere
2) massive TVs so if I needed to get another beer, I didn't need to give up a second of the game
3) great selection of beer on tap (food is also good, particularly the sweet potato fries)
4) fun games to play if you're team is getting killed or it's halftime (shuffleboard, pool, etc)

I will definitely be coming back for the games next weekend.
author: Lesley S.

description:
When I used to live in the city, this was my go to bar for happy hour and/or to relax and catch a game or play some games! The beer selection is huge at this place and if you are truly indecisive, they have a spinning wheel that will make a decision for you! 

The staff at this place is amazing! Super friendly and always swinging by to check up on you. The food itself is average (bar food). They have various games: pool table, shuffle board, skeeball and arcade games! You can also reserve sections if you have a big party conning in! 

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good, relaxing time!
author: Imran M.

description:
I want so badly to love this place but I will probably never go back. 

My first time going was the first Thursday night game for NFL. You walk in to this enormously gorgeous bar right off union square with games and tvs galore. They serve 100 different beers and decent bar food for cheap. All of the signs are there for my new favorite bar. And that's where it ends.

Service is a joke. My first trip there I gave them credit for being brand new and ill prepared for a football game. Three different managers came by our table to pick up pint glasses (clearly they need to have more) but failed to ask if we needed anything or how things were going. 

Last week they had 4 bartenders behind the bar and one cocktail that had no business serving. She had no idea how to control the flow of service,  when to sell a next round and really just made us feel like we were an inconvenience to her.  The 4 bartenders belonged in a dive bar. They were rude and condescending, especially when I asked if someone could put toilet paper in the women's restroom. What a difficult request.

The owners of this nna place need to get it together fast or they won't even make it a year. It would be a shame with all the potential.
author: Joanna Y.

description:
Good beer selection, food was okay (the guy got my order incorrect - even with only two of us at the table), and the service took very long - hence the reason I just ate the food.  

Our beer glasses were empty for 30 minutes while the servers walked around our table, then they suddenly closed out our tab - (handed to us by another patron).  

Needless to say, I won't be going back.
author: Kevin S.

description: This is my favorite bars in San Francisco. It has so many taps and the servers were nice. I was there twice of 5 nights in SF. Love it. There are many games and pool tables in the bar. I would go back there if i ever went back there again.
author: Mark T.

description: Cool layout...cheap happy hour beer..huge beer selection...good view of Powell Street if your a tourista :)
author: Steven K.

description: Place is pretty cool for watching sport games, great TV and atmosphere.  Food is typical bar food, deep fried and spivey. Only downside, place smells like my college basement - beer smell
author: Jim M.

description: Very good selection of beers.  Food was fantastic.  Great place to stop and relax with a beer and some food. Reasonably priced also which is a plus.
author: Chris W.

description:
Dont judge a book by its cover. The latter totally applies to the outside entrance of this fantastic place.

Awesome choice for beers
Great choice for the games, from shuffle board, pool tables, to videogames. plenty for all tastes
Massive, place, I can guarantee you wont feel cramped
Plenty of huge TV screens for your favorite sports

My wife and I had a blast, had fun just like when we were kids.

Long story short, if you want to have real fun with your friends, this is the place!
author: Itachi U.

description: Great place to watch a game. 3 floors of big screen TVs and Projector Screens. The ambiance is pretty upbeat. Very much a bar!!! I recommend this bar to all the sports junkies.
author: Brisa M.

description: Great beer selection, typical bar food. Very nice staff. Very wide open space, but the seating seems limited. Certain areas of the bar do not have a wait staff that will take your order for food or beverage. It is a bit awkward standing in line at the bar to place an order for a beer or food, in hopes of not losing your seat while you're away. That's the worst part about the place, but worth a stop by if you are in the area.
author: J P.

description:
One of my top go-to places when I have large groups of people. It can house hundreds of people here, with skeeball, arcade games, tons of beers on tap, and even a tap spinning wheel! 

I love buying beer off the spinning wheel - whichever bottle it lands on, you get it. Sometimes a free shot of choice. Prices are super reasonable, drink selection is absolutely amazing, and they've got pretty decent food here.

We hosted probably 50+ sales people here before and everybody had a blast.
author: Albert K.

description: Great place if you like to clean your own table, go get your own drinks and ask for things like ketchup. It's your typical mediocre fried frozen food and mediocre to poor service (they asked me to close out for a shift change at half time, your shift change is not my situation).  The plus, they have a ton of tv's. Unfortunately, they don't have a schedule or a plan for what they show where. You'll need to chase someone down and ask for your game on the tv.
author: Jake M.

description: Definitely a cool place to watch a game and drink some beer. But the food is not good at all. We ordered the wing plate and the chili cheese fries and everything was cold which was expected since it seriously took maybe 5 mins for it to out to us. Love the selection of beer and they have a decent Bloody Mary.
author: Cillisa M.

description: You are a sports bar, you know it's the Champions League final and you staff 2 baarkeepers and no waiters? There is a 20 minute line to order right now, the place is full and 3/4 of the tables have neither drinks nor food. Mismanagement at it's best. Do you realize the revenue you are missing out on? Not to mention that you ruin the game for me. One additional star for the decor.
author: Luca E.

description: We were pleasantly surprised by this place!  Our friends were treated rather rudely when they asked to watch the Dodger game across the street at Marriott's Bin 480 so they were referred here to the Golden Gate Tap Room by the hotel bell guy.  We've passed by Golden Gate Tap Room numerous time but never stopped as we assumed it was touristy and not great.  To the contrary, they have a wide selection of beers and a decent happy hour food menu.  They have plenty of TV screens so my friends were happy that they could watch their game, while having beer and apps.  They have plenty of video games, games and entertainment in a fun environment too.  We shall be back!
author: Maile N.

description: The TV's are a-plenty in this joint. Two floors, and HUGE projector screen TV's! Service was the the only downer. Slow to get food and drink orders. However, the food was good, especially for a sports bar. If you're in the financial district, and looking to catch a game, then go for a beer and maybe some wings. It's good for large groups.
author: AJ L.

description: Darian (spelling?!) was the best bartender! So sweet and attentive, drinks were perfect! Very friendly and my friends and I all appreciated her attentiveness :)
author: Nicole R.

description:
Just got back from the bar.  Fiancee and I were there at 8pm on Friday, 8/16.  Great layout, plenty of space, tons of TVs, pool tables, shuffleboard and a phenomenal beer selection.  We are rooting for this bar, but management needs to get their shit together.

There was a line at the bar 12 wide x 2 deep and only 2 bartenders.  Table-tops and seats all over the place and somehow no waitresses???  That is just clueless management.  We left rather than waiting in that 20 minute line again for a beer.  The place had easily 100+ people there, and I'm sure at least a fourth of them would have had more drinks if someone would have come by and taken an order.  How many others probably left for the same reason we did?  Management should watch an episode or two of Bar Rescue, it would do them wonders.

Hope they turn it around.  The foundation is there for an amazing sports bar.
author: Kevin P.

description: Our hotel was nearby so we decided to walk to GG Tap Room for a few beers and snacks to unwind from a day of sightseeing. For a Monday night at around 9pm, the place was pretty packed. I did notice right away there was only 1 waitress for a room of about 40 customers. Many of the tables had not been cleared and the ones that were cleared had not been wiped down. We settled for a sticky table and waited. After about 5 minutes my bf walked to the bar to inquire about any wait staff, the bartender said the waitress was going home and that he should just order from her. We ordered a few beers, nachos, and veggie potstickers. The beers were good, but the food--I could have made at home. The busboy ended up being our "server" for the rest of the evening. In between him serving others and clearing tables, that guy had a very busy evening. I did enjoy the many TVs to keep us entertained.
author: Loren M.

description:
I was visiting SF from out of town and came here to meet a friend for a drink/chat (on his suggestion) - pretty cool setup here. Call me silly (or a tourist) but I rather enjoyed hiking up the stairs to get here. I wasn't expecting it to be very busy, as we came on a weeknight, but it was pretty packed!

There was plenty of seating available and giant TVs all around; other patrons seemed to be really into the hockey game that was on. I was surprised that I was still able to have a good conversation with my friend without having to yell (like one usually has to do at a bar). 

I can't vouch for the food (as we only got drinks) but from spying on other tables, it looked to be pretty standard pub fare, nothing too special. Drinks were good though, and reasonably priced compared to some other places I stopped in!

Great place to grab a drink and chill for a while!
author: Sam S.

description:
Golden Gate Bar and Grill is a bit hidden, but definitely offers a worthwhile lunch near Union Square which is a bonus if you are looking for a hearty meal after shopping. The burger selection isn't too crazy but has solid selections such as a blue cheese burger and decent substitutes for fries. Additionally, it's generally not crowded at lunch during the week because it's tucked away upstairs. 

I don't know if I would go out of my way to return here (unless I was in the area for happy hour as they have an extensive bar selection) but I definitely recommend it to anyone searching for a lunch spot in Union Square.
author: Sophia A.

description: Great location for drinks and game viewing. Nice big screens. Good crowd. I'd definitely go again. Don't know why the average rating is 3 1/2 stars. Should be at least 4 or 5!
author: Maricel D.

description:
Had a great experience here. Came by on a Friday after work for drinks with friends. Def recommend the fried pickles and sour beer. Lots of screens for watching the Giants game. And great service from Shoshanna! Made us feel right at home and got our order/drinks super quick. She'll have us coming back!!
Solid sports bar. Good food. Good atmosphere.
author: Meleah L.

description:
Amazing space, tons of tv's (some delay between different tv's)
The food is good, standard, but well priced.  Exactly what I was looking for.
Loads of beers and variety of drinks.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!! I have NEVER had service this bad.  Had to flag people down for everyhing...first time ordering, wanting another drink, getting the check.  Food came out and was wrong. A beer took 10 minutes to recieve, and the whole time my card needed to be held as a tab, even though we were sitting at a table.  Good luck getting that back.  At one point the waitress walked passed us looking the other way, did not care about us at all.  She also pointed to an empty water cooler when other people asked for water.....

WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. Hire some real employees that actually care, not some emo stoners that hate their job and dont care about sports....its a sports bar!
author: Jesse K.

description: Tons of tvs!!! Tables, couches, shuffle board. Two levels with more than enough room. Feels like big vegas sports book. Lots of beers on tap.
author: Adam R.

description: Been here several times and I always have a blast. I feel like a kid here because there are arcades, billiards and shuffleboard. A huge selection of beers on tap. The menu nicely separates beers into categories which makes it easy to decide what to order.
author: Ming L.

description: Went here on a Friday night to meet friends for drinks.  Great atmosphere.  Lots of room and tvs.  Food service a little slow.  In a great location near union square.   Great selection of beers.
author: Donna T.

description:
Loud.  Like crazy loud.  And some people had their kids in there?  What?  It's a bar.

Anyhoo.  Really was excited about this place.  Food was okay.  My brother got some free shots from the bartender.

But, yo, the service is crap.  It took forever to get a staff member to deign to talk to us to get some orders.  And, then when we put the order in, it took forever to get it.  We had to flag like multiple people down to get our food.  And, don't even ask me about how long it took to get some additional food.

I think if I weren't drinking then, I might have been madder and given it a harder review, so I think they're getting a pass with the 2.  

The idea of the place is great.  But, the execution needs work.  It's stupid loud and the servers don't seem to be able to handle crowds.
author: Shaunita J.

description: Came here with friends for some chill beers and and food, having a nice time. Then some doorman (no idea of name but was wearing a bandana) started walking around eyeballing people and trying to cause trouble (no idea why was friendly atmosphere).  Proceeds to call my girlfriend one of the most racist insults I've ever heard - once we picked up our jaws of the floor, we left and will never return.
author: Liam C.

description:
Like every bad review, the service is horrendous.  I have been here 3 times and each time has been worse.  The food is great bar food, the space is awesome, and the drinks hit the spot.  

This past Thursday, I went to watch some football and the bartenders were overwhelmed and would give you the death stare when you order food.  I even had the female bartender try to persuade me to NOT order food.  She stated it would be like 30 minutes and I told her that's fine. She then asks if I'll be here that long (wtf?!?), again I say yes. She gives this look like I'm a pain in the ass.  

It seems like the bartenders would be better off in a dive bar in the mission.  Sorry you work at a sports bar near Union Square. This bar will be busy, full of tourists, and us working professionals; deal with it. 

I still think it's a great place to watch sports and play some games.  Just expect below-average service.
author: Adam M.

description:
Cool spot, have lots to do there like shuffle board ,arcade games, and even Skee-ball. 
I put $5 into the jukebox for 5 or so songs, but never played. One of the bartenders came out and re issued the credits and still none of our songs played. Overall, fun place, great beer selection, this place is pretty cheap for drinks in the city. Worth checking out!
author: Chris C.

description: Cool place to hang out with friends and good happy hour deals. Space is pretty big. Lots of beer to choose from. I like how they have a lot of east coast beers that are hard to find here. There's games as well, such as shuffle board, skeeball, etc. I had the smoked rib tips, which were really good. Plenty of TVs as well.  There's also a free nacho check in deal if you check in on yelp.
author: Lisa T.

description: Went here a few months back to watch the Warriors playoff game. Great atmosphere. Lots of TV, pool tables and a lot of tables. What more can you ask for? They had a special game day menu that had cheap appetizers which was on point. Would come back for a game or just to hang out to play pool.
author: Gabriel G.

description:
It's pretty awesome inside with all the games. Like an adult chuck e cheese. I beat my boyfriend in skeeball! :D and then got my ass handed to me in a round of billiards, but all in good spirit. If I hadn't been wearing a skirt I would've totally tried the motorcycle game thing. Next time! I wanted to play foosball but everyone was tired already, oh well. 
As their name implies, they have a humungous selection of beer. I just turned 21 a few months ago so I was a bit overwhelmed with all the choices. I decided to try something different and got a belgian "Matilda" beer. I liked it a first but wasn't a huge fan of it towards the bottom. Got a few Stellas after and it totally hit the spot. 

Different sports on each different tv, totally awesome!! I'm SO coming here for the world cup :D!
author: Wanda M.

description:
Fun! Noisy! Good food! Lots of sports games projected on nearly every available wall! Attentive staff. Clean bathrooms. Lots of people having a great time! Everything a sports bar and pub should be!

P.S., the macaroni and cheese is off the hook!
author: Terry T.

description: Good atmosphere, terrible service. Always a full house and not enough staff. Along with that food took over 40 minutes to receive and "forgot" one order so we never received it unit all other food had been eaten. Food is not the best either.
author: Sarah R.

description:
I want to give this place 5 stars because:

* Location is awesome (22 steps away from Union Square)
* 100 beers available
* Skee Ball, Pool, & Shuffleboard
* TVs EVERYWHERE
* HELLA cheap food (get the NorCal nachos.... they're pretty drunk-tastic)
* The bartenders are pretty cool
* The crowd is diverse enough that you won't feel out of place
* THERE'S SOOOO MUCH SPACE!!!
* Great place to watch sports, have a beer, and still keep your lady-friends from bailing on you
* The BEER WHEEL! 
* Happy hour until 7pm = $2 off all beers on tap!

But.... I'm only giving 4 stars because:

* Our waitress sucked. How is it possible to ignore a group of 8 waiving you down for an hour? How is possible to screw up a food order that consists of 3 items - 2 of which were the same item? If you are clearing our empty glasses and we tell you that we want to order a round, why would you just walk away and not take the order? We were there for a few hours and she checked in on us once ... and only because she thought we ordered stuff that we didn't order (because she hadn't come to check on us for an hour).  [disclaimer: They're not all crappy servers... the skinny gal with the long hair is always nice and on point]

It's always sad to lower a biz rating based on the actions of one person - but in this case.... her actions (or lack of) soured our experience. We'll be back again.... we will just avoid her at all costs.
author: Mar A.

description:
A really good sports bar, without the typical sports bar feel. Large TV's with multiple sports playing. Arcade games, pool and a soon to come karaoke bar! This is a good place to chill
When you want to come hang out without all the frills and fuss. Good hangout for tourist especially on weeknights. Service was good! Food was good! Drinks were stiff!
author: Aysia H.

description:
Coordinated a group outing here and everyone really enjoyed themselves with the multitude of games, TVs broadcasting sports, pool, and an endless beer selection. I ordered lunch (which was all bar food) for everyone which worked will with our group. No complaints and a group went back for more beer and fun after an outing. Coordinating with the salesperson was easy and straightforward. The staff was pleasant enough. I would recommend this place for groups.
*mistakenly put down 3 stars; meant to click 4.
author: Tessa M.

description: Service is slow! It might of been the spot we was sitting down. The bar it self is nice I like the point they offer a tons of beers unlike other bars.
author: David P.

description: I came here with my co workers for the first time and I was completely disappointed. I went with a party of 7 and my co workers and I all kept getting charged different prices for the same drinks. Some of us kept the tab open while some paid rights out front. I ended up paying $4.00 more than most of my co workers. On the plus side the location is close to Bart and there are lots of arcade games to play. A place I would like to go to of the prices of the cocktails weren't so inconsistent for every customer.
author: Citlali N.

description: Food is subpar. Waitress was husslin and had easily 100 customers... credit to the wait staff, but the food was actually bad. Soggy "fried" pickles, chicken wings were cold. The "sauce" on the asian nachos was mysterious in taste and color. Next time I'll come to watch the Hawks destroy the niners while drinking a cold one AFTER a real meal.
author: Trey W.

description: Love this spot, love the plethora of TVs, loved getting free nachos with a first check in. Love all the beer choices. Didn't love that my friend who was visiting made me take crown shots on a weeknight and the shots were HUGE.  If it was a weekend, I'd have been thrilled. Love all the games like ski ball.  Super fun place
author: Ross I.

description: Great atmosphere and good drink specials for downtown San Francisco
author: Cathe D.

description:
Ugh.... I really really wanted to like this place, the games, 100 beers on tap, HUGE open space & food! I thought for sure this place would be great. 

First time I went, it was with coworkers and we ordered through the waitresses, that was great and we had fun. But the second and third time we went was later and waitresses don't work passed 9 so if you want food or drinks you have to order up at the bar, which I wouldn't normally have a problem with if the bartenders weren't such dicks! I brought friends from out of town and they all had the same experience, we had one beer and cut out. I was a little disappointed seeing as how my experience with the waitresses were great and I was really rooting for GGTR to pull through but eh, I guess not. 

I will not be back, nor will I recommend this place to anyone after 9pm.
author: Angela C.

description: HUGE televisions. Great service. Food was just so-so, though I kinda liked the sliders and the Vietnamese egg rolls. It's a great place to watch a game and enjoy some new beers, classic beers and decent cocktails. The service level tipped it from 3 to 4 stars from me. Fun spot. Give it a shot.
author: Matt G.

description:
Really cool 2 level pub, lots of Tv's, seating areas, shuffle Board, ski ball and an outstanding Craft Beer selection with atleast a few dozen Taps!
 The bad...  Came here twice on my stay in San Francisco, experienced both a really busy Friday night and a slow Thursday afternoon, both time female Bartenders we're rude and unwelcoming. It was really hard to get a drink from them and even harder to get them to smile. No hospitality from the staff whatsoever.
author: Christine S.

description: We enjoyed our lunch at the Golden Gate Tap Room. The bar tenders were very friendly and the beer selection is fantastic.
author: Christopher H.

description:
3 stars because when my buddy booked an entire room for the Super Bowl, they filled it with strangers anyway, this rendering his reservation useless. WTF?! What happened to our big screen?! They tried to make up for it with a pitcher or two of beer, but that's ridiculous.

Anyway, the food was great, the space is huge (so many floors!), and they have tons of beers on tap. So despite the shitty scheduling mix up, I give this place an extra star for the eats and drinks! Also, they have cider which is great since one of my girlfriends is allergic to gluten and it's often tough to find things she can drink. So woo! Gluten free drinks FTW!

I would definitely come here again with friends for another party or big game. But I'd sternly lecture them over the phone about keeping my reservation as well.
author: Sherilynn M.

description: Great place if you enjoy cocktails, beers, and Sports. Awesome for groups small and large. Plus you've got to love the different games available and the WHEEL!
author: Julian D.

description:
This place is really awesome when it's not crowded. Shuffleboard, pool tables, skeeball, buck hunter HD, 100 reasonably priced beers, private areas for groups. 

The upstairs is depressing. Stay on the main floor. 

Buck hunter takes credit card. Watch out...
author: Andrew M.

description: Came here for the first time on a less crowded night (Sunday) and I really like this place. Nice selection on the beer ( they have my favorite Crispin Pear. Yay!) Ordered the truffle fries and they were good. The waitress who took our order was nice. I'm definitely coming back! :)
author: Linda V.

description: 60 taps to choose from and great service at the bar, but it was quiet on this 3 pm Thursday. The smell was bad at first in the place, spilled beer and cleaner, but it seemed to improve with our second beer.
author: Tim R.

description:
Despite the somewhat touristy name/facade, the 2nd floor bar area is legit -- huge space with an extensive selection of beer from all over the world. atmosphere is fun, young, and filled with 20's and 30's coming for HH. 

The place has a cool vibe with pool tables, big screen tvs, arcade games. Great for watching a game or a hosting a big group.
author: Miri Kwon R.

description: Exemplary selection of craft brews and my friends and I enjoyed the big screen. Go Green Bay! And my Calicraft Buzzerkeley.
author: Jodie N.

description: Awesome atmosphere. Plenty of ways to watch sports.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Amazing tap beer selection. 21st amendment is my fav... ordered the tap room burgers with bacon and a fried egg. Off the hook  probably one of the top 5 burgers I have ever eaten, hands down and the staff was very attentive & friendly. I'm very surprised this burger hasn't been named top 10 in San Fran.
author: Marcy V.

description: A fantastic place for so many reasons - great for groups, incredible selection of taps, lots of entertaining and reasonably priced arcade games... honestly, it's all been said before and I don't have much to add except to verify the experiences of so many others. I've been three times and each time had a fantastic beer I had never tried before. The wheel of drinks is fun if you don't know what you want and like surprises, but it was broken the last time I went. I went with a group of 6 the first time, and we ended up rotating between a few arcade games for a bit as it was pretty loud and hard to have a conversation with a group. I went with one friend another time and had a great casual conversation over beer, so I'm sure it varies by night and by time. I'm hesitant to go anywhere near Union Square out of fear for crowds of tourists, but this is a very fun and high quality spot.
author: Chris M.

description:
We went by here on the way back from a comedy club to wind down before going back to hotel room.

Good beer selection. A good sized crowd for a Tuesday night. Lots of activity, music was a good loud. It really felt like we were hanging out at someone's cool basement ... lots of games around the perimeter, a couple of shuffleboard games going on, even skee ball, some standard video games and pinball. we hung out for an hour, even got roped into refereeing a couple of shuffleboard calls. 

Great, no pressure overall vibe. Go here and expect to enjoy yourself, being yourself.
author: Michael B.

description: This place is awesome! Good drink and food specials. Fun customer service, a lot of beers on tap!
author: Melissa D.

description: First time going to this place yesterday, upon arrival I was eager and excited for my visit. When showing my id to the bouncer instead of being mellow about our interaction, he starred me and my friends down as if he was trying to intimidate us. I moved on with my group of friends and was impressed by their wide variety of beer selection. Also their mixed drinks were quite tasty. I didn't like how everything was sticky from the menus to everywhere on the floor. Also 10 mins before closing me and my friend got kicked off the pool table when their was clearly more time. Once again the bouncer trying to intimidate us over the pool tables. Overall a fun place with a lot of different games, definitely would go here to entertain some friends. But the hospitality just wasn't there and not sure how much they do for closing because everything seemed a bit raunchy.
author: Rocky V.

description:
I usually come here for the Meetup event every Tuesdays. I like the area because it's spacious and there's a huge TV/projector so you can watch whichever game is live.

The only reason why it's 4 stars is because they close "early" at midnight (for the bar) while the restaurant on the 3rd floor closes at 10pm.
author: Jake T.

description: Had my birthday here and it was so much fun. Something to do for everyone! I didn't even have to entertain my guests!
author: Aleks E.

description: It was late, and we were hungry, but still wanted to be part of the action, so we stopped in here.  Food was great.  Atmosphere reminded me of a Lucky Strikes or Dave & Busters.  A little confusing to find a table, but flagged down a waitress and she helped us out, and was very friendly.  Was honest about menu items not being enough to share and helping to suggest some items.  We even tried an Apricot beer that was excellent.  It was a great ending to our quick weekend trip!
author: Jasmin U.

description:
Came here last night with a big group of co-workers, many of whom had been here before and raved about it.

We had an awesome time.  We did not order the food, nor did we need to hear the sports.  (Honestly I'm not sure I've been to many "crossover" sports bars that have the volume up, because usually there are a ton of screens showing different games/events so it doesn't make any sense to have the volume up.)

We found the service to be extremely friendly, and attentive almost to a fault.  Everyone had great drinks and beers, all of the beers we ordered (a wide variety) were available.

Loved the vibe.  Tons of space, lots of tables and seating, big windows overlooking the hubbub street vibe of Sutter and Powell.  Lots of great games: pool, shuffleboard, skeeball, the big beer wheel, etc.  Last night they were showing the XGames on some of the screens which was awesome.

The entrance is unobtrusive and you walk upstairs, so even though it's right off Union Square and it was a Sat night, I did NOT get a B&T or tourist vibe at all.  The people there seemed likely mostly SF'ers to me.

Highly recommend, would go back in a sec.
author: Toby V.

description: Great spot to watch the Warriors in the playoffs. Crowded...but a screen everywhere for you to watch the game. Good drinks choices, not overly expensive. Enjoyed this place...
author: Ed O.

description: Wanted to get a drink after dinner stopped at the first bar we seen...well the disclaimer didn't say we had to walk up 17 flights of stairs grrrrr J/k they had an elevator lol but non the less we sat at the bar and Damian was our bartender told him to make me a Pineapple Express #killedit then my co worker ordered a lemon drop......yuuuuuum!  He's great!!  Good atmosphere, friendly and worth it!
author: Frenchie B.

description:
WARNING: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE FOR BIG EVENTS.

Golden Gate Tap Room is unbelievably unprepared to handle the amount of people they can fit. We went for World Series Game 3 last night (Friday). Here is what we got:

-Long wait to get in.

-We ordered 2 appetizers. They took two hours to come ... two hours. TWO HOURS. After we complained for the 4th time, the manager came and offered to give us extra appetizers for free. At least he made some effort, but frankly the whole order should have been free. The food that came was barely edible. Boneless teriyaki wings were cold and bland. Chicken fingers had been left in the deep fryer too long and tasted burnt. Nachos were awful; canned cheese with burnt bacon and a couple chopped tomatoes. Even with the free extras, the food wasn't worth more than $5 all together, and the check for the 2 terrible original appetizers was $17.

-When our server disappeared for long periods of time, we tried getting beers at the bar, but it was near impossible. Multiple times I waited at the bar trying to get a beer for 20+ minutes (not exaggerating) and just gave up. It turned into people waving money in the air every time a bartender looked up.

Frankly, even though the service was bad, I don't know what the servers or bartenders could have done. They were just criminally understaffed and unprepared. This is a failure in management. 

This place seems like it could be fun on a slow night if you just want drinks. But DO NOT trust Golden Gate Tap Room to provide a good time when it counts.
author: Steve P.

description:
I have been there twice now in 2014, once for my birthday and another for a friends birthday. I really like the space, its like an upscale sports bar. TONS of beer on tap and a full bar. Unfortunately I always show up by the time the kitchen is closed so I cant speak on their menu but it looks good. The waitress brought us their homemade chips as a consolation to the kitchen being closed, so props to her. 

I have to shout out the manager that took my birthday reservation, he got my group a great location with a pool table, he even comped me a drink when I arrived. I am a fan and will be a regular to this place. I still want to try the sit down restaurant on the 3rd level. I also cant wait till they change their closing time to 2am.
author: Ed S.

description: Tried to play shuffle board at a seemingly empty table, but the bar tender said someone had booked it and didn't return the pucks.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Fun atmosphere, awesome selection of lagers, ales, and ciders from around the world. Wine also looked decent. 

Saw some beer I never even knew was sold on draught- I'd only ever seen it in bottles. A bit pricy, but that's sf for you. Definitely a must-go for the end of a long day walking.
author: Em K.

description: Great bar to drink. Skewers are amazing, and prices are great bartenders are friendly and a great atmosphere. Don't be scared of the door at the front it's worth walking through.
author: Sergio L.

description:
We had an event here and had a great time.  Atmosphere was fantastic with tons of huge TVs, games, two great shuffleboard tables, skee ball, and pool (though it felt like it may have been a smaller table than standard).  We ordered from the full dinner menu (which the owner went out of the way to make possible for us even though it wasn't usually an option) and at least my meal (the chicken club) was quite good.  You don't come to a bar expecting haute cuisine, but as pub food it was very enjoyable.  

Overall the whole group had a good evening and we'd definitely go back.  I'm not sure why the reviews are low so far, hopefully they're working through initial growing pains as a fairly new establishment.  The owner seems legitimately to be working on any sort of service issues, and given the quality of the space there's a lot of potential here.
author: Anthony P.

description:
I came here on a Saturday around 4pm.  I really wanted to like this place, but I just can't. The space is great, and I like that there is shuffle board and skee ball and lots of TVs.  

HOWEVER, the service and food is lacking severely. We sat at a table, and no one came by. We ordered at the bar instead, and after an hour of being there a waitress showed up to take our orders. Strange.

The beers from tap were WARM and I was served the bottom of a keg's unfiltered thick beer.  When I returned it to a different bartender, it was acknowledged that I shouldn't have been served that. I'd even question the cleanliness of the taps, the beer just tastes weird and warm. Order something in a bottle.

The food is your typical bar food, and some dishes are even worse than that. We ordered fries for one, from the bar again as the waitress kept going missing, and they arrived cold. The "queso fundido" was just your can cheese with some cut up sausage on top. Everything is cheap, so at least you're not being rip offed I guess.

And finally, the crowd is just plain weird if you are a local. Or a normal tourist.  At this hour, people were wasted. The bartenders and waitresses were seemingly encouraging it.
author: Jeanne M.

description: What a awesome treat.  The hospitality is great.  The service and the food is great.  Make sure to spin the wheel at the bar. The wheel has a awesome selection of beers and if u get lucky you will get a shot to go with the beer.
author: David D.

description:
It's an awesome sports bar with tons of options for beer and games to play. I really like the atmosphere and it's perfect if there is a game on and doesn't get insanely crowded like other sports bars do. 

Their sign outside says Happy Hour goes til 7pm but that is a lie. It ends at 6pm. I asked the guy why they hadn't changed the sign or at least put a sign up noting that sign is wrong and he said he didn't know.
author: Jordan A.

description:
Shuffleboard, fooseball, skiball, 

Lot of great beers on tap.

Friendly bartenders and very spacious area.

Pricing was reasonable.  I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Charles S.

description:
I like this place a lot, it's a cool sports bar. I've been here twice and it was during the World Series, which you could only imagine how packed it was, but it was still a good time. 

The food is actually good too, they have a huge selection of beers. They have a couple floors to this place so the beer/food selection may be different, depending on what floor your on. That was the only downfall.
author: Elisia H.

description:
Great sports bar for union square area. tons of large big screens. beer is average priced, but they have a LARGE menu. cocktails are bit pricey, but for union square they are not.

The only complaint is get there early for a big game the place will be overly packed, so you will have to stand up if you're not an hour early.

Lot of tourists as well as its right around the hotels.
author: Dakin G.

description: My friends and I went here last night and we had the best time! Michael is the hardest worker there and was so nice to everyone. I also loved Jessi or Jamie I forgot her name but she was so sweet. Also Fred Claus!!! we will definitely come back again next time we're in SF
author: Aishling C.

description: This is a pretty cool hang out spot in Union Square. There's plenty of things inside to keep you entertained. They have a lot of beer selections and there's plenty of room to catch up with friends. My only complaint is that it can get pretty loud, but what bar isn't? FYI... No cover charge!!
author: Mertani G.

description:
Maybe this place is great if it's Saturday (I hear they don't have Sunday Ticket), you're wasted and forgot to have brunch so the food they serve you feels like the greatest thing you've ever shoved in your slobbery mouth.

If you're not a hot mess, this place is terrible.

Apathetic (read: non-existent) service. Waited an hour for food to come out cold (sent back, try again) on a Thursday night. Here's what we had:

Burger : dry meat, dry bread, no condiments

NorCal Nachos : cold gloppy bright orange cheese...like the kind that comes put of a pump. Gross.

Jalapeño Poppers : Good. Glad they didn't fuck up deep fried food. Slow clap.

One star for a decent beer selection and comfy atmosphere.
author: Caroline M.

description: This is a really fun place to come with a big group! Located right downtown/in Union Square, it's a huge space with a ton of TVs and games to play. If you check in on Yelp, you get free nachos which were big and delicious! So worth it! They also have a ginormous selection of beers.
author: Alexandra W.

description: Great waitress Stacy, very kind and friendly. Very low key and a good time. Great tasting beer on tap.
author: Lifhdy V.

description:
This place was definitely a good time for me & my friends.  We are constantly looking for places where we can play foosball! The only down fall was that our food came out abnormally cold.  We order about 4 different types of apps to snack on while we took turns.  Also the spinner wheel was broken =/ 
In any case, the shots tequila were great & the atmosphere was made for adult fun SF Style!
author: Patrisha B.

description: The place is amazing if you like craft beer and noisy environments. If you go there and it's late - good luck with finding some fun.
author: Mariano Q.

description: This place is my favorite place to watch big games! Go to the top level! 2 big screens and lots of other televisions up there too. There are a few pool tables, skee ball, pinball machines and a great bar and food!
author: Tiffani M.

description: Its an awesome place that has multiple floors with tons of TVs and games to play when watching the big game.
author: Beni R.

description: I love this place, for me it's my favorite sports bar in the city. The place is so huge even when it's crowded you still have space. It's also not that hard to get a drink when it's too busy. Staff is fast food is decent a lot of different beers on tap. Tons of tvs so you can see from anywhere.
author: Brandon L.

description: Yummy nachos and great beer!  Cool atmosphere for game watching! Great place to make new friends and play games.
author: C K.

description: This place seems like it should be cool, but is mainly just a bummer.  I mean, if you need a place for, like, 572 friends to meet up and watch a game then I guess this is the spot.  But even then, it's kind of miserable.  The food is a definite NO, but I guess the drinks are fine.  It's definitely a tourist trap due to its proximity to Union Square.  Nothing against tourists, but it just contributes to the dullness of an establishment when it is dependent and reliant on the tourist scene.  It's like bars think that they don't have to try hard to give their customers a great experience, because no matter what they will get customers.  The tourists don't know any better.  They just know convenience.  Which is this place.
author: Kristen F.

description: Great sports bar. Excellent place to take coworkers or anyone new to the city. The place is huge and offers all kinds of games including pool and air hockey, prices are reasonable and food isn't bad. Tons of TVs all over so it's the perfect game day spot.
author: Lilly M.

description: Great bar! You can see whatever you want and they even switch channels according to your preference.
author: Mark V.

description:
I don't know what's up with the low ratings, but if you love beer, this is the candy store of beers! 50 drafts and 50 bottles. You'll find yourself not knowing what to get because of the extensive beer menu!

They have foosball, shuffleboard, skee-ball, and a pool table too. I didn't play any games, or order any food, so all I have to say is if you're here for beer, you won't be disappointed. The Happy Hour is great. Not sure what the specifics are, but in this area, 2 draft beers for under $10 is a really good deal. Located on the 2nd floor above Walgreens, it is very spacious with lots of seating, multiple TVs to watch sports, and a relaxed atmosphere. Not at all touristy as I suspected. Will be coming back, for sure.

Have to minus a star though because I ordered a Snakebite expecting a pint of half lager and half cider, but got a bottle labeled "Snakebite" instead. That was a first. =/
author: Zell C.

description:
Spin the wheel of beer!!!!
Maybe not for 5 drink orders at one time cause the bartender won't be the happiest with you but hey... not sure what to get... spin away!!!!
There is so much to do here I don't even know where to begin!!  Ski ball, Foosball, shuffle board, pool, on and on and on!!!! 
This place is so much fun!! I think they have a restaurant upstairs but haven't made it that far.. too much to do and not enough time to do it all!!
author: Mike H.

description: So fun during big games, love the mystery wheel! Huge space, lots of seating. Can get a shot & beer for $6
author: Krysten R.

description:
This place has an extensive beer list and really tasty food. They have a $2 off HH deal as well. There is a whole restaurant and bar upstairs too.
 However; it's a really douchey atmosphere, it's hot and clammy even on a mild day and the service sucks.
 I wanted to try more beers and more food but the sloppy looking bartender in the filthy shirt was too busy chatting with friends and fellow employees to bother with the only customer at the bar. The server was just to busy not making eye contact.
There are not enough tourists in SF to keep this dump going for long.
author: Richard L. D.

description: This is a bro bar. There is a big emphasis On sports but that is not even an issue because I dig basketball/baseball and football. This place clearly caters to men, or young women. The bathroom was missing toilet paper. We sat at the bar for 5-7mins and no one attended us, we then ask a waitress if we sat a high top would we get wait service...she said sure! We sat at table for 10mins...no one came. We sat back at bar. (We are really easy going ladies...patience was wearing thin) finally service...(it was 7pm on a Thursday.) the bar tender was knowledgeable and friendly! Success!
