Only to find out heels switching shifts!  not my favorite place in SF. If u are a man younger 30 or a lady younger then 25. Or serious sports fanatic/pool table enthusiast (not tons of tables) there are plenty of bars that will cater to adults !
author: Jo V.

description: Neat venue. About time this area got a decent sports bar. Portion sizes are pathetic. Ordered buffalo wings. 4 small wings for 6 bucks. Lame. Way overpriced. At two bucks, this appetizer would have been priced appropriately. Still hungry. Need to find someplace else to eat. Afraid to order anything else here.
author: John T.

description: Best beers! Great games! Great time. Went here for a company party and had a blast. Our bartender Shoshanna was the best! Can't wait for the next party!
author: Stephanie N.

description: I just finished a client event at Golden Gate Tap room on the 3rd floor and it was a huge success!!! The staff including Yuli, Daniel, Michelle and Jose made my day and my event successful!!! And of course the rest of the staff too! Thank you to GGTP! Not only a great place to host an event but a great place to hang out and have fun. Food was great too especially the philly cheese sliders! Yummy!! Thanks guys. We'll see you next year!
author: Meghna K.

description:
Place is legit I like it, has a lot of good beer selection and is a good place to go.

I recommend trying the sampler for the food the fries and nachos are good and crispy

I come here for the bar not the restaurant. Next time I will try the restaurant.
author: Royston H.

description: I randomly found Golden Gate Tap Room on my Yelp app. I walked to the restaurant since my hotel was close. The entrance is located up a flight of stairs. The restaurant was laid back during lunch time. I was able to watch sports and grab a quick bite to eat. I had a burger with fries. I thought the burger and fries were cooked well.  It wasn't the greatest burger but definitely good. Food prices are reasonable. There are a variety of beers on tap (great selection). The bartender was attentive. The restaurant has multiple televisions throughout (great for watching sports). Customers can play skee ball as well. There's a wheel behind the bar labeled with beers and shots. Customer can pay to spin the wheel and win a beer or shot. That's a cool idea for a sports bar in my opinion. The Golden Gate Tap Room is a good choice for watching sports and drinks/food. I give Golden Gate Tap Room a 3.5 rating.
author: Dominic B.

description:
I came four times in the last year. Three times on a Saturday afternoon, and once on a Thursday night. 

The three Saturday afternoons were great. There were a fair number of people, plenty of games on, and drinking games to play all over. Like a Dave and Buster's in a really amazing location with a bit more upscale vibe. The big projector screens had plenty of seating, so I was able to get perfect seats for all the big games. A great bar environment that is worth checking out on a casual weekend.

Thursday, however, was a disaster. My friend and I walked in and placed an order at the bar. The bartender told us to take a number to the table of our choice, so we sat alongside the Powell Street wall (opposite side of the bar). We closed out our tab there at the bar and our food came as promised.

Two other couples were at tables next to us. Every table took turns flagging down servers, bus boys, and even patrons who looked like they might be waiters. It was impossible to get an additional order taken. My friend and I wanted drinks, so I looked around for an employee to notify.

I stopped a very busy waitress twice to insist that she take my order, but she kept insisting that she wasn't my server. I understand that my order isn't her direct responsibility, but someone needs to be concerned with how long people wait to get a glass of water, place an order, or even make a complaint.

A long time later, a new waitress finally came by to take one order. ONE. And then she left. She did not return for a long time, and when she did, it was to deliver the first table's food. I waved to her as she walked away to a private party, ignoring me. We waited longer. No dice. We got up and left.

I wasted more than 45 minutes in that bar without being able to order a drink. No water refill, no alcohol, no extra food. Nothing. I hope it was someone's first day, because I can't think of any other reason for such a performance.
author: Jared S.

description: Holy crap, I can't believe I've never been here during the 1 year I have been working in the big city. One of my former colleagues had his last day event at the Golden Gate Tap room. This place is awesome. There is a bar, a bunch of games, and a pool table. Definitely a great place to hang out after work for Happy Hr. I am not much of a beer girl, but I love hard cider. They have a good selection of cider here. So I checked in here and I went to redeem my free nachos. Ordered a cider, and the bartender forgot my order of FREE nachos. The awesome thing was he gave me a free beer to redeem because he forgot my FREE nachos. How awesome is that. Free beer and free nachos. Thanks bartender! You'll definitely see me here again.
author: Quyenna T.

description:
I'll start off by saying this place is dope and I have been coming here since the world cup. I always come here to watch big games and normally come with a big group of friends. It's the kickback spot. I've never had any complaints since I love the atmosphere and the workers, but today was an exception. 

Normally the staff is really nice, but today, since the get-go our "redhead" waitress was really sassy and rude. I came with a group of friends which had to eat and leave early for a concert, but I stayed with a friend to finish watching the Sunday night football game. Since my friends were in a hurry they got up to pay and thats when our waitress got ticked off. Place was understaffed tonight, so obviously she was stressed out about that (not my fault so don't take it out on me), but then when she came back she didn't give us our change. When asked for it she started yapping about tip which we were going to do, but she lost it once she started complaining to us and being rude. I had never had a waitress harass me over a tip before and I could not help, but laugh that she was really losing all manners and losing the reputation I had for this place over a couple of dollars. She might as well have begged us for change...

What pissed me off was the fact that I was still drinking a beer and she came and took it and threw it out. I got up and complained to the bartenders and spoke to the manager, who were apologetic, but didn't really seem to care, and I left under the impression that I am not the first person to complain. After reading a couple of yelp reviews I realized I'm not the first person to realize that this place is understaffed and their servers are a**holes. 

Like I said, this place is cool and when I've eaten here the food is good. I had nothing but good memories here, but today was a joke. I know it was because of a dumb redhead waitress, but not coming back here. I'm honestly surprised that women got hired with that attitude, and if it was because of her looks, then they need to reconsider hiring, because she's not very appealing to the eye.
author: Carlo J.

description: I had to change my review from two stars to one when thinking about it: even the decent service couldn't save this restaurant. The food was probably the worst I ever had in a restaurant. No matter how hungry you are, don't eat here! This place is nice for having a drink and watching the game but that's all.
author: Anni T.

description: Golden Gate Tap Room is a great place for a quick beer and some pool, but if you want food, I would suggest somewhere else. I had the nachos which tasted like melted Velveeta on stale, soggy chips. The bacon bits were all concentrated on a single chip at the very top of the pile as well, causing a problem with fair distribution. But if you stick with beer, you'll be fine. Cocktails are a no no.
author: Lawrence H.

description: Huge TVs everywhere, so many beers and full bar in general, arcade games, pool, shuffle board, cheap drunk eats. what more is there to life?
author: Sarah S.

description: Great sports bar!   Huge place, two floors.  Cool big screens everywhere!  Nice beer selection too.  The food was just okay, nothing that really stands out.   Best place to be on Sundays but you do need to get there early, especially on Niner game days.  Will try to make it for March Madness coming up soon.
author: Richard M.

description: Very cool bar right across the street from the Sir Francis Drake hotel.  Huge beer selection, including the wheel of beer.  Burgers and apps are priced right and tasted great.
author: George C.

description: Great location. Very chill sports bar with really cheap drinks. If you want to get drunk, you can get really cheap AMFs and a variety of beers. Skeeball lovers will also love this place. The entire staff there is great too. Only downside is it closes a bit early.
author: Jin N.

description: Second time here for a team outing.  Lots of beer selection and the food is a-ok.  Shuffleboard is fun.
author: Rossi K.

description: I'm surprised this place has such low ratings. It's such a gem to find a sports bar this size with a legit happy hour in union square! The beers were $4 during happy hour, and there is a pool table, shuffleboard, video games and skee-ball!
author: Peggy L.

description:
Disclaimer: This entire review is based off an entirely disrespectful way of dealing with patrons. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the bartenders but this review is not a reflection of that. 

I did some research and decided this would be a great place to watch the finals of the World Cup. We got there early because we knew it would be busy and found a table. Everything was pretty cool until we tried to order food. This review is entirely based is on the service and how they treated us. Our waitress told us we couldn't purchase a la carte items, but we could pay $20 upstairs for a buffet. Keep in mind if we had ordered about 4-5 things for our table it would have been about $20-30 total for a table. Not wanting to do that because it was a rip-off and because that is NOT what was advertised on their website, a staff member told us it was fine for one person to purchase a ticket to the buffet and for the table to share. We had seen at least 3 other tables do this. Well about 30 minutes later this angry man comes and tells each of us who had been eating have to pay $20 each. He was extremely rude when he came over and we tried to explain what happened and what another staff member had told us. He didn't make us pay the $20 but he was angry about it and had someone take the plate of food away after we told him we wouldn't eat anymore besides the person who paid for it. 

The thing that makes me upset is this is not a result of anything I or fellow customers did but the lack of communication regarding staff members. The manager/owner changed the policy to make everyone pay $20 for bar food- wings and fries when they normally have these available a la cart. In addition, instead of being nice about the whole thing, the person who spoke to us was a jerk, plains and simple. Everyone at our table was quite taken aback and we will NOT be recommending this place to any of our friends for the simple reason that customer service made us feel disrespected.  

I understand the manager sometimes posts to poor reviews and apologizes, but this was something that should have been thought about before a busy weekend.  Had we just been able to purchase some fries and nachos, it would have been the same price we paid for the buffett and I would be giving rave reviews about this place.
author: Lori M.

description: You have to pay for shuffleboard and the service is very slow. DO NOT go to watch the 49ers or Giants, the place will be packed and it will be impossible to get a server's attention. Also despite having multiple tv's, there are many places where you can not easily see a screen. There are much better places to watch a game in this city.
author: Laura F.

description: Good sports bar.  Check in on yelp for free nachos!
author: Kelly M.

description: Beer selection is great.  Bars space is amazing.  Management at this establishment is something we all wish wasn't this bad... And it was.   They kicked us out of our seats because they forgot the reserved sign.  They didn't send a waitress or waiter over for 2.5 hours when we've asked several time (we went to the bar instead so whatever). Last thing... My party went to go smoke and I asked the manager (who previously kicked me out of my table and then bought us a beer) to watch our table because I needed the restroom.  He promised he would stay and watch our stuff... Least he could do.  As soon as I walked away, he walked away to talk to some girls.  Really really awful derive here.
author: Michael B.

description: I really enjoy this place. 2nd floor or 3rd floor it's always an enjoyable time!! My after work cool down or sports bar favorite!!
author: Dana D.

description: Tons of great beers on tap on the lower level, the food isn't bad either but DO NOT go on the top story. We went to watch a game and the bartenders were extremely slow, rude and understaffed. Stay downstairs and get a good craft beer.
author: Mark Y.

description:
This is one of those "I wish I could give half a star" reviews.  This place stinks, literally.
Separate security staff. all morons.  Large group, seated comfortably and buying food and drinks, told they have to move.  The other group "reserved" the area by "giving the bar a pile of cash".  That's an actual quote.  The half star is only for the beer selection, although they are out of about a third of the beers they list.
author: Cap O.

description: Not sure what's the deal is with this place. Came here on a weekend night, not terribly packed. A server came and said she'll be back to wipe our sticky table, never came back again, not even to take our drink orders. Later she was seen busy flirting with the table next to ours. Fine, we got up and order some beer from the bar. All night we tried to wave down some people to order fries to no avail. And they kicked us out sharp on 12am!!! What kind of bar does that? :( Never going back.
author: YY M.

description:
I hate giving only 2 stars but my first trip to the Golden Gate Tap Room may be my last. With its multitude of TVs and a couple of very large big screens, it is a great place to watch sports, I'll give it that. It's also very large, making it a good spot for a party or large group to catch a game or play pool. Here
s where the two stars come from: 1) The service was terrible - our waitress was perfectly nice but every round took FOREVER, and our drinks arrived watery with all the ice practically melted - no good bartender or waitress would let drinks go to the table like that. No apologies when I complained. At around 7:45 PM we ordered a few appetizers, and only after we complained how long they were taking did they admit the order hadn't gone in. The food finally arrived around 8:45...and they didn't comp a thing! and 2) Speaking of the food that almost didn't arrive, it was terrible. The skewers were overcooked and whatever they were calling the orange stuff on top of the nachos, it wasn't cheese. So if you are looking for a spot for sports and beer, I guess it's your place but don't order cocktails or food.
author: Ingrid E.

description: I walked in here and walked out because it was too crowded. It's not my cup of tea. If you want to stand around to watch a game (unless you get there super early) and hear people live and die with each moment of a game even if it's the first quarter and first baskets of a basketball game (for example), maybe this is the place for you.
author: Lucky B.

description:
Great for hosting big parties and enjoying all the entertainment galore (skeeball etc), but NOT for locals who are used to your neighborhood bars and the SF hospitality. Both my friend and I had terrible interactions with bartenders two seperate times.
Perhaps the bartenders view everyone to be tourists.. and feel justified or even privileged treat customers rudely since they've been around for awhile or they simply won't see them again. 
To iterate my side of the story, first the bartenders were VISUALLY choosy about people they serve first. When we all know they can never be completely on top of serving  people in the right order, at this joint I was starting to think I was being refused to be served since he even made an eye contact with me.
After getting my beer (that's after waving and getting his attention) he took my card without a word, kept serving other people and never came back to me. When I asked to have my card back, he called me "honey" and told me that I'm going to have to wait.
Absolutely absurd! Guys, I'm going to stick to my small neighborhood bars with relatable bartenders without control issues.. I don't want to gamble my nightouts for a thin possibility of getting friendly service at this spot. Not impressed :(
author: Michelle Y.

description:
They have really nice shuffle board tables, the food was quite good and everyone was really friendly. Bar staff was quick, too. I'm not a fan of sports but many of the people I was with were and there were large TV's and projectors all over the place for loads of different games. They also have loads of space.

We had a blast, definitely a cool place to go.
author: Doug S.

description: I went here for a Warriors game a week or so ago.  Lets face it the Sports bar scene is lacking in San Francisco as a whole. This place might be the best place I've been in the city to watch a sporting event.  On top of it they have tons of entertainment scattered about (skeeball, shuffleboard, pool, video games, etc) If you want to enjoy the game from a couch or booth you can do that. If you want to sit at a table with stools you can do that too.  Pretty much every way you could imagine watching a game is here.  Prices are reasonable and the food is pretty good.  It's not the greatest but that's not why you come here but it was all cooked well enough to eat with your booze and yell at your favorite teams.  Staff is all friendly and welcoming.  I plan to do most of my public sports watching here in the future.  I'm just really sad I found this place after football season was over.
author: Joco F.

description: Great atmosphere, plenty of activities. Fantastic selection of beers. If you're looking for a sports bar with plenty of screens & a great selection of drinks this is the place for you. The pub snacks here were fantastic, I highly recommend the filet mignon skewers & the mahi tacos you can't go wrong with either. We'll definitely come back here from now on.
author: Martika A.

description:
Well, what can I say about this place. Let's start with about the only positive i have... This place is called a tap room, and they live up to the name. Having thirty or more taps. 
That is the end of my positive review. To be 100% honest there was plenty of beer to choose from, unfortunately it isn't cold. So if you are looking for a enjoyable cold beer that doesn't taste like the the wane beer of Eastern Europe, I would recommend going somewhere else. 
Along with warm beer comes "great" service, by great I mean non-existent. It took several staff members to walk past my family and I before we realized that there would be no service for us. Needless to say, we we were able to get some warm beer. 
And last but certainly not least, the cleanliness was below average. I'm pretty sure no one has whipped the tables off since the last time the Niners won the super bowl.
Stay clear of this place if you are a connoisseur of beer.
author: Kyle J.

description: Waited half an hour at the bar and got no service. No eye contact and totally disregarded me. My friend that met me up even waited with me and finally left. First time here and probably the last time.
author: Tommy P.

description: If you are looking for a casual bar for a large group of friends, this is your place! Very fun and relaxed atmosphere, and very spacious with tons of types arcade games, pool tables, shuffle boards, etc.  The drinks weren't too expensive, and they have a large selection of beers. In addition, they have plenty of seating so you don't have to worry about standing around all night with your drinks.
author: michael l.

description: Hands down worst service in the city. At the bar or the table, all the employees are incompetent and careless. Sat for 55 minutes before anyone even came to our table and I had gone to the bar 5 times to try and get some one to come help us, after getting asked at least twice each of the 5 times where we were sitting, still no one even came close to walking by us. They forgot our food, took 35 minutes to get 2 beers, got water in Dixie cups, the guy in the bathroom was peeing on the floor...just a shit show. Really really disappointed because it is a great bar in a great location and has an abundance of TVs and games. If this review means anything to you, don't go here. Waste of 2 hours of my life.
author: Steven L.

description:
I was not terribly impressed with this place; partly my expectations and partly how they delivered.

tl;dr - meh, good beer selection, but poor service, mediocre food, and lacking the advertised (by SFist and thrillist, not GG tap room) "arcade".  Might go a 2nd time to give them another chance.

Ultimately I was pretty disappointed in my experience here.  I went because of an article in SFist that described this as a huge bar and arcade.  I met up with a friend on a weekend afternoon and there were a couple people behind the bar as well as a couple servers/runners going about on the floor.  At that time, there were about 5 total patrons, 3 at the bar.  It took a while to get greeted, and had to be pretty assertive to get served.  The beer selection was good, and the liquor and wine selection seemed to be as well.

We shared a couple of appetizers; the buffalo wings were pretty bad (or aggressively mediocre? certainly edible, but not good).  Over the few of hours we were there, there were probably about 7-9 total individuals at the bar and we still averaged at least 15 minutes of having an empty drink and trying to get someone's attention - bartenders were most often chatting with each other, but sometimes with a patron that they seemed to already know.

There seemed to be a bunch of TV's, so it might be a good place to go during games, though the floor was also setup a bit strange, with having to go out of your way to get to and from the pool table or around due to railings and ramps.

Ultimately, I might go back just because they were new and it's reasonable to give them a second chance, but with so many great places in SF you really need to nail it the first time.
author: David N.

description: Really fun place! Perfect for big groups! There is just so much to do here! from games to spinning she wheel for a drink! THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!
author: Andre L.

description: Very understaffed for a sports bar. There was only one bartender staffed and it was obvious that everyone waiting to order was getting frustrated. I heard multiple people standing around me who asked there friends "should we just go somewhere else?". I hope the management will eventually realize that you have to have additional bartenders on game days if you're running a sports bar.
author: Richard C.

description:
This place brands itself as a sports bar, but plays cindi lauper instead of the audio for a Duke/unc game. we were  with a group of 25 Duke fans, asked kindly for the audio, and the bartender rudely declined. Then spoke to management, who also declined.

Will not return for sports
author: Dan S.

description: Uhhh... First of all there are 4 people drinking at the bar. They have a server, but not table service? If the bar was a bit busier that's understandable-ish. But whatever that's a minor annoyance... I get to the bar to order my food and ask the bartender the simplest of questions. What is the sauce on your sliders? He literally looked at me and said I don't know, the menu says there's sauce? This is your job, not mine dude. I then wait almost 30 minutes for food, which is good, but also cold.. That's super exciting! Maybe they should hire some people that actually give a flying fadoodle about their job. I may come back to play games, but I'm definitely not impressed by any means.
author: kaylee G.

description: Bartenders who are attentive and give a sh*t?  In SF?  Who would have thought?!  Fun place especially if you want to get your shuffleboard on.  Lots of beers on tap.
author: Kyle K.

description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place. Wish there was a spot as cool as this in LA. Went one Sunday after a football game and had the place to ourselves. TV's everywhere, games, and lots of beer choices!
author: Mars T.

description:
So I looked at the door for the Golden Gate Tap Room, and i'll admit, I was nervous.  it looks like a hole in the wall bar, with no lights. But when you walk in, you immediately walk up stairs, to a game room heaven. A slight sliver of San Francisco, carved out for folks who like ski ball, pool, and delicious beers.  

Don't let the minimalist façade fool you...this place is a legit place, clean, well run, and a lot of fun. 

Their beer selection was good, not great, thus 4 stars instead of 5, but I will return.
author: Gardner H.

description:
I reserved space for a 40 person group here on a Monday night and luckily had a very different experience than most other reviewers.  I went in a bit worried because the woman I had been emailing with was very slow to respond and was pretty unclear about everything, but when I got there and met with the bar manager (Craig?) I was very happily surprised by the service.  

They'd reserved two big spaces for us along with a pool table that you can rent for $5/hour.  I thought I'd also reserved a shuffleboard table, but that seems to have fallen through the cracks in my emails with Vanessa.  When I told the manager that I'd have liked one, he made it happen and we happily played pool and shuffleboard all night while watching Monday Night Football on a big projector screen.  

I had also been confused about the food situation (get your menus online, ggtr!) and thought the restaurant the floor above served food in the tap room.  They don't, but the manager made it happen for us when he really didn't need to.  They also thought ahead and had wristbands available for the group to make it very easy to order at the bar.  He went way above and beyond in making sure my group had a great time and I'm really appreciative of it.   

Food, beer and bartenders were all great.  Loved having all the games, there was really something for everyone and the management really really impressed me.  Definitely recommend it for anyone, but particularly for groups.
author: Alison H.

description: Although this is more bar than restarant, the food is outstanding.  The menu is mostly apps, but everything is good.  Try the beef rib tacos.
author: Rod I.

description: Just left here after having a game in San Fran... MY NEW SPORTS BAR in San Fran now!! Plenty of fun & drinks are cheap...
author: Roy G.

description:
i was visiting SF for the weekend and was looking for a Michigan State bar to watch the game at. according to sfbayspartans.org, this was supposed to be an MSU bar, but it wasn't!

apparently the upstairs crowd was "surveyed" to see which game they wanted to watch: 2 top 10 teams or a blowout game. they decided on the blowout game and forgot to "survey" the 2-3 tables of people watching the MSU and Oregon game.

while this doesnt warrant a bad review, the service we received was very slow. we also ordered a couple long islands which tasted like over sized lemon drops because it was all lemon juice. we asked our server and she claimed it was a "California thing", but i was unable to find anything online about this. 

the icing on the cake was our server mumbled something about wanting to go home, but we were her last table. upon hearing that, i ordered our table to close our tab so we could all leave.
author: Bryan N.

description: lots of different kinds of beer and lots of pool tables. nuff said.
author: Fatima Zahra E.

description: Slowest service every...do Not come here on a Friday or Saturday, unless you want to wait 30-45min for one drink.  The bartender will ignore you.
author: Ryan K.

description: I'm a sucker for places with skeeball and shuffle boarding. And if you're indecisive like me about what to drink, just spin the big ol' wheel on the wall. It's also a great place to catch the games since there are many TVs all around. Drinks are decently priced. Did I mention they have Mortal Kombat and that Duck Dynasty shooting game?
author: Kelly C.

description: I love this place! Always have a great time coming here with friends. I learned how to play shuffle board here. The games are fun, nachos are yummy, and there's always plenty of beers to choose from. Bar tenders are friendly too. Sometimes this place gets packed though and you have to wait around for games.
author: Stephany S.

description: I first came here for my friend's birthday a couple weeks ago and I was impressed with how cool of a spot this is. Definitely the place you want to be for any game.. Great TV's, beer, pool tables, etc... and it is nice, clean, and spacious. The real reason I am writing this review is that I have been back multiple times, and each time, more and more impressed with the service. Golden Gate Tap Room did a seriously good job on hiring recently... Polite, funny, timely, just all around great service every time I have been in. Ask for Daniel! One of the best in the industry. Thanks guys I'll be back.
author: Rob L.

description: Though it was almost empty when we were here (granted, it was early afternoon), it looks like a lot of fun to hang out here, a gigantic space by SF standards. Impressive beer selection. Great bartender. Deep fried pickles: five slivers per serving, smallish portion but tasty enough. The slight dirty mop smell was a bit of a turnoff.
author: Maximillian M.

description: The service was poor due to being understaffed. Our order was incomplete and it took more than 30 minutes to get a beer after arriving. Our server also took our food away without asking before we were done, and gave a number of excuses/apologies for poor service. We hope this wasn't typical.
author: James N.

description: Very nice friendly people lots of fun plenty of TVs pool tables games it's a place for adults to have fun
author: Nicey S.

description: Great spot to grab some drinks and watch some games. They have a lot of great beers on tap and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They even put one of the huge tvs to the Gator/Bulldog game so my wife and I could enjoy the Gators destroy them :) we didn't eat here, so can't say anything about the food. But would definitely go back for beer and games.
author: Danny F.

description: Watched the Giants Game last night with a friend and really liked this venue.  Lots of TVs and several different beers on tap as well as cocktails to choose from.  Recommend getting there early before a big game to find a seat otherwise it is standing room only.  Service was good and friendly despite all the customers and chaos.  Definitely returning!
author: Carmelita B.

description: The beer selection here is amazing. the service side leaves a bit to be desired.
author: Joe A.

description: Awesome for watching baseball (and probably football). Nachos with Yelp check-in are good too!
author: Sofia M.

description: Few arcade games, 2 pool tables and shuffleboard. They're all about $1 a game and beer prices are your average $6-$8. They have a lot of TVs and the atmosphere is pretty chill.
author: Claire P.

description: Taproom is one of the FEW true sports bars in San Francisco. Maybe I'm ill informed, but Jillian's pool hall and tap room are the only 2 SF sports venues. Taproom was packed for the Niners' playoff game, the beer was abundant and served quickly, and the food was solid bar fare. Unfortunately, they massively overcharged me. We had a few parties at our table and the waitress apparently was unable to keep them straight. My bill ended up including 2 pitchers I didn't order and 2 food items I didn't order. They also forgot the wings I ordered. Overall, I started happy, but will now be reluctant to return.
author: Justin P.

description: Environment is great but damm the bartenders look piss! Lol we went there yesterday and we had a bartender with dreadlocks n color hair she was always in a bad mood when she served us if you don't like your job lady don't work in customer service other then that are servers were greaT! Great food! Other then the bartender being rude everything was good
author: Kellz A.

description: What a fun place. Went with several friends last week. Appetizers excellent. Huge array of drinks. I'm a cider fan and there were 3 on tap and 3 available by the bottle! The top floor has shuffle board and air hockey as well as tables for eating AND an area with couches for a more private setting. I was super impressed with this bar. Will be coming here again!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Was here tonight watching Game 6 of the NBA finals and of course rooting for the Warriors, which won tonight btw!!! WhooOoo!!! Go Warriors!! =)) Because this game was going to determine whether there would be a game 7 or not, it was crazy packed in here! Luckily my friend's boyfriend was able to get a table on the 3rd floor. I was here for the last game as well on a Sunday and it was pretty busy that night too. So not only is this place huge but there are alot of screens here, which made it a perfect hangout spot to watch the game. The servers/bartenders here are pretty awesome and nice too. I was really hungry and wanted to order some food but our server said that the kitchen was really backed up and that they wouldn't be able to take any more orders for another 20 minutes. I was ok with that because it was totally understandable and Im just glad that she told me that instead of just taking my order and me wondering where the heck my food is. Loll anyways the crowd was great and very lively. While waiting to order for food, we just got pitchers of beers and drinks first and watched the game. After we were finally able to order food, the food actually came out fairly quickly! I got the buffalo boneless chicken wings and the garlic fries. The fries were really good and the chicken was also but it was a little too spicy for me. Anyways when the Warriors won the game, everyone in the bar was celebrating and cheering! It was so awesome!!! This is definitly a fun and chill place to watch a game with good food, drinks, and great company! =)
author: Mary C.

description: Always a fun place to hang-out after work.  Good selection of Beer and appetizers are affordable.  TV's all through out.  A great place to watch sports
author: Christian L.

description: Love this spot. Adult Disneyland. 50 beers on tap 50 in bottle. Affordable great bar food and excellent location. Can't beat the prices anywhere downtown
author: Amy C.

description:
We were just looking for a cool place to have a drink and we found it!  The ambiance is really cool, they have arcade games, pool and skee ball (love me some skee ball), but the games are kinda pricey.  

It took FOREVER to get a drink!  The bartenders were clearly drunk, flirting with some girls at the bar and ignoring the other customers.  I think it was about 10pm, and we were hungry, so we tried to order some food off their menu (including the check-in on Yelp for free nachos, which proved useless), only to be told that they had stopped serving food already.  The first two beers we chose from the large menu posted on the wall behind the bar were unavailable- they were out of one and don't carry the other anymore.  The personality of the bartender that finally got around to helping me, left something to be desired.  I don't expect warm & fuzzy, but you tend to want a pleasant bartender who is happy to help you and doesn't act as though you're a nuisance because you're not one of those flirty co-eds at the other end of the bar.  

The "wheel of beer" is a nice touch...it was fun to spin, though they spin it for you rather than you getting to spin it.  I think that was our favorite part of the whole experience.  I might give this place another try, but the bartenders really need to step up their game and not be so discriminatory.  They clearly have tunnel vision for the customers they prefer to serve, and that is no way to run a business. It would also be nice if they served food until closing.  People like to eat when they drink!
author: Jess M.

description: I'm really bummed I have to give this place a 3 star. To be fair, they opened recently and are probably just understaffed for big games. We got a table but had to order from the bar and they forgot our order after we already waited 30 minutes to order. I love the massive screens for big play off game, but service killed the experience. I couldn't even close out my tab to pay in the end. I really wanted to like this place, and maybe a few months down the road they will hear the feedback and make some operational changes.
author: Jen S.

description: Cool place that just opened (hasn't even had it's official grand opening yet). It has TONS of potential. Great location on the 2nd (or maybe 3rd) floor on the corner of Powell and Sutter. Cool interior and lots of space (would be great for groups). Skee Ball. Shuffleboard. Pool. Like a big, new Buckshot. Beers seemed pretty pricey ($7 for a Hoegaarden) considering the food seemed pretty cheap. 2 stars because it felt like they were nickel-and-diming us, charging for Shuffleboard ($3 /hour, held my buddy's ID and didn't tell us until after we returned the shuffleboard gear that there was a fee for playing). Lame. Hopefully they get the kinks worked out because I can see this place being popular. Saying "actually, you were over an hour, so that will be $3.26," doesn't win you many fans. It does have LOTS of TVs, so that is a plus.
author: Patrick L.

description: Gets way too crowded for big games, but overall a huge venue with good beer.  Can't for for Football season!
author: Jay H.

description: Great Bar.. Only down side is they need more seating for the 49er games. Lots of IPA's on tap.
author: randy t.

description: This place is a lot of fun. Something different for Union Square. There are many beer options which is cool and skiball (that is always a good time). The food is typical bar food. But all the videogames and drinking options is what will make me keep coming back for more!
author: Kaylie P.

description: Well this is a random place I never knew about.  Went here to watch the Utes beat the Bruins with some friends from Utah (also the lonngg Giants game that went into the 18th inning). TVs everywhere, foosball, pool, shuffle board.   It was really hot in there but I'm hoping that's because it was our little heat wave. Waitress was nice and efficient even though she had been there allll day.  Great selection of beer and the NY sliders are delicious.
author: H R.

description: Brittany is a great server. Tons of activities and snacks and beer. I mean, what else do you need in life??
author: Marshall J.

description: Only reason Im giving this place a lower rating is they have so many private events it is almost impossible to head to happy hour here without calling ahead. But its still a great place for a bunch of people with good beer on tap, happy hour prices, tons of tvs to watch sports games and tons of other games too.
author: Kristan B.

description: What a hidden little gem of a sports bar this is!  Located off of union square, go upstairs is this brand new sports bar, equipped with lots of TVs, big and small, darts, and games!  They also have pool tables, but we didn't play.  Just stopped by for a drink.  Their bar was a bit slow tho..
author: Stephanie C.

description: I LOVE games.  I love bars. So when you put those two together, it is the perfect marriage of things I love and this place doesn't disappoint.  From the drink wheel you spin for a drink "surprise" to the plethora of games such as PacMan, ShuffleBoard, SkeeBall, Pool, etc this place has something for everyone.
author: Vanessa L.

description: We still love that place and we still go there, we consider ourselves regulars... Last time we went was the very same day I placed that review... Oh n best cocktails are done by Andrea (i think that was his name) :D
author: Mariam H.

description:
Solid sports bar with lots of fun arcade games and affordable beer ($6) with good selection. Came here on a Saturday night around 10:30 and there was plenty of room to sit. Was great for a griup or friends or a company happy hour to drink a but and play games

Wish it was open past 12 (there were pretty aggressive lights turned on telling you to finish up around 11:30).
author: Ojus P.

description: Great selection, great bartenders, great service! What can I say? 5 stars! (Yelp says this review is shorter then most. Yelp, I would read more reviews IF they were shorter. How's that for a review?)
author: Bibi B.

description: It is a cool spot nestled in Union Square that not many people or tourists know about.  Service is not the best but it is a bar.  They have a wide variety of bottled beers and I requested the purple haze ($6).  I came when it was happy hour and the place was pretty packed but as soon as it was not happy hour people started clearing out.  A pitcher of Blue Moon beer during HH was $15 versus when it was not HH, that same pitcher was $21.  The Blue Moon beer was extremely flat as well.  I would come back here but only for happy hour which is 3PM-6PM M-F excluding holidays and long weekends.
author: Christopher C.

description: This place is allll-right. I don't see the big hype with it. Yes, it has games and is huge, but it's kinda grimey/old and the staff is pretty useless. We tried to play shuffleboard for days and the staff kept saying it was reserved yet there was no one there, so we left. Also, the food does not look appetizing. Step it up, GG Tap Room. Let's get some renovations going.
author: Priya G.

description:
Wow, sometimes its scary when you read reviews on a place and when you go it is word for word accurate.

This place is such an enigma. They have a huge beer selection, tons of tvs and tables and seating areas. And thats where the positives quickly end. 

Service is just as bad as the food. Of the 60 or so beers on the big board, 1/3 are likely not available. Not to mention the beers on the big board don't match the beers in the menu. Go figure.

I would only go back to this place if I had to watch 'the game' and I had already eaten, drank, etc etc.
author: Brent A.

description:
I thought that the service issue was a temporary working-out-the-kinks thing. Turns out, the service is bad because the servers (or at least bartenders) are bad. I stood at the bar, trying to get anyone's attention for several minutes. One bartender (I was told her name was Brandy), looked me straight in the eye, then went on doing whatever she was doing and ignored me completely. "Okay, so maybe she doesn't serve customers," I thought. It didn't bother me until a girl came up to the bar, stood right next to me, and was greeted and served by the bartender. Again, Brandy looked right at me, turned away, and went to go do something else. That was that. My girlfriend and I left to go to someplace less unfriendly.

I had high hopes for this place. It's a great location with a fun vibe, and I'm not quite ready to give up on it completely, but something really needs to be done about the bartenders' attitudes.
author: Kristopher A.

description: Never eat in an empty restaurant! Breakfast is not their thing. I just had an omelet. The hash browns were horrible and how can you get a ham and cheese omelet wrong? They did.
author: David C.

description: Of all the years I've lived in SF, I have never noticed this bar. I would seriously walk past it and not know. The opening is a bit small so it's hard to notice, but the stairs lead upstairs to a fairly large bar! I was surprised I haven't been here before! There's arcade games, large tvs to watch the game (Which we saw IGGY make his 2nd buzzer beater of the season :D!) Didn't get a chance to order anything since we didn't stay too long after meeting up my friends, BUT there's free nachos if you check-in on Yelp here! :P
author: Amanda C.

description: I just used Golden Gate Tap Room to host a 50+ person event and they were absolutely great!  We had a nice, separated space with a pool table (and massive tv screen) right in the middle of the bar and a highly attentive waitress who came to take drink orders.  Setting up the reservation in advance (for drink tickets, food, and pool/shuffleboard reservations) was simple and we were able to buy tokens the night of for everyone to play games.  This is a GREAT place to host an event - I highly recommend it, especially if you're looking for a place that offers more to do than just drink alcohol (though their alcohol selection is pretty fantastic as well).
author: Jessie C.

description: Went there with a group of friends to watch the worls series and we had to purchase tickets in advance to get into the place period as long lines were outside and the large bars could not accomodate everyone. I really like it though TV screens everywhere no matter where you sat you could see the game. Some screens were very large others smaller but it totally worked. Also great drink menu with a ton of beers on tap and a decent wine selection, drinks - the service was slow but perhaps they did not staff enough for a busy night like this. The food was ok - typical bar food, quesedillas, mini sliders, nachos etc. but who comes here for the food anyways...  We'll be back!
author: Beth P.

description: The food and bar were great and the atmosphere was awesome. However the service was terrible, we saw our server twice in 4 hours as she was too busy flirting with other guests and acting drunk to care. If you get the "server" Mitchella don't expect to get served or even see her.
author: Anne W.

description: We went in to grab a beer and some Nachos. Asked a server where to get a menu and she directed me to get one from an empty table. Beer selection is good, food is terrible. Nachos were cold and looked like they were made at a high school football game with the terrible cheese in a bag.
author: Shane D.

description: This place is a rare find in SF; where you can actually enjoy a beer and good snacks and not break the bank. No hyperbole needed here, which seems to be used for many places in SF.
author: Beth G.

description: There is so much potential with this place. Location, space, tons of tv's, the bar games like pool and shuffleboard, free popcorn, and enormous beer selection. But the service is abysmal, the popcorn is seemingly always stale, the prices are Union Square driven, and the food just sucks. And my verizon mifi doesn't work here so I can't even work. Get your ish together owners.
author: Anthony T.

description: I've been here a couple of times to catch some East Coast games. Service can definitely be slow, but they are quite friendly and helpful. I'm surprised at the low score, but then again I have yet to try the food. Maybe I'll stick to the alcohol. Drink selection is quite extensive.
author: Christina N.

description: Waitress was top notch, but don't sit in the back near the windows, next to the water cooler and pinball. Literally feels like sitting on an iceberg, even with a jacket on and the heat being turned up upon request. Perfect spot to watch sports though, as the tv is right next to your table, hence why I decided to tough it out the whole night. Jameson also helps. GGTR carries just about every sport too, which is great, but they leave the same game on every channel. We asked them to change to the Nets game (Brooklyn represent), but every other TV/screen had the same CIT tournament game on (for the casual fan, this is not even the NIT of second tier college basketball tournament games). Seems like a waste of the space they have. Could totally dominate the area and show every available sporting event on its own tv. Also didn't like that a child was allowed inside, continuing my dislike of this trend since my NYC days.
author: Dan M.

description: This place is so fun! Great beers on tap, solid bar food (both are fine deals compared to other SF establishments), and the games are awesome. I went with about 10 people and there was always something available for everyone to play, from shuffleboard to skeeball to buck hunter to pacman and more. I'll be back.
author: Ben R.

description: Nice place near Union Square. Great music not too loud so a nice place if you want to kick back and not have to shout to talk.  TV screens all around to watch the games. Happy hour starts at 3 which is nice.  Good beer selection and full bar. Bartenders were very personable and creative. Andre did a great job creating a dill pickle martini that my wife was interested in trying. She loved it. Would come back again.
author: KaRex R.

description: Pretty busy sports bar when there are some game on track. Lots of stuff to do, just the wait for beverages is way to long for making this my regular place (I was there on a Saturday later afternoon). Food quality was fine.
author: C S.

description: Quite possibly the best set up for a sports bar in San Francisco... But it's poorly managed. There is NEVER enough staff to cover the crowd on a Sunday for football. We always wait way too long for service. Just a few more servers and this place will be set. We can only hope that management reads this and hires a few more employees.
author: Ryan A.

description: Las Vegas locals... We love a great bar. We tried at least 20 bars in San Francisco (no judgment please :-) and had grumpy, rude bartenders in each one except here. They were awesome! Fun, helpful, made it a great experience!
author: Mindy N.

description: Food totally sucks, but this is a great Sports Bar to watch Niners games at near Union Square. The place is huge and they have a lot of great beers on tap. Real cool atmosphere. Just order a couple of pitchers and eventually you will not care about the quality of the food. They also have a popcorn machine in the back with free popcorn, that is cool.
author: Kamil K.

description:
Very spacious with a nice amount of screens. Pool, shuffleboard and skeeball a plus.

Cocktail waitresses are horrible. Sat with my girlfriend for 20 min at our high top table on a very slow Sunday before realizing no one was going to help us.  I went to the bar and asked if I should just order from them and he said a cocktail waitress would be by any minute. Waited 5 more minutes while watching the waitresses help the table next to us and a few others while constantly walking past us, even making eye contact then looking away. I ended up just ordering everything from the bar and walking across the huge room back and forth myself.  I've been in the industry for 17 years and over tip like crazy.. Their loss.  What's worse is everytime I went to the bar I'd see the cocktail waitresses leaned back texting or whatever on their phones and playing around while there were multiple tables on the floor unattended and looking lost. This has happened on more than one occasion. I'm not sure how they decide who to help and who to not help but the service is pretty horrible/non-existent. Maybe they just don't like money. Could be sooo much better with a better staff.  Seems very poorly managed. Bartenders have been decent though.

Food is nothing special. Regular sports bar food. Don't eat the tacos. Very bland and unappealing. Spicy ribs are ok though. Everything else is average.

You guys are new and have potential to be very awesome. Please get rid of the lazy cocktail waitresses and get some new blood in that shows great hospitality and acts like they give a crap about their job. Otherwise you may be doomed. Good luck!
author: Montana R.

description: Huge beer selection. I was there for game seven of the world series, so it was jam packed. I did not eat there, but seems like an excellent place for drinks. You will never run out of beers to try and it seemed very spacious if not for the huge crowd for the game.
author: Yoshito K.

description:
After holding all of our football game watches at GGTap last year, I was excited to request reservations for this coming season. To my disappointment, management has turned over. Rather than confirming my reservations, the new manager responded that they are working on securing game watches other than Miami at GGTap. I found this ungracious and rude, especially considering last season in which we brought 30-75 people during non-peak times. Trying to salvage the partnership, I thanked the manager for the heads up. She then responded she will not guarantee sound and that our first game coincides with a Big Ten game which she found bigger and more important (even though our game is on ABC). There was no reservation attempt for this game, the manager simply felt it was more important. I called Tap hoping to understand why we are getting so much push back for trying to renew GGTap as a Hurricane bar which we had been advertising up to this point. Rather than trying to apologize for a misinterpreted email, which I expected, the manager was defensive and arrogant. She repeatedly told me she used to work at another Sports Bar and knows which games are more important. 

Apart from being quite insulting to the University of Miami athletic program (which boasts 5 national championships), I am completely shocked at the response I received from GGTap. We had such a positive experience last year, coming every weekend for an entire season, and getting to know the previous managers and servers. New management seems to forget the service in a service industry. Regardless of this manager's personal opinion on which athletic programs are "important," as I patron and a person I expected a little more respect.
author: Samantha K.

description: Fun place to come and play some arcade games, have a drink and just hang out with friends. Love the big screen TVs and pool tables.
author: Narina A.

description: Came here around 1:00pm on a Friday. Not crowded but still a lot of fun.  Definitley recommend for a good day bar. Skeeball, Foosball, golden tee, pinball,  and pool.  Great selection of beer as well.
author: Justine M.

description: Great place to hang out with friends and play some shuffle board, pool or even skee ball.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place. I live in Los Altos but work in the city so it's rare that I get to go out like I did in my pre-kid days. After reading a review on SF Eater about their soft launch some co-workers and I decided to head over for happy hour before it gets too touristy.

The concept was great! Shuffleboard, skiball, pool tables. What's there to not like? Well they clearly weren't ready for even a soft opening. The food and food service was particularly bad. I ordered 2 orders of tacos and 1 order of potstickers at the bar and paid cash. When the food arrived there were 2 orders of pot stickers and no tacos. The waiter informed me they were out of tacos but since I had paid cash I'd have to go talk to the bartender. He was nice enough and told me to just order 2 other items. I went with short ribs and a smoked salmon plate. The salmon arrived with no bread or crackers or anything, just a pile of salmon and a dollop of mayo (no silverware or napkins in sight either). When I asked how it was supposed eat it the waiter looked confused and said "I guess I could bring you some bread." He delivered 3 paper thin pieces of bread that wasn't even enough for a 1/4 of the salmon. 

I guess with their food you get what you pay for. It seemed oddly cheap compared to the $6-7 beers.

The system for checking out shuffleboard pucks was really unorganized too. One of the two tables went unused for over 30 minutes and when we inquired at the bar as to it's availability we were met with blank stares and told they didn't know who had the set for that table. 

We left having played a single game of skiball and longing for a decent bite to eat.
author: Elena M.

description:
Seems to be a theme here that I agree with...GG Tap Room does not know how to handle large events! Stay away if you do not want a headache and to wait an eternity to get a drink or food!

Came here twice for World Series games and each time the service was laughable. Totally understand things would be slower but we waited one hour and 15 minutes for our waitress, when I finally asked when we can expect help I was told there were not enough servers and I should just go order at the bar myself (which took another 20 minutes to get to the front of the bar) and another 45 minutes for 3 appetizers. 

Other negative is the line!! They decided to capitalize on these large sporting events and now charge $10 to get in, in return you can use this $10 on your first drink. This process REALLLLLLY slows the line down! Seems alil silly to charge at a sports bar especially when the service is so crappy! 

Not sure if it is a capacity thing but there is SOOOOOOO much wasted space in this place, there are entire room with massive big screen TVs and no chairs, I find it hard to believe that their capacity is so low for such a large space - who knows. If possible more chairs would make it more comfortable. 

Positive - so many TV screens it would be impossible to count!
author: Nicki B.

description: Big screens for sports, which is good but .... Limited meny even for a sports and the service was incredibly slow and bad. Not recommended for eating.
author: Ulf N.

description: A great place to hang out and have a fun time. A couple of pool tables, skeeball, foosball, and old pac-man machine and beer. What more could you ask for? It's on the second floor and is much bigger than it seems from the outside. It's perfectly located and a perfect place to bring a group of friends.
author: Jessica M.

description: This place is absolutely awesome. A great date place. They have bars, food, pool, shuffleboard, arcade games, huge tv's, etc., etc. Awesome Union Square location (walking distance to my house, so even better). I'm very glad I discovered this place (on my own) and will be a frequent patron there and won't hesitate to tell everyone I know to go there!
author: Rick M.

description: Great place to come alone or with friends. Like sports? Come here for the game, you can even reserve a VIP section for your party if you like. 50 taps for you beer drinkers plus more in bottles. Cocktails? No problem, the staff is always nice and can make a great drink. I frequent here on Thursdays! (& other days)... Games galore - pool, shuffle board, skeeball, arcade machines, you name it. If you aren't having a good time here, check your attitude and change it!
author: Jason C.

description: This is a great place to hangout with friends and watch the games. I'm not a sport addicted, but liked your layout and atmosphere. Definetly, I'd recommend this pub to my brazilian friends.
author: Juliana P.

description: Stopped it to have a few mid-day drink and play some pool. It a really cool hang out spot. Much like a sports bar but the do have quite a lot of beers on tap. I was expecting them to have a lot more craft beer (both on draft and in bottles). This was the largest downside. For calling themselves a Tap Room, they should definitely have more craft beer. The food is a little over priced, but what can you expect from a place located right in union square. Overall rest place and I would return if I needed mid-day break from all the shopping.
author: Garrett Kaeo W.

description: Don't get the free nachos. They are completely disgusting: chips with cheese whizz and cold bacon.
author: Len S.

description: I came here with my boyfriend on his birthday and we got a nice seat at the bar and our bartender was nice enough to offer him a birthday shot. There was this deal, if we checked-in we got free nachos. Nachos were delicious btw.
author: Devin ..

description: Definitely my kind of place.  Enjoyed the two level experience.  A ton of beers to choose from; tap or bottle.  Food was good but too pricey for the quantity.
author: Sonny P.

description: Definitely a fan of this place. Hard to find such a big sports bar in the area with a full bar and vast selection of drinks. Love the different games too. My rating would move up to 5 stars primarily if they manage to improve the speed of their service. I think a lot of other reviewers mentioned the same thing, and I just really don't understand why the place doesn't hire more people or figure out a better method of managing the crowds. Takes a while to get a drink, but nonetheless, there is plenty of entertainment to keep you busy while you are waiting!
author: Brian S.

description: We went in on Sunday for football. I asked the waitress if she could put my team on and she said "No, we have a lot of requests," but there were plenty of tv's to support every game! This was after she forgot our beers for a good 15 minutes until we re-asked. It wasn't busy. She just forgot. We had the boneless buffalo wings, which were ok (except that we kept losing them in the ranch since there were no servers around to give us silverware), but the nachos were worse quality than the $1 nachos from the Taco Bell dollar menu. DO NOT GIVE YOUR BUSINESS!
author: Chris B.

description: Had an awesome cocktail waitress. Stephanie I think it was. She had an amazing and inviting disposition despite how busy it seamed to be down stairs. The best!!
author: Derek H.

description: We enjoyed this bar during a visit to San Francisco.  It is a casual space with a lot of beer options.  It was nice just hanging out and drinking a few beers with plenty of space for the patrons.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because of the service.  Our waitress was very nice but seemed to be the only one working the floor.  Service as slow and even though we planned on ordering more food and drinks, we decided to try somewhere else.
author: K N J.

description: Great beer selection. The Philosopher is probably my favorite. Beers are pricey, but it's worth it. They have a happy hour and you get $2 off your beer. All the games are fun, but sometimes the machines just eat your money up. There have been times when I put money in and the game wouldn't even work; just a waste of my quarters. They also have shuffle board which is one of my favorites. This place is definitely a place you would want to check out if you're in the downtown area.
author: Laurel C.

description:
I came here with a group and arrived around 3pm for Game 4 of the World Series which started at 5. We had roughly a dozen in our group, and scored a seat in front of the largest of the TV's. We thought we had it made, but I could not be more mistaken.

As other reviewers have noted, the service here is terrible if existent at all. There's only one tiny bar on each floor which attempts to serve probably 300-400 people a piece. Some bartenders try to stay upbeat, but half of them are crumbling under the pressure and cramped space. One bartender on the third floor was even vengeful, and actually skipped the people who had been waiting the longest multiple times, presumably for trying to get his attention (heaven forbid). Getting a beer took over 20 mins each time because we were forced to use the bar. We never saw a server once.

Also, they had the foresight to schedule a reservation at 8pm using the seats we were sitting in. We were kicked out of our seats in the seventh inning of a World Series game!!! I couldn't believe it.

The cramped spaces, tiny bars, lack of servers, and mismanagement all leads to one conclusion: Golden Gate Tap Room is not prepared for a busy night. Do not come here for larger events!
author: B K.

description: Hidden GEM! Really chill atmosphere, awesome beer selection, great people.
author: Truong N.

description:
The two stars are for the awesome shuffleboards and the plentiful sports tvs.  If you want to actually eat or drink, I would not recommend coming here.  

The service was horrible, 
1) They advertise 100 beers on tap, but the first 4 different beers we tried to order, they were out of, including the basic guiness (well they weren't really out, they just hadn't tapped the keg yet and weren't willing to do it even though it was 6:30pm on a Wed and not really that busy)
2) The bartenders lost 2 different credit cards that had tabs open on them while we were there, and yelled at US that we didn't have a tab open... hmm... well, I gave you my card... 
3) Although prices for food were cheap, you get what you pay for.  I'd recommend eating elsewhere or ordering 3-4 dishes per person if you want to actually eat dinner.
4) They lost our food order, then finally a half hour later, brought us someone else's order (sorry poor people who were staring at us knowing that was their food).  We told them, and they let it sit there for 10 mins, then came around and took it to the other table.  I think those people were too hungry to send it back after it had been sitting on our table for 10 mins.
5) After getting the wrong food, it took them another 45 minutes to get us our order, and they once again brought the wrong thing.  If we hadn't already paid for it since the first bartenders made us close out our tab when they switched shifts, we would have left.

Moral of the story is, don't eat or drink there, but the games are cool.
author: Amy W.

description: Games and atmosphere are fun, but waited a half an hour for a drink when the CO2 machine went down and the waitress disappeared.
author: Chris K.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood.  Excellent for sports watching - the place is large and spacious with games for those not interested in sport, pool, shuffleboard and skeeball.  Always had great service, particularly with Tim, charming and efficient!   Over 100 beers on offer, as well as mixed drinks.  The bloody mary was spot-on.  Yes, I'll be back!
author: Alison M.

description: If you are in San Francisco and in union square. You have to come check out this great hidden gem! It may not look the part outside, but inside this sports bar and game lounge is the best for game days. They have over 40 TVs and couple huge jumbo screens. They have great tap selections and great food. I highly recommend this place on any game days if you're not going to the games.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Horribly poor service. They take your credit card and disappear, occasionally check on you but fail to keep the drinks fresh. I'm still waiting for my check and credit card back.....food was good, but server will not get max tip
author: Jeff J.

description: Annoyed .... Who are these people? ... Reminds of a roudy airport bar.  I must be the only local here.  My nachos suck.
author: Yacate C.

description: This place is pretty cool! I went on a Saturday during the day and they were playing every college football game and even games no one really cared about. I also love anywhere that has skeeball and a jukebox, which they do. The bartender, Tim, was very busy but was so funny and professional at the same time. Really made my friends and I feel comfortable there. The food is basic fried food, but the beer selection is out if this world! Great place to go in Union Square.
author: Lyndsay P.

description: My husband and I stumbled upon this place while vacationing in San Francisco last week, and if you want to have a few good beers, then this is the place to be! We both love a variety of beers (especially my husband, he's all about the hops!) and GGTR definitely delivered in the beer world. But unfortunately, the service and the food left us utterly shocked. How can you have a place this nice, with an incredible beer menu, and hire rude bartenders and serve food that I could find at the grocery store's freezer section. As long as you don't eat here and don't plan to have a lot of interaction with the bartenders, it's not a bad place.
author: Krystyna C.

description: I went here with my friend on 7-22-14 7pm'sh.  It was an event that includes open bar drinks and food.  I ordered the whiskey sour, midori sour, kamikaze, and long island---the drinks were better than expected.  Also had the chicken wings, fries, veggie potstickers,etc, again is better than expected.  Noticed there are video games.
author: Jer W.

description: Great beer selection & plenty of TV's to watch the games. What more could you want.... free popcorn, they got that too
author: Eric L.

description: Decent selection, $6 for most beers, but no prices posted. Cool young atmosphere. Would go again but not the greatest service.
author: Chris H.

description: I gave it a 2 because it was pretty sub par. Bartender was unfriendly and the environment was decent at best.
author: Cortland A.

description: Great sports bar. Lots of TV's and bar games. Good bar and menu is decent. If they get slammed unexpectedly.... prepare to wait at the bar.
author: C W.

description: Came here to watch 49ers vs Sea Hawks playoff game. Place is huge with tons of TV's. Like it.
author: Vikash G.

description: Awesome sports bar, great vibe and decor. Drinks are decently priced and a good alcohol to mixer ratio. LOTS of TVs with sports everywhere! Plenty of games and things to entertain, good for groups.
author: Michele D.

description: I liked the venue. Plenty of TVs, games, and other diversions. My issue was with the bartender. Too busy putting on a show to provide good service. But hey--he threw the bottle in the air and caught it! Wilikers!
author: Corey R.

description: This place is really clean and has decent service. The burgers and fries were really good. My daughter got the fish and it was not good. It was stone cold in the middle and tasted wierd. So I would suggest steering clear of the fish and chips.  I also got the happy hour martini and it was good.
author: Michelle M.

description: Not a bad place but nothing special.  A lot of 21 year old Bros seem to like the place.  The bar tenders are nice and helpful.  The beer is basically the safeway beer isle on tap.
author: Paul M.

description: GGTR is right by my office, so I figured it would become part of the bar rotation...  but I'm just not feeling it.  It's too big (feels like Dave & Busters), the place is understaffed, the food didn't look great, and I wasn't a fan of the crowd.  They have shuffleboard tables, which is great, but the tables are almost too long.  There's just no intimacy.  I guess it's ok if you have a really big group, but there are so many better spots in the area.
author: Bud L.

description: Two bartenders don't seem too quick to tend to the customers, out of order tending, long wait to get a drink, more frustrating than enjoyable.
author: Devin T.

description: Rude staff. Closes early. Chaotic environment. Less games than you think.
author: Neil M.

description: Good bar food (free nachos thanks to yelp), good atmosphere, and a wide variety of beer.  I'll be back.
author: Seqan D.

description: This is a great place to hang out with lots of friends with an incredible atmosphere.
author: Michael G.

description: Cool place to play games and drink . However , just closed at 130am when the it says it closes at 2 . The bouncers wouldn't let us play one last game of pool
author: Jon H.

description:
Disclaimer:  nothing against the folks that work here.  In the three times I've been, they've been accommodating, and friendly.

Yesterday was likely the last time I'll be at GGTR, at least on Sundays.  What looks like a sports bar (tons of TVs), and feels like a sports bar (beer, wings, beer, beer), is in reality a sham.

THERE IS NO NFL SUNDAY TICKET. 

Rule #1 of any sports bar:  Have football.  

Forget the bells and whistles, just have football, and I will come.  Good wings are a bonus.  Without Sunday Ticket, neither me nor my friends will be back on Sundays because we can't watch our teams at GGTR.

On top of that, yesterday, there was a huge divisional game between the hometown 'Niners and the 'Hawks.  The place was rented out for a private party during game time.  Perhaps this is good for business in the short term, but IMO (and I am in no way, shape or form an expert, except when it comes to good customer experience) yesterday was a wasted opportunity to build a reputation with 'Niner hungry fans who wanted to check out the new place.

If the owner has any interest in generating a loyal and evangelizing customer base, he needs to execute better on Sundays.
author: Bobby N.

description: cider was $4 during happy hour and skee-ball never gets old.
author: Adam R.

description: The worst service ever. Food is good, if you get it. Even with all the mistakes, nobody had said sorry. Everyone blames someone else. The longer I'm here, the more stars they lose.
author: John C.

description: This place was terrible. We went there friday night for drinks and their late night snacks. The food was cold and we never recieved a beer we ordered. They also tried to tell us they were closed on the top floor when we ordered food 15 min prior and we hadnt even recieved our food yet. Their french fries tastes like they had been sitting under a heating lamp. When i go the city i expect great food and this was crap. I will be calling the restaurant tomorrow and letting them know how terrible their food and service was.
author: Elena L.

description: This place is great! I have been coming here for the last few weeks and it is amazing! Everyone here is incredibly helpful and friendly. I have been watching sharks game here and come at least once a week. I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good sorts bar.
author: Elliot S.

description: This would be a great place but the service is whack. The female bartender with the tattoos was so RUDE.  It was my cousin's birthday and we asked if she could spin the wheel. She spun it and walked away. She looked so uninterested in helping us.  I also ordered a pitcher of beer and she tried to give me 1 glass when there was 3 of us. I asked for 3 cups (is this unreasonable?!) and she questioned me about it! SO RUDE.
author: A L.

description: I've always visited GG Tap for the beer selection, the games, and the TVs. One thing I always tried to avoid, however, was the food that resembled what you'd find at a diner on the side of the highway. This didn't stop me from ordering some eats earlier this week in the interest of lining my stomach ahead of a lengthy happy hour. Little did I know that there's a new chef in town who understands what it means to serve food in San Francsico. His name is Larry and he's completely revamping the menu with dishes that are tasty and unique (see the picture below of his take on a BLT; it was awesome!). We tried 5 of his new dishes and everything was fantastic. Definitely try the new food items here when you visit! Ask for what Larry is recommending; he's going to do wonders for this place.
author: Paul J.

description: It's a testament to SF's bar scene that a place like this only gets a middling yelp score from most visitors. If GG Tap Room was in Sacramento, it would be the hottest thing going. It would also probably not be called "Golden Gate", but I digress. The special lady and I stumbled in here on a recent visit and were super excited about the find. Bricks, exposed wood and leather banquettes give the place an old-school, manly vibe. Skeeball and vintage arcade games give it a retro-nerd touch. A good selection of on-tap beers make it a worthwhile stop for hop-heads. Beer-and-a-shot specials give the douche-bags and alkies something to look forward to. A giant screen playing sports games make sure that sports fans have something to talk about instead of just standing around mouth-breathing. The pool table and shuffle-board round out the package. The line for beer was a little disorganized and they could have used another person on staff, but we still had a few beers and a snack from the small but rad food-menu in a reasonable amount of time. They also had a yelp check-in offer for potato chip nachos that was a very pleasant surprise. I'll definitely go back and recommend it to others.
author: Logan J.

description: Awesome place to get a few drinks. They're beer selections is great. If you're  going there to watch a game get there early
author: Pedro C.

description:
first time at the the gg tap room was last night, and right away i loved the place. ski ball, pool, games all over. it was huge! the place had a pretty cool feel, and i just wanted to love it.

unfortunately, it went downhill from there. we decided to order food (the popcorn shrimp, some fries, and naked wings.) which was all pretty great. no, REALLY good. it would have been better had the bartender not wanted to talk down to me while i was ordering food, but whatever. i blew it off trying to think about her day (i work in the same neighborhood in a similar environment.) and moved on. 

until i realized i had been there for an hour and a half and i hadn't seen a single employee bus anything. seriously, not a damn thing. oh, and i hope you dont rely on the redheaded waitress. she was less than willing to move from her spot next to the bar. you want something? nah, you can go up to her and she'll relay the order. i had actually never seen such a lazy staff. practically no effort towards anything.

at this point all i was there for was my food, which again- was the fucking bomb. seriously, so damn good. however, the busboy had a few other ideas in mind and when after i had been there for close to 2 and a half hours finally decides to bus the table of food i'm eating. uh, what? nevermind the fact that there were four other tables next to me, empty, and filled with dirty dishes and empty bottles. no, he decides he's going to take the plate that i had just picked food from maybe three seconds before? (there was a good amount of food on the plate still.) 

that was the last straw, and i actually left pretty pissed. i really, i mean REALLY wanted to love this place. i tried to push things back, justify things in my mind, but all in all it was pretty bad. i won't be back, and sadly don't see things taking off if the staff doesn't change.
author: Lex B.

description: Wow. Never have had such a disappointing experience as we had today. After the negative reviews saw the head bartender review and so we thought to give it a try. Bad idea. Food order of simple wings and sweet potato fries was messed up, had to order everything at the bar because the poor waitress was ALONE on an opening week NFL Sunday?!! She btw righted a food order she didn't place so kudos to her(Stephanie). We get it, you're busy. But you won't be much longer if you don't fix things soon!
author: Lucretia S.

description: I went a fourth time hoping to see even a little bit of improvement.   I sat down at a table, and waited...and waited...and waited.  20 minutes later a server walks by and looks at me, notices I don't have a drink in front of me...and walks on by.  When I ask to have my game on the nearest TV, since nobody else is looking at it, I'm told to move to another TV.
