The TV I get has cable or satellite connection problems and locks up, and I miss the entire 2nd quarter of my game.  Another person watching the game went up to the cashier station and asked for help.   No follow up.  I walk up to the cashier station and ask for help.  No follow up.  Server walks by and I wave her down.  She says she forgot and then walks away.  No follow up.  I go find two young looking dudes with ties on...they look like management or maybe ownership.  They finally help me out.  What the fuck is the matter with your servers?  Why aren't you hiring more and better staff?  Not returning....ever.
author: Kurt L.

description: We came in and we were not acknowledged by the server, after several minutes we seeked out help from the server and bus attendant. The eventual response and rudeness from the server completely turned us off  and we got up to leave but decided to go upstairs to the bar and Don (bartender) ended up turning our whole experience around.   He was extremely friendly and attentive, while being busy too. The manager, Josh, also stopped by the bar and made us feel welcome to San Francisco.  Those two turned around our entire experience and we left saying how glad we were that we stayed.
author: Jill N.

description: Service is usually pretty slow, but sitting at the bar with Andre servicing makes things much better. Super quick!
author: Matt R.

description: I don't like to give negative reviews. But, man - what a horrible place. Third time getting absolutely ignored here. 2nd level bartenders, shorter guy with glasses and brunette chick with tatts over looked one of us sitting at the actual bar, and another of us waiting in a static line for drinks. Got tired of it and wanted to leave. Took 20 minutes to close the bill just to leave after waiting. Tried the third floor due to being thirsty and hungry - the bartender was busting his ass even though the floor was half empty. However, after trying to get food for nearly 30 minutes from a server (Harland or Harlem was her name, something like that, told to us from the bartender after being told we have to order food from her and not him) we just had to leave. Went to a place down the street that was awesome. Check my other reviews to see where. I work in the industry and have a ton of patience and can totally feel for someone when they're in the weeds. These people, however are just slow, rude and are costing the company money from where I stand. Could've gotten a meal, drinks and return customers had everything gone well.
author: Dustin D.

description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yp2ZC7KD20U  Gulet kiralama
author: Murat S.

description: We have gone here the past few weekends to cheer on our Chiefs and it is our new favorite spot to go on Sundays:) It's a two story bar with the first floor having the most action but both floors have lots of tvs playing all the games and arcade games everywhere! They don't have a huge menu but the food is good and pretty cheap for being right in the city too. They have good service and a pretty good beer list. Great ambiance for a sports bar with lots to do. They also have a karaoke bar coming soon to the 4th floor so we may have to check that out when it opens;) Great spot!!
author: April C.

description: Pretty typical sports bar, a great place to watch a game. The crowd knows there baseball. Really good beer selection and pleasant staff
author: JJ G.

description:
Went here last night. Definitely left a bad taste and I'll probably never come back.

My friends get to the bar and it's a bit crowded, but not crazy busy to the point that we waited as long as we did. There were two bartenders. We're standing on left end of the bar, and had to wait till the bartender with the hat all the way on the other side acknowledged us and took are drinks order. I wondered why the bartender in the black shirt and mustache on our side couldn't help us since there was only 3 of us, but I dismissed it. It was a chunk of time to wait. No stars for that.

There was another point in the night where I noticed that there was a broken glass on the corner next to one of the games. Pretty dangerous I would say since huge chunks of glass were pointing straight up. I tried to get one of the waitress' attention, but she just whizzed right by me. I don't think it was that loud in there that she couldn't here me, but whatever. We went back to the bar to get more drinks and let the bartender know about the issue.

This time I was standing right smack in the middle of the bar, so he had to have seen me. Nope. NO acknowledgement what so ever from the same black shirt bartender even after he helped the guy right next to me who just sits down a little bit after I get there. There were several points during waiting people would walk about away, new people would show up and he would help them. Not even looking me. I was a bit distraught to say the least and asked my friend who is taller than me to switch places. Maybe he couldn't see my because I was short and in all black. I guess that wasn't the case because he still wouldn't help my friend either. Same thing: new people would come and he would help them instead. My friend said there was a point where he looked straight at the bartender in the face, and the guy goes on to help someone new at the bar. At this point, I've complete forgotten about the broken glass and just absolutely brimming.

Finally the other bartender with the hat helps us. He was so quick because we only wanted 3 beers, so I couldn't understand why the other bartender was ignoring us. We were waiting quite a long time that we began to people watch and notice that sort of thing, I'm embarrassed to say. Considering that was the second time of the night with the same bartender disregarded us in the same fashion, I can't think of anything else.

I actually think that the decor was really cool. I liked the paintings and the games were pretty fun. I think the issue is that where the shuffle board is located, you get this build up of people in a some what narrow space. However the rest of the are was roomy and comfortable. They have a various beer selection of craft beer on tap and bottle which was pretty good. So if you want a decent beer with BAD BAD service, come here.
author: Eve B.

description: Watched game four of the wold series here! We were a large group also celebrating my birthday. The place was really busy with all the Giants fans watching on tv screens EVERYWHERE! We had great service from Daniel, food was good and there is a great beer selection. This is the place to come to!
author: Anthony L.

description: Expensive, bad service.  They forgot to give back my ID, because you need it to RENT the shuffleboard pieces.  Bartender asked my name 6 times when I tried to get it back, didn't apologize.  Acted annoyed they forgot to give it back.
author: Erik K.

description: I came here during a World Cup match. This place is horrible from the waitresses being snappy and rude to getting my food 2 1/2 hours later. I do not really understand how I place my order right when I get there and wait 45 minutes to ask the waitress where my food is. After waiting another 30 minutes I get my food. its cold & crappy. A waste of 12 dollars. I then send it back and wait once again for my food. And when I receive it, it is not any better. I do not recommend this place if you care about service or food.
author: Hayley G.

description: This place reminds me of a mini Dave & Busters. It is huge upstairs, but we didn't really feel like playing any games. I came for a gaming event HH. The vibe had no music. The one good thing was that drinks were $5.50 each which is cheap by SF standards (why give $0.50 change back?).
author: Jeanne C.

description: Speaking just on large groups for space rental, this place is great for a casual dinner or get together. I reserved one pool table space and just ordered a bunch of food. It was a good time all around. Don't expect to be amazed by the food, because that's not really what you go there for. It's good bar food, but the ambiance they created is what makes it great. My only suggestion is to have one server for 2 sections. When we went, they were short on staff and we didn't get a lot of attention.
author: Theresa F.

description: Two stars for the impressive beer menu. That's where it ends. Originally sat at a table and soon realized that nobody was going to bother to come over and take our orders. Found a waitress near the bar and she said that she couldn't be bothered because she was busy and to try to get drinks from the bar.  Took about 10 minutes to get a beer at the bar.  Super douchey NY bartender with the neck tattoo needs to find a new job since he hates customers so much.
author: Jerry P.

description: nice setup. weird location. WORST service ever!!! The manager in particular sucks
author: Amit S.

description: this place is awesome!!! It's a great place to watch sports and play games.they have a big screen in the middle, and a lots of  tvs all around, a large selection of beer.one of my favorites places to hang out with friends and have a drink :)
author: Ana A.

description: Nice looking, good games and spin the beer wheel.  However, 2 *major* downsides.  Very overpriced and closes way too early.  I was shocked and annoyed when last call was announced at 11:45p.
author: J E.

description: Love the beer selection.  Could spend all day here.  Service was overall very good.  It does have typical bar food, but goes well with the beer.  Will be back for sure.  Great TV's and of the games.  Skee all, pool tables, foosball, and more.
author: Jennifer P.

description: I came by here after work to watch some of the football games. It really is a cool place with a lot of TVs. And also everything was priced well. Unlike the previous reviews I received great service. I think our waitress name was Stephanie. She was very friendly and came by to check on us several times. She was very helpful.Because of the outstanding customer service I received from Stephanie I will definitely be coming back to this place!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jeff P.

description: Great spot! Awesome games. Tons of HD TVs and over 100 beers to choose from. The staff is knowledgable, friendly and will make sure you can watch whatever game you're looking for.
author: Ryan T.

description: Went to the tap room with friends yesterday to grab a beer and lunch. We're sat immediately in a nice booth. Once seated we waited 10 minutes for someone to even recognize us. Then it all went down hill. Andre was our waiter and was rude right off the bat. He took my order and then screamed next expecting another person to speak up. He never made eye contact and he was rushing us. I asked for a sperate check at the beginning of the meal since I had to leave early and he just said flat out no. I work in a restaurant and find it easier to be notified at the beginning of the meal. Our food came, wasn't bad but half the table was done eating by the time the other food came. Tables around us with families received much better service and got their food before us even though we sat down first. Andre made an assumption that we wouldn't tip well and didn't give us the time of day. Great atmosphere and location. Horrible wait staff. Potential is there but attitudes need to change. Nothing at this place was great enough to bring me back.
author: Madeline M.
